1111111.content:
Okay, good news, we're finally at the story part of the story!

~~~

Your name is [...], and you're a huge Digimon fan. You played the card game when you were little older than six years old, you watched the amazing things some of the world's most famous tamers had done, and when you were old enough you even got hired to take pictures of Tamers and their Digimon for a magazine. Whether the column you got hired to is a temporary thing - a fad to be thrown away with next year's garbage - or a permanent position worries you sometimes, but you don't really care. You got your dream job, which lets you hang around just to photograph these amazing creatures. Somehow, the beauty of nature just can't compare to the beauty of what man created in the Digital World.

Today has been a rather slow day, unfortunately. There have been no sightings of wild Digimon, nor have their been any particularly exciting events going on between Tamers and their Digimon, like the Tournament you were overjoyed to report on last week. You've come to the park to take pictures of the Tamers who work with their Digimon there on off days like today because, well, the only other Digimon related thing in the entire city at the moment happens to be the kids in the playground on the other side of the park playing their Digimon Card Game. Not exactly the most exciting thing to report news on, but then again what you're doing now isn't really invigorating either.

As you snap a picture of what looks like a young boy and a Gabumon practicing their attacks on a statue made flame-proof just for the digimon's target practice, you noticed something out of the corner of your camera lens. You thought there was something in the tree. Perhaps it was just your imagination, but it looked like a branch moved, enough for you to know it wasn't wind. You moved the camera to look at the branch, and you tried to see if there really was something there.

What do you see?
1111111.title: Renamon [Rika's Digimon; Season Three]

choices: "... I would love to show you around the city."
"...I really have to get back to work."
11111111.content:
You DO see something in the tree! In fact, the moment you get your camera focused on where you thought the movement had come from, you see a second movement, a small blurred color mix of white and something else, and then nothing. Whatever it was just moved before you could see it. But you saw that as it disappeared, another tree jerked a bit. You focused on that one, and the movement pattern repeated itself as whatever caused the movement tried to avoid your camera lens. This repeated itself all the way through the park, until you realized what the movement was doing now - it was heading towards you.

You took the camera off from your face to get a better look - and wonder if you should start running the hell away - when a big golden blur shot out from the tree and landed on you, causing you to fall backwards. You landed, hard I might add, on your back, with the figure on top of you, feet driving into your stomach. Thank god you'd at least been to the gym twice in the last month or you would be in some serious pain in the gut area right about now. More important than that, though, was figuring out why the figure that you now identified as a golden fox was crouching on top of you in the first place.

"...Why do you photograph us, human?" The Digimon said, slightly puzzled and cocking its head to one side ever so slightly.

This sentence confused you quite a bit. You had been out here to photograph and make notes of the trainers quite a few times before, but you had never even had a Digimon bat an eye at you before. They were all used to getting noticed by humans, particularly the ones that were excessively large or noticeable in a crowd. And now that you thought about it, you really couldn't remember having seen a Digimon like this one ever, even in other parts of the city.

Not knowing what else to do, you decided to answer her question before she wondered why you were so silent. "Well, I'm a reporter. I do a magazine column called 'The Digital Plane and Simple', so I come out here to take pictures of the Digimon and their tamers." You made a mental note to change the name of the column later if your superiors would let it go. Obviously they didn't think making a play on the 'Digital Plane' was as bad of an idea as you knew it was.

"A reporter? That's good." The Digimon said, smiling slightly as she stepped off your abdomen, giving you a much needed relief from the surprising weight of the Digimon.

"Good? What's so good about that?" You said, wondering why she hadn't thought of you being a reporter earlier. Camera, and all that stuff after all. But more odd was why she was so happy to see a reporter.

"Well, I'm new to this world. I wandered through a portal and found myself in your 'Real World' by mistake. I don't think its so bad, though, and you humans are rather interesting, so rather than going back I was hoping someone could show me around this city. I want to at least spend some time in human civilization before I go back - your society intrigues me." The Digimon said, standing there as you continued to lay on the ground. Obviously the society had yet to teach her the human manners to at least offer a hand up to the person you just tackled hard enough to break bricks.

You forced yourself up off the ground anyway, noting a spot on your chest that was mildly numb and was sure to be one hell of a bruise by tomorrow. "Well, uh..."

What do you say?
11111111.title: You see a second movement in the tree!

111111111.content:
"...I would love to show you around the city. Truth be told, I'm not getting much done around here anyway. You didn't exactly come at the most exciting time you see, hasn't been a major even since last week's Digimon Tamer Tournament." He said, leaning up against the tree the Digimon had leaped out of earlier when it tackled him.

"I see. Well, I suppose that's for the best. Tamers and their Digimon tend to pick fights when they see Digimon like me wandering around without a Tamer." The golden fox said, sighing a little bit. Obviously she had had experience with the Tamers before. Not hard to believe - many Tamers were under the impression that any wild Digimon that showed up were inherently evil, and if they weren't causing trouble they were thinking about new ways to cause it.

"Yeah, I see what you mean, Miss... actually, I don't know your name." You said, a little embarrassed. Even though you were a very, very new Digimon Photographer, to have come into contact with a Digimon you hadn't heard of before was a little disappointing. You had considered yourself a minor expert, to say the least.

"My name is Renamon." Renamon said, bowing her head slightly as a gesture.

"And my name's [...]. Glad to meet you, Renamon."

"It is my pleasure to meet you, as well."

"Well, around city there's a lot of buildings, but you'd be surprised how many of them are just big corporations. Most of them don't even have anything to do with Digimon, despite the fact that this is probably the biggest destination for Tamers on the entire East Coast of America. Probably the two biggest places to visit that actually have to do with Digimon would be... the Arena, on the Eastern end of town. That's where all the big tournaments are held, and they even have smaller sparring rings for individual fights that don't attract big crowds. That's a big destination, that and the entire Northwest corner of town. That's the area of town that is the unofficial 'Digimon Square'. Most of the Tamers that actually live in the city have apartments over there, and there's even a few stores run entirely by Tamers and their partners."

"I see. Well, I think we should start..."

Where does Renamon want to visit?

1111111111.content:
"...at this Digimon Square you speak of. It sounds like there might even be more of my kind around here."

Shrugging, you turned and started heading towards the Northwestern section of town. "Maybe, but let's hope not. Wild Digimon like you aren't usually so... well, tame." You looked at her to see if she took offense to anything in that sentence, and thankfully she remained passive. "In fact, usually as soon as one shows up the Tamers are all over them. Its actually kind of weird that you managed to get past all the security screens that they put up between our world and the Digital one without even causing a minor alarm.

"Well, I always was good at being unnoticed."

You rubbed the back of your head at that. "Yeah... don't remind me."

You both walked together in a (mostly) comfortable silence for a few more minutes, until eventually you wound up in a bustling square. Tamers and Digimon were everywhere, here a Gabumon and its trainer eating cotton candy and over there what looked like a Patamon playing in a small playground with its Tamer. The entire square was bustling with life and activity. Fortunately, with you at her side - and with the general abundance of Digimon - nobody questioned the identity of the new golden fox Digimon appearing.

"Well, this is the square. Its where most of the Tamers who don't fight with their Digimon spend their free time, and anyone who is on a break from the Arena is too. But right now they're holding an unofficial group training session, so there aren't as many Combat Tamers as there are people who just enjoy hanging around with their Digital partners. Its actually a pretty upbeat, happy place most of the time."

Your Digimon companion lets a smile come to her face. "I can see that. Someone could really get used to spending their time in a place like this, with all these happy people around." Renamon said. You smiled back at her, happy to see that she was quickly adapting to the new world. And you had to admit, even though you were used to it it was still a pretty nice sight seeing all these people gathered together to do nothing more than have a little fun.
1111111111.title: "...at the Digimon Square."

11111111111.content:
"Yeah, it is nice. So, probably the biggest destination of this whole place is over there." You said, nodding to a place across the street. In it, a man and a woman were handing out plastic packages to children and teenagers closer to your age. They were all looking very happy, the people in the little store because they were earning money and everyone else simply because they were happy to be getting their package.

"What is that place?" Renamon said, obviously confused by the children and the shop.

"Well, since this is your first trip to... our world," You said, still very uncomfortable about referring to the human world and the Real World just because Digimon were - obviously - real. "I guess you wouldn't know about those. Those packets all have cards in them, and that's why its the most popular destination in Digimon Square. Whether you're a tamer looking for a new boost in power, or you're just a little kid who loves to play the game, its the best place to take your money." You said, glazing your eyes across the rest of the square and looking for something else important to name.

"There's also the Digi-Daycare, where a lot of Tamers can drop off any Digimon they have if they need to go somewhere where Digimon aren't allowed. It's a pretty nice place, but it isn't very used even during busy hours, because most Digimon are capable of taking care of themselves. Only Tamers with baby Digimon or who are overly protective usually use it, so right now for example it's probably about empty."

"Hmph. Being coddled won't help them become any stronger. If they're going to learn to live on their own, they need to start now." Renamon said, a bit coldly. You had to agree a bit, sometimes, just because of how ridiculous the concept of a daycare center for beings who could quite easily destroy a human in a fair fight was, but it still struck you as a bit heartless.

"Yeah, well... aside from that, there are quite a few stores around here who offer discounts to Tamers and their Digimon, as a service to all the good people who help keep this city safe if an evil, wild Digimon should ever invade the city. And beyond that, there are-"

Before you could even finish your sentence, something strange happened. The entire city seemed to vibrate, and your ears were set on fire as a huge booming sound came through the air. Renamon put her hands to her ears at it, probably in even more pain than you because of her sensitive ears. And as soon as that booming sound disappeared an even worse sound came through, this one more like the sound of nails on a chalkboard, but quieter. The reason it was terrible wasn't because of the sound, but because of what it meant. You had enough experience to know exactly what was happening - a Digimon from the Digital World was breaking through the security fields between the two worlds, and it was doing so forcefully.

The first voice began to be raised as a great, red tear broke through the fabric of the world above in the sky. "DIGIMON ATTACK!"
11111111111.title: The Tour of the Square Continues

111111111111.content:
"What?! Now?!" You yelled, as the tear widened and a huge claw broke through the rip. This... was definitely not good timing.

"We need to get out of here, now!" You yelled at Renamon over the sound of the hole being widened as the Digimon on the other side tried to force its way through.

"What? Why? I thought you said that this place was full of Tamers." Renamon said, obviously confused as to why you, and everyone else for that matter, seemed to be acting so crazy.

"It is, but just look around you." You said, gesturing across the park. All around, people were picking up their Digimon and leaving, heading for the hills with all the speed their legs could carry them with. And what was more, you noticed even those with advanced Digimon in their Rookie or Champion states rather than the younger Digimon were running.

"Where are they all going?! Don't they see that there's a Digimon to be battled?" Renamon said, looking around herself with disappointment and maybe a hint of disgust at the people running away.

"All the Tamers who actually fight are over at the Arena today, if I figure right. They probably just fully recovered from the latest Tournament, and they'll be training for the next one already. They'll be here in about ten minutes, but until then we need to get out of the way!"

Another screech broke through the air, and you suddenly realized that the Digimon was on its way in. You recognized it now, it was the head of a Greymon, and it was going to be here in about fifteen seconds. "No."

"What?" You said, looking ahead as the Greymon ripped another length of tear in the sky and fell through a bit more.

"I refuse to run away. If none of these Tamers are brave enough to stand and fight, then I will instead." Renamon said, and then took several steps forward toward where the Greymon would land when it came through.

You had to give a hand to her - even though she probably knew she didn't stand a chance, going up against a Champion Digimon when she not only had no Digivolution of her own but didn't even have a Tamer to give her the advantage - she was still willing to go all the way and stand up to the Digimon. But at the same time, you had to ask... was she nuts?!?

And just what the hell were you supposed to do?!?
111111111111.title: Proceed with the story.

choices: You get stopped on your way there.
1111111111111.content:
You knew you didn't have much of a choice in the matter. Even if you were scared out of your mind, and even if you had barely met this Digimon who seemed almost suicidal in her desire to fight this wild Digimon, you were as concerned for the buildings and people around as she seemed to be, and you knew you weren't going let this girl get herself killed over it if you could help it anyway.

But, of course, first you had to catch up. She was already almost at the tear, and you were still standing around like an idiot.

You started running down the street just as the Greymon tore through what little of a barrier remained between the two worlds and fell through, landing with a huge thump that shook the ground under your feet and cracked the pavement in a huge radius around it. You nearly fell over, but managed to keep moving towards Renamon as she started to unleash attacks on the wild Greymon.

"Diamond Storm!" You heard her yell, and you watched with amazement as a huge array of, what else, diamonds formed in the air and shot at the Greymon. The diamonds didn't even seem to scratch the huge Digimon, though, and the diamonds just bounced off of its huge skull plate. What the attack did manage to do, though, was get the Digimon's attention fully focused on Renamon. Definitely not a good thing.

"Nova Blast!" You heard the Greymon roar as it fired a huge ball of fire at your new friend. She rolled to the side, though, and the attack hit the pavement a few yards behind her, actually melting the road where it hit. You were shocked at the sheer strength of it, but you weren't deterred and you continued on, making your way closer to the Greymon.

As you moved closer, trying not to draw its attention toward yourself by accident, you could see that Renamon had started another wave of diamonds flying at the Greymon, this time going for its chest. The diamonds cut in a bit, but they didn't do much damage. In fact, the only reason you even realized any damage had been done was from the way that Greymon winced as the attack hit him. It was kind of confusing, looking at digital creatures with no blood to tell you when some damage had been done to them.

But as the Greymon winced, you saw it lift its leg. And then, it jumped up off its good leg, then quickly came crashing down, stomping hard on the ground. Unlike before when the Greymon had simply been falling out of the portal, this time it was actually trying to force an earthquake type vibration through the ground, and you could tell the difference. The very street shook and broke in places as you were swept clean off your feet, catching yourself on a traffic sign and knocking it down. Obviously, this was a very poorly maintained street sign for you to be able to break the metal so easily; or maybe the Greymon had just weakened it with the massive shaking.

Looking out, you almost felt your heart stop as you saw what was happening. Renamon had fallen on the ground during the shaking, and from the looks of it Greymon had knocked over a street lamp, which was now laying across Renamon's back. She was pinned to the ground, and even though she could probably get out if it, the fireball growing in Greymon's mouth meant she might not get the chance if you didn't act fast.

Before you even knew what you were doing, you grabbed the sign you had fallen on and ran up to the wild Digimon, letting loose a battle cry as you swung the sign as hard as you could over your head, bringing it down smack on the Greymon's tail. It let out a roar of pain, but you saw that it was still firing its attack as it did so. You yelled out as you saw the blast hit by Renamon, worried for her life. She didn't deserve this. But you saw that the blast had only hit her left arm, burning it and probably breaking the bones with the force of the attack, but at least she would be alive.

Unfortunately for you, the Greymon no longer seemed to care about her. Instead, it was turned toward you, and it looked pissed off. And so did the Nova Blast it had in its mouth building up slowly. "Uh... maybe I didn't think that plan all the way through..." You said, as you stumbled backwards, trying to get away from the digimon. You were just beginning to say your prayers, when suddenly the Greymon's mouth snapped to the side.

You looked around to see what had caused it, and suddenly you saw a blur heading for the Greymon's mouth. It slowed down as it impacted, and you finally recognized it; it was a WereGarurumon, and it was really starting to kick the crap out of the wild Greymon. In fact, before you even knew what had happened the WereGarurumon was standing on top of the Greymon's body as it slowly faded back to the Digital Plane. Obviously, this one didn't feel like screwing around.

Taking advantage of the fact that there was no longer a hostile Digimon in front of you, you ran around the WereGarurumon and knelt down in front of Renamon. She didn't look to be in too bad of shape, but she seemed to have passed out from the pain in her arm and it looked pretty burnt up. You had to get her to the Digimon Hospital, which was rather inconveniently one of the few Digmon-related buildings not located IN Digimon Square. Picking her up in your arms, you began to run off towards the hospital, not bothering to look back at the WereGarurumon or anything else as you kept running.
1111111111111.title: You make a decision.

11111111111111.content:
As you carried Renamon, you realized that she was surprisingly light for how strong she had looked during her battle. In fact, you had to guess that most of her body mass was fur, because there was no way she should weigh this little. But you were getting sidetracked, so much so that you almost ran smack into the boy who stepped into your path.

At first you didn't pay much attention and just tried to step around him, but then his Digimon stepped into play as well, a huge ExVeemon stepping in front of you and blocking off what little of the alley you were in was left.

"Uh, excuse me, but I'm kind of in a hurry."

"We figured. That's what we came to talk to you about."

You didn't know whether the kid meant that they were going to help you get Renamon to a hospital or what, but you could tell this much - you didn't like the tone of voice he had. It sounded... dangerous. That was the best way to describe it.

"We saw that little incident you had back there at the plaza. Terrible stuff... and it makes me wonder, why exactly didn't you use your digivice to help out that partner of yours?"

"Well..." You said, trying to think on your feet. "It's a little embarrassing, but... I left it at home. I'm always forgetting stuff like that."

"You would think that a real Tamer would never leave his home without a digivice, wouldn't you? I mean, it only seems like the smart thing to do."

"Yeah, well, I never really said I was smart..." You said, still trying to edge around them. You didn't like where this conversation was heading, at all.

"Well, let me tell you this. You'd better get smart, real fast. Because if I didn't know any better, I'd say that was a wild Digimon in your arms right there. And you know what we do to wild Digimon, don't you? We send them right the hell back to the digital world, in a million fragments of code. Let me make this clear to you..."

Reaching forward, the kid grabbed ahold of your shirt. You would've loved to sock him right in the face, but your hands were occupied at the moment with a large bundle of yellow fur. "...if I even THINK you're trying to protect a wild Digimon, I'll make sure you never give me reason to think that again."

Without even expecting or waiting for a response, the kid just turned around and walked off, his own partner following him as they vanished around a corner.

"What a jackass..." You said to yourself as soon as you were sure he was out of earshot. Ignoring the events that just occurred, you continued on your way to the nearest digital hospital.
11111111111111.title: You get stopped on your way there.

111111111111111.content:
You closed in on the hospital in what must have been record time. They were already prepared to take in any of the injured - they were excellent about knowing the moment a digimon attack hit the city thanks to the latest scanner technology. Almost the moment you were in the door, the medical staff had picked Renamon out of your arms and taken her off to whatever room they had availible.

You went to a waiting room chair and sat with your head resting on your hands. With little else to do, you found yourself thinking about how they would help her. It seemed odd - the Digimon were data, even in the real world, and that meant that there wasn't any way to heal their bodies. They must have used some kind of... code repair sequence or something. You didn't know. Wow, that was the shortest distraction for your mind ever. And now you were back to worrying.

For thirty minutes - which seemed like an eternity - you sat there, worrying about her. One of the biggest problems with her injuries was that Digimon could only recover all the way if they spent weeks recovering and testing themselves, or by being bonded with a Tamer and using the Digivice's mysterious energies to heal themselves. And with a wild Digimon like Renamon, she was going to be suffering for quite awhile.

But at last, a doctor came out of the room. He wore a special uniform marked with the Digital World insignia on his jacket to signify his position, and to your great relief he didn't look sad or troubled.

"Well, she didn't get too bad of an injury. Even for a Rookie level I don't think she was in any mortal danger, but you did good getting her here so fast. We've put her on a dose of pain medication just to ease the burns, but she should be awake within a half hour or so, and I can release her back to you immediately afterwards. Just link her up with the Digivice and she'll be in fighting form by tomorrow."

You put on your best fake smile and nodded at him, which he returned before walking away. That wasn't going to be good. The doctors were probably used to people coming in for injuries even though the digivice could do most of the work - a lot of Tamers still hated to see their Digimon in pain for any amount of time. On the other hand, if someone you had met today happened to see that she wasn't recovered within a couple days, there were going to be suspicions. And you doubted she wanted to just sit inside until she had fully healed.

Standing up with a sigh, you opened the door to her room and then prepared yourself to do some hellacious damage control.
111111111111111.title: You arrive at the hospital.

"Well, well what do we have here? A new digimon tamer huh interesting."

11121111.content:
(To be clear, my fanfic will be taking place during the 2 1/2 years between the first series and Shippuden.)

Your name is [...]. You are a villager in the Village of the Hidden leaves, working your everyday life as a street sweeper. You've never been overly happy with your life, but since you just recently turned sixteen and were able to move out of your parent's house it was still pretty decent. At least you had a roof over your head that you could call your own and you had a job that left you free to do whatever you want - at least, until the sun went down and you had to start cleaning up the village for the next day's activities. You had actually been the one to suggest the nighttime shift to the people directing all of the people who took care of Konoha's upkeep - for two reasons. Firstly, it would be damn near impossible to keep up with the messes that were created during the day with all the crowds. And secondly... you loved Konoha at night.

Even though all the normal folks were sitting in their homes, resting in their beds while you moved silently through the streets, making sure it was in proper shape for the next day, there were others besides you who were awake at this hour. And these were probably the most important people in the entire village.

Ninjas.

You loved to watch them whenever they were passing through. The way they leaped through the air, so gracefully and yet so deadly, crossing from building to building was amazing to you. And when you had seen them in action - during a day trip to the academy, or when you watched them training with each other - their powers with Chakra were nothing short of incredible. And at night, there were no other distractions for you other than watching them move about, even your bosses never checked in on you to see if you were working because they were too busy sleeping for all their bureaucratic nonsense the next day. So what if the ninja occasionally broke a few shingles by a powerful step or misstep, you didn't care. It gave you more of a reason to climb up on the roofs while you were fixing them and realize just how intimidating the things they did were.

Tonight was an unusual night. The activities of ninja had been unusually quiet - and not the quiet that meant that they were probably moving about, you just didn't hear them. It was... almost too quiet. The sound of your broom sweeping over a spill from earlier that day and gathering up the mess and dust that was starting to build on this rarely used street seemed to intrude on the sounds every moment. Feeling slightly disturbed by the city's silence, you casually placed the broom against the wall and leaned back between two buildings for a moment, allowing yourself a small break before you wrapped up the rest of the night's duties. The silence was giving you a very bad feeling for some reason.

But, even as you thought about the silence, it was shattered. Not by any particular noise, but one simple sound, like fabric on fabric, but you knew better than this. The sound brought a smile to your face - it was the sound of one of the village's many ninja moving through the village. From the sound of it, probably moving across the ground. You had learned quite awhile ago to tell the difference between what sounds their footsteps made, it came with the months you had spent cleaning up the village by night. Turning to the side, you suddenly saw the figure. The blur, black in the dark night, went just slowly enough for you to look at it for several seconds as it passed.

But, as you watched it pass, it did something none of the other dozens of soundless shadows you watched through your nights on the job did. It stopped, and from the look of the black silhouette, it was looking at you. And as it looked at you the moonlight hit it just perfectly, illuminating its eyes...

Its white, blank eyes.

"Hm?" You said, almost unintentionally. The figure seemed to react to this, or perhaps it was just choosing that moment to move, heading back along its way and moving on down the village road. It didn't take you very long to figure out what you had just seen - you had caught a rare glimpse, for you anyway, of the eyes of a Hyuuga. Sadly, which one it was you would probably never know.

Still, the event made the night just that much less ominous and mysterious for you. Whistling softly to yourself - very softly, people were still sleeping after all - you went back to sweeping the floor, hoping to be done at least a few hours before sunrise tonight. You needed a good rest after a night like tonight.

111211111.content:
You were sitting casually in a slightly uncomfortable love seat, sprawled across the thing as though it were nothing more than a large body pillow. Today was an unusually slow day, especially when you compared it to your exciting, if mostly uneventful previous night. Things around the village weren't normal, they were worse than normal .They were downright dull.

You sighed and leaned your head back even farther, trying your hardest to think of something you could do. The Academy was off for a day, half of the ninja in the village were gone, and most of the other half were simply stationed around the village on guard duty, or on a short vacation. All in all, the village itself was bustling with activity... but none of it was even remotely interesting.

But there was one, vaguely possible option for you. You could head out to the Training Grounds, and watch the ninja at work. The grounds were technically off limits to civilians, and since you were off-duty cleaning you fit into that category for now, but plenty of people still cleaned during the day. If you took a broom with you and looked busy, there was a chance you could get away with it. Whatever you were going to do, you had plenty of time to decide, so you went to the refrigerator in your kitchen and poured yourself a cup of coffee.

You cleared your mind as the delicious flavor vaguely tinted with cinnamon hit your tongue, deciding what your next move was to be.
111211111.title: The next day...

1112111111.content:
By the time you managed to arrive at the training grounds, it was almost noon. You had to stop off at your office to pick up most of your supplies - after all, just having a broom would hardly make you look busy - and then you had to circle around the training grounds until you found one that wasn't being used that day. You finally found one near the end of the training grounds, and began "cleaning" it, scraping up some of the leaves off of the ground while you were secretly checking around to see if anything interesting was happening.

At first, you thought you were completely out of luck. You looked into the zones to your north and west, but you didn't see anyone. Whether it was a stealth exercise, or whether you were simply unlucky in the field of watching amazing ninjas at work, you didn't have a clue. But as you peered into the final zone, off to your east, you spotted something. A jacket flapping in the wind, and then beyond that you saw a gathering. You couldn't make too much out of them, but you could see that there were three students standing in front of a taller person, their sensei most likely.

You crept closer to that side of the fence, raking up the early autumn leaves as you did so. You finally got to a place well surrounded by trees, one which you could pretty safely watch the ninja without them really taking notice of you. At least, as long as you stayed still. After all, they wouldn't be looking for you, so it was pretty safe to say that the Genin, at least, would look over you rather than actually spotting you.

As the ninja began to spar with one another, you had a bit of difficulty trying to judge how the fight was going. In fact, you couldn't see enough of the battle to really even tell who the ninja were. But you did see that they were moving fast enough you wouldn't have been able to catch it anyway. You sighed, and leaned back against a tree, fanning yourself with a particularly large leaf you had found. It was hot for the time of year, and even sitting in the shade of all these trees didn't help too much.

But then you heard sounds moving closer, and you peered back to see one of the ninja moving closer. You froze, instantaneously, but it seemed like she was too busy running your way to pay much attention, and you saw why. One of the ninja behind her was chasing her, and she probably was looking for a spot of ground that would be advantageous to her. But, as she moved, you finally were able to make out which Genin she was, and you were amazed. It was Hinata Hyuuga, the heiress to the Hyuuga's... throne? You didn't know what to call it, as little knowledge as you had about the ninja customs of the clans. Either way, you were impressed. And you recognized the boy behind her as none other than Inuzuka Kiba, hot in pursuit. As soon as you looked at him, though, he disappeared, leaping away into the trees.

Hinata turned to look back at where he had been, but even she was unable to locate him. And you could just barely make out the motions she was making with her hands, then. They looked familiar somehow...

And then she turned around, and stared straight at you.

Instantly, you knew what must have happened. She had spotted you with her Byakugan, and must have been so surprised at seeing someone non-ninja in an adjacent training ground that she had turned to you instinctively. Probably not the smartest thing, because as soon as she turned, Kiba leaped behind her and karate chopped her across the neck, knocking her out cold on the ground. You stared in horror, knowing it was really your fault that it had happened - she had been surprised by you, that was the only reason she hadn't easily dodged or blocked that move.

Kiba looked concerned as he stood over her, and you gulped in fear you hadn't realized you had as well. Whether the move was powerful enough that it had really damaged her, or it was simply the fact that she was totally off-guard, something about the move Kiba did was more damaging than he had thought it would be.

Feeling terribly guilty about what just happened, you sighed and decided to return to your home. You had caused enough trouble today, no need to make it worse.
1112111111.title: You head for the training grounds, and hope the...

11121111111.content:
As much as you would have loved to claim that you were completely capable of sealing off your emotions like the ninjas you loved to watch, guilt is a powerful emotion. You spent the rest of the day thinking about what you had just gone through, and although you realized that it wasn't totally your fault, that didn't change anything. By the time that the clock finally reached six p.m. on your wall it felt like you had been there for an eternity.

Probably the biggest motivator for this guilt was some depressing news, indeed. Hinata had wound up in the hospital after her injury. It was nothing serious that would even leave a mark for too long, but because she had been totally off guard it had given her enough damage that she was sent there to ensure no complications developed while she recovered. Although it was probably just her father being overly protective for no real reason, you still felt horrible about it.

So, with only about three more eternities of waiting until it was bed time, you decided to do the only thing you could think of. You confronted your guilt head on, which had brought you right to the spot where you were now standing... directly in front of Konoha Hospital, just waiting for the courage you were seeking to bubble up out of the ground.

"Well... screw it all, I'm dead meat anyway." You said, sighing as you walked into the hospital. You knew visiting hours were over in about half an hour anyway, so there really was no time like the present.

As you opened the doors, you welcomed the blast of air coming in from the hospital - it was definitely much nicer than the cool autumn air you had been standing in until just then. Your sight immediately showed you something more impressive than a heater, though, and that was the two people exiting the hospital almost at the same time you were entering. You didn't remember their names, but there was no mistaking their looks - it was Hinata's father and sister. You tried for a second to think of their names, but nothing came to you.

With nothing better to do, and very glad you hadn't come in earlier while they would've still been in the room visiting Hinata, you casually walked over to the desk.

"Excuse me, miss," you said to the nurse behind the counter, "where can I find Hinata Hyuuga's room?"

The nurse smiled at you and immediately cited it off. "Room 124, down the hall, second on your left." Obviously she remembered it from telling Hinata's family where she was because she didn't even take a half a minute to remember the number.

You thanked her and then proceeded to walk down the hallway, only entering the door on the left after about ten seconds of standing there, wondering exactly what the hell you were getting yourself in to. With one final sigh of resolve, you pushed open the door and walked into the room, looking at the single bed to see what Hinata was doing.
11121111111.title: Later that day...

111211111111.content:
You entered the room with an apology halfway off your lips, but as you did so you saw something even more shocking and horrifying to you than seeing Hinata get injured in the first place. Hinata was sitting on her bed, crying with her arms crossed in front of her. She must have thought she was alone, because the moment she saw you she tried to turn and hide her face away from you. Whoever had caused her this much pain... you promised yourself you would make them pay.

But then she seemed to realize who you were, because she stopped crying and wiped her eyes, trying to take a closer look at you. "I... I know you. You're the boy who was in the Training Grounds."

"Here it comes..." You thought to yourself. The yelling, the hating, the most likely pummeling, any of these were going to hurt you either mentally or physically. "Look, I'm really sorry about that, I was out there to clean, and I just..."

"I-I-It's okay. It was my fault. I shouldn't have been so easily distracted." Hinata sniffed and stopped her sentence there, though she looked like she had more she wanted to say. But you weren't focusing on that, you were focusing on the fact that she seemed to think it was HER fault? What was up with that?

"What? No, it was totally my fault! I shouldn't have even gone out there to clean, it was a stupid idea." You neglected to mention the facts that not only were you not actually cleaning but you also weren't even supposed to be on duty that day. Or ever... nobody really cleaned the training grounds. Unless they wanted to punish a new guy by making him work alone all day in an empty lot, they left them alone; ninja couldn't really dirty the place up.

"N...no, I shouldn't have been so easily distracted. I'm... I'm a bad ninja." You could almost see the tears coming out again as she said that, but she fought them back. And you thought you now had an idea about why she was crying only seconds after her family left the room.

"Look, um, if you ever need anything, I can't really make up for this, but, uh, I'd be glad to help. I mean, you probably wouldn't need anything from someone like me, but if you did I'd be willing to help..." You tried to stop your tongue from tripping over itself, but somehow it didn't work that way. You could barely put a coherent sentence together for some reason.

"Thanks, that means a lot to me." She smiled at you, but you could tell that she was almost as uncomfortable with the situation as you were. Visiting time was almost up, anyway, so that gave you a bit of an excuse.

In fact, even as you thought that another woman came into the room. "Sorry sir, but visiting hours are now over. I'm going to have to take him away, sweetie."

Hinata and you both looked relieved - although somehow neither of you actually noticed it on the other's face - and you gave her one last 'goodbye' before heading off with the nurse. Your walk out of the hospital was plagued by thoughts of the accident still, but this time instead of them being guilty memories they were simply confusing. How could any of that incident have made her feel bad about herself? Maybe she tried to hold herself to a higher standard or something, but you were the one in the wrong, why should she be punished by her family? Or be punishing herself so much?

You sighed, and slowly walked out of Konoha Hospital's doors. You didn't know the answers to any of these questions, and you probably never would. Either way, it was time for you to get out of there and go about your life.
111211111111.title: Hinata was... crying?

1112111111111.content:
Two days had passed since your encounter with Hinata. You were still confused as hell about the whole thing, but at least you were a little better off as to knowing why she acted the way she did. With some careful asking around the town, you had found out that she had always been naturally shy, but despite that her father put all the responsibilities of a Hyuuga clan leader on her. And when she couldn't live up to the full expectations of her father, well, that didn't make things any better for her position or her shy personality.

You were really mad about that, but unfortunately there wasn't actually much you could do about it. The matters of the Konoha Clans were hardly open for meddling by the public, and Hinata herself would probably not thank you for the interference.

You had just wrapped up your afternoon cleaning and put away all your materials when you heard a knocking sound at the door. It was a strange knock, though, it sounded like it came from down low, and it was louder than usual. Sitting up, you raised an eyebrow at the door as though you expected it to answer your unspoken query, and then got off of the couch and walked to the door.

But to your further puzzlement, nobody was there. However, you did see a piece of paper sitting on the step, with a small rock on top of it holding down the paper.

Opening the door and grabbing the paper, you held it under the sunlight and then looked at the writing on it. It was a letter written to you, in rather informal handwriting.

"You said you would help me if I needed it, so please come by the training grounds we met at in half an hour."

You didn't understand what she would want your help for, but it was easy enough to figure out that this might be your only chance to help her out more. And you also knew the training grounds were a good half hour away if you were just walking there, so you needed to leave right away.

Way more questions raised than answered by the letter, you set out immediately towards the training grounds.

111322211.content:
You sat in a reclining position on a park bench near a fountain, staring at the clear blue sky as a few clouds passed by. Man, this day was so boring, not to mention how boringly average your life was. You craved adventure, and besides, it`s not like anyone would really miss you if you left. Just then, you turned your head to the side and saw a person in a trench coat drop a brown paper bag on the ground near the fountain and continue walking. You jumped up to return the bag. "Hey, sir you dropped your-" you began trying to get the person`s attention, but somehow they disappeared. "What the hell? Weird..."

Then you looked back at the bag. For some strange reason, you felt compelled to open the bag. "I know I shouldn`t, but maybe I`ll just take a peek..." You crouched down and picked up the bag, and it felt pretty heavy. Opening the bag, you found what looked like a purple apple with a swirling pattern all over it. "What the hell? Is this a Devil Fruit? No, it couldn`t be. I mean, Devil Fruits don`t exist, and this is probably just a prop for a L.A.R.P.`er... (Live Action Role-Play `er) But it feels so real, and this doesn`t feel or smell like it`s been painted or made by hand. Maybe..." You decided to take a bite of it, just to see if it was real. Worse comes to worse, you hurt your teeth a bit. You open your mouth wide and surprisingly take a bite out of it, and swallowed it, but it really tasted horrible. "Ugh! That tasted bad enough to be a Devil Fruit. But I don`t really feel any different..."

Just then a strong wind literally knocked you off your feet and sent you tumbling into the fountain. You instantly lost all your strength and began sinking, but somehow you didn`t hit the bottom. "This fountain shouldn`t be that deep!" you said in your mind. "And why can`t I move?! Oh crap... my lungs..." you exhaled the last of your breath and took in water, your mind slowly beginning to black out. "Crap... I`m gonna drown..." was the last thing that crossed your mind as your eyes closed and your mind went silent.

You awoke with a start, and began coughing the remaining water out of your lungs, and you realized your clothes had been changed into a simple brown shirt and black pants, and you were laying in a bed somewhere that looked somewhat familiar. You noticed your original clothes were sitting folded on a chair next to the bed. "Where the heck am I? The last thing I remember is drowning in the park fountain after eating that disgusting apple." Just as you got out of your bed, a woman in a nun`s outfit came in with a bucket and what appeared to be some towels.

"Oh, you`re up!" she said in a mix of shock and joy. She then ran out of the room saying "Igarappoi, our guest is up!"

"Igarappoi?!" you said in shock as she closed the door. "Then... I`m in..." You stopped yourself as the door opened and a large man with curly blond hair that looked like a judge`s powdered wig came into the room, dressed in moderately formal clothes.

"Oh, I`m glad to see you`re doing well, ehem, Ma~ Ma~ Ma~" the man said while clearing his throat a bit. "You washed up on our shores a few days ago and have been unconscious since. You`re lucky one of our resident`s found you or you might not have survived."

"Oh, uh, right," you said scratching the back of your head with your hand. "Where`s the person who saved me? I would like to thank them."

"She went on a hunt to get some food for our village a few hours ago," Igrappoi replied clearing his throat again. "Ma~ Ma~ Ma~"

You know One Piece pretty well, and you know Luffy and the Straw Hats should be here in a few days. And since I sank in the fountain, I did gain a Devil Fruit power. I just don`t know what it is yet. So I need to find out what kind of power I have, and I need to make sure I`m not labeled as a member of Baroque works, cause I don`t need Zoro cutting me open like a can of tuna. Alright, so first priority after I eat is heading out to the town outskirts and trying out my powers. But maybe I should give Igarappoi a bit of a heads-up that I know who he really is."

Then the door opened and a cute black-haired girl in a skirt and tube top came in with a plate of food and a glass of juice on a tray. "Feeling better already I see."

"Not as good as I will on a full stomach," you said joking a bit and you gratefully took the tray and began wolfing down your food.

"I should really test out what powers I have," you said as you stood back up from sitting on your bed and walked out the door. You passed by a few people and said "Hello", but deep down, you felt uneasy about knowing they were all bounty hunters working for Baroque Works.

"Ah, you`re up and about I see," Igarappoi said to you, drawing your attention. "How do you like our quaint village?"

"It`s nice," you said smiling at Igarappoi. "But I`m heading to the outskirts for some combat practice."

"Combat practice?" Igarappoi asked. "You can fight?"

"Let`s just say I can, but I don`t know how," you said to Igarappoi, confusing him a bit. "Maybe I can kill two birds with one stone," you said in your mind.

"I uh, Ma~ Ma~ Ma~ don`t quite understand what you mean," Igarappoi said.

"Follow me, and you`ll find out faster than you can say 'Baroque'," you said a bit quietly to Igarappoi, causing his eyes to shoot open a bit wider and stare at you. "Come if you want to find out." You walked away from Igarappoi with your hands in your pockets.

-Later, at the outskirts of town-

You found yourself standing in front of the Cactus Mountains, stretching your body a bit to warm up. You can feel the power of the Devil fruit coursing through your veins. "I can`t wait to see what kind of power I got."

"What did you mean?" you hear a familiar voice ask you. You turned around to see Igarappoi with an attractive looking girl with long blue hair tied back in a ponytail. "What did you mean when you said 'Baroque'?"

"I was referring to the style of art, but I guess it has a dual meaning for those following Baroque Works, right, Mr. 8, Miss Wednesday?" you said with a small smirk on your face.

"How do you know that name?" the blue-haired girl asked as she pulled out a bottle of what looked like perfume.

"Let`s just say you two aren`t the only ones with information," I said getting into a defensive stance. "And as you may know, I don`t exactly know how to fight at the moment."

"Then this will be easy," Miss Wednesday said as she sprayed the perfume, opened her button shirt, and began shaking her body from side to side. "Miwaku no Memaii Dance!!"

You dropped to the ground to stay low so the perfume wouldn`t affect you, and a strange feeling came from beneath your hand as it lay flat on the ground. You somehow knew what to do, and you willed the ground to rise from under your hand as you stood back up. The spot you had touched glowed as a weapon handle came out of the ground, shocking Mr. 8 and Miss Wednesday, who had stopped belly dancing out of shock. The handle continued to rise as it met your outstretched hand, and the back of the handle met your palm. You then grabbed it and pulled the rest of the weapon out of the ground, revealing the weapon as a black metal staff. "Looks like I got a good Devil Fruit," you said holding the staff in a fighting stance.

"You`re a Devil Fruit user?!" Mr. 8 said in shock. "Fine, then it looks like we`ll have to eliminate you for knowing about Baroque Works and add another tombstone to the Cactus Mountains."

"Now, now Igaram, I think Princess Vivi and you would rather talk things out with someone with information," you said, again shocking Igaram and Vivi.

"How... how did you know who we were?" Vivi said looking at you in disbelief.

"Like I said, I`m a man with information," you said calmly. "Look, I`m not here to kill you, or extort you for money."

"Then why are you here?" Igaram asked. "It seems a bit suspicious that you know who we are and are asking for nothing."

"I`m not asking for nothing," you said. "I`m asking if I could help protect Princess Vivi. I know the kind of trouble Alabasta`s in, and I want to help in any way I can."

"What do you think Igaram?" Vivi asked.

"I`ll think about it," Igaram responded. "I`ll give you my answer after we deal with the pirates who recently arrived."

"Alright, then I`ll be out here practicing," you replied. And with that, Igaram and Vivi left you alone to practice as they resumed their disguises as Mr. 8 and Miss Wednesday. "I`ve got till midnight to at least get a good understanding of my power. The power of the Busou Busou no Mi..."
11132221111.title: You decided to head out to test your new powers.

111322211111.content:
~~A few hours later~~

The sun had set and it was clearly dark out. The full moon and stars were shining brightly that night, giving you a clear enough view of your surroundings. You were taking a break after all the practice you did with your Devil Fruit when you heard a multitude of gunshots go off. "Looks like it`s party time," you said as you slapped your palm on the ground. The familiar light of transformation appeared under your hand as a copy of the Medajalibur from Kamen Rider OOO rose from the ground and you clutched in in your hand, running back into town.

"Okay, quick run-down of what I can do," you said to yourself as you ran. "I can make any weapon that comes to mind, and it retains the qualities of the object I made it from, and the more of something I use to make a weapon, the better and stronger it is. I can`t substitute elements though, so I can`t make bullets without an explosive, or a bow without something for a bowstring. When I tried making a sword from the air, it was harder to do and required more concentration to form the weapon, even though it was very light and cut like nothing was there. So elemental transformation is more costly, but more effective. And from what I can muster, any inanimate object I make into a weapon will stay a weapon until I will it to do otherwise, but I think I can only have about 5-6 weapons active at once, cause I tried to make six swords, and my staff disappeared. Still, I should probably lift a few weapons from the bounty hunters around here. Not like they`ll need them after Zoro`s done with `em."

"Hey, that kid from earlier is coming to kill us!" one of the Baroque Works agents said drawing their attention to you. "Shoot him!" They all shot their guns at you simultaneously, and on instinct, you jumped above them. However, it was much higher than you would have jumped back home. A few tests earlier showed your physical strength, speed, agility, etc had somehow been multiplied!

"Not bad," you said landing in the middle of the crowd. "But not good enough!" You spun around in a circle, blade extended, and took out the small group of Agents that tried to shoot you. They all dropped to the ground and you picked up a few guns and had an idea. "Maybe if I can make weapons out of elements, maybe I can combine weapons too." You grabbed about six of their flintlock pistols and a good ten dozen bullets the Agents didn`t need anymore and focused on them. Your light surrounded the guns and bullets and when the light faded, a pair of modern Magnum pistols were in their place. "Nice, now I`m a bit more balanced." You also grabbed a few of their swords and made a tough drop-shaped shield with a blade on the pointed end of it. You then grabbed a two holsters and slipped your guns into them, and ran off. "Thanks for the upgrade guys!" Just then, you saw a very large explosion to the right of you. "Crap! Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine`s Day!"

You arrived just in time to see Mr. 9 get blown up by one of Mr. 5`s boogers. "Gross, but that could make good ammo," you said to yourself. You watched as Vivi, sans her hairband, just stood there in shock on Carue. "Why isn`t she moving?! She could get killed!"

Mr. 5 just picked his nose again and rolled up a second shot. "Looks like she wants to die. I`ll be glad to oblige." He lifted his arm and pointed it at Vivi ready to fire.

"Damnit!!" You yelled as you jumped in front of Vivi just as the shot was fired. You quickly lifted your shield in between you as the booger, and the booger exploded on impact with your shield. "You know, you keep picking your nose like that, and you`ll get a nosebleed." you said as the smoke cleared, revealing you unharmed from behind your scuffed shield.

"What?!" Mr. 5 said a bit shocked at your appearance.

"It`s you!" Vivi said a bit astounded and relived on your appearance. "What`re you doing here?"

"I told you I wanted to protect you and I meant it, Princess," you said still looking at the pair of Baroque Works agents. "I`ll give you some time, so move it!"

"But you`ll..." she said sounding concerned for you.

"I said move!!" you yelled to her, still not looking. "I`m a nobody and you`re a princess of a kingdom in turmoil! If I die, no one cares, but you have to survive! Now go!"

"R-right..." Vivi said as she and Carue high-tailed it out of there.

"You must be pretty brave to want to fight us," Mr. 5 said calmly.

"Yeah, that or pretty stupid!" Miss Valentine`s day replied. "Kyahahahaha!"

"Well, a stupid guy wouldn`t know the identity of Mr. 0, now would he?" you asked trying to get them to focus on you.

"Then we`ll have to eliminate you," Mr. 5 said as he picked his nose again. "Can`t have a nobody trying to spill our secrets."

"Good luck trying," you said. "Cause I already know how your Devil Fruit powers work."
111322211111.title: Later that night...

1113222111111.content:
"Oh, do you now?" Mr. 5 said as he aimed at you again. "Nez-palm Cannon!" You ran at the shot, blocking it with your shield.

"I thought you`d learn after that!" you yelled as you swung your sword at Mr. 5. He stomped on the ground and made an explosion that knocked you back from the force, and sent Miss Valentine sky high, leaving her floating in the air from her umbrella.

"Kyahahahaha! We aren`t the novice grunts that work here!" Miss Valentine said from above you. Then she dropped very quickly on top of you, trying to crush you with her now increased mass. You jumped back just in time to dodge Miss Valentine, but you got hit by Mr. 5`s booger, sending you flying back through a building or two and covering you in rubble.

A good while later, you managed to pull yourself out of the rubble with your sword and shield, and Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine were nowhere to be found. "Damnit! They got away!? An explosion went off a few blocks away, signaling where Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine`s Day were. "Looks like I`m about to play Track Runner. I hope this works..." You slipped the shield and sword onto your back like Link from the Legend of Zelda, and placed your hands on your hips, over the holsters where your Magnums were sitting and they began to glow. The light moved from your holsters down to your feet, and when the light faded, you were now wearing a pair of metal-lined boots with the pistol chamber and clips hanging out the back. "Time for a test run..." You moved into a sprint starting position and then a small clicking noise was heard. "Magnum Step!" you yelled as your hands left the ground and you took the first step. As soon as your foot hit the ground, a bullet shot off, increasing the lift you got off the ground from your step, and shooting you across the area and onto a rooftop. "Better than I hoped!" You said as you landed on the roof and sped across the rooftops to catch up to Vivi, each step using up a bullet. "Please let me make it in time..."

You made it just close enough to see Miss Monday get crushed by Miss Valentine, and get off her."Kyahahaha," Ms. Valentine cackled as she stood up . "Do you really still think you can escape from us?"

"You don't have a chance of getting out of here in one piece," said Mr. 5.

Princess Vivi bit her lip in frustration, probably because of the sacrifices her friends Mr. 9 and Miss Monday had made. "I will survive, I will escape!" she vowed. "I will make it back home to Alabasta Kingdom."

"Eh-hah," Mr. 5 chuckled as he stuck his finger up his nose and pulled out another piece of nose gold, aiming it at Vivi. "TAKE THIS! NEZ-PALM… CANNON!" Mr. 5 flicked the booger at Vivi who stood there in shock not knowing what to do.

You used both barrels of your boots at the same time, sending you flying in front of Vivi as you pulled out your shield in mid-flight. You saw Zoro get in front of Vivi and you got in front of him, blocking the explosion with your shield.

"You survived?!" Mr. 5 said in shock.

"I don`t have time for this!" Vivi yelled at Zoro as she lunged to attack him. "Don`t you ever give up!"

"Vivi, hold it!" you yelled, pausing her attack. "He just tried to defend you!"

"Thanks for the cover," Zoro said as he looked at you and then to Vivi. "And I`m under orders to rescue you."

"Rescue?" Vivi asked.

"Then get with the rescuing and get her out of here!" you yelled.

"So you're the swordsman who beat up all the lowly employees who were stationed out here," Ms. Valentine realized.

"Why would you want to protect the Princess of Alabasta?" Mr. 5 inquired.

"I'm under orders," Zoro admitted completely honest.

"Good reason," Mr. 5 remarked, "but one way or another, we're gonna have to eliminate you because you're in in the way of our orders You too, shield boy."

"Kyahaha!" Ms. Valentine laughed, "Aw, what a shame!"

"Eh-hah," Mr. 5 chuckled as he once again stuck his finger up his nose.

"You know, this is getting tiresome," you said as you sheathed your sword and shield again. "I`m just gonna shoot you two."

"Kyahahaha! With what?" Miss Valentine asked. as your hands moved to your sides.

Your boots glowed with light again and your Magnums re-formed in your hands, shocking everyone but Vivi. "With these puppies."

"You`re a Devil Fruit user!" Miss Valentine realized.

"Thank you Captain Obvious," you said as your grip tightened on the triggers.

"I FOUND YOU!" came a loud shout. We all turned to see Luffy in his straw hat and with a very plump, ball-like torso. Zoro grinned at the sight of his captain. "ZOOOROOO!"

"What is it now?" Ms. Valentine wondered.

"Luffy!" Zoro called out. "Thanks for coming, but I've got this one. Or did those greedy jerks drag you into this too?" Zoro got a better look at Luffy and realized that he was seething with anger.

"YOU ARE GONNA PAY FOR WHAT YOU DID!" Luffy hollered at Zoro. "I'LL KILL YOU!"

"WHAT?" Zoro exclaimed, obviously clueless about what Luffy was angry about. "WHAT KIND OF NONSENSE HAVE YOU GOTTEN INTO YOUR HEAD THIS TIME?"

"SHUT UP AND GET READY!" Luffy snapped. "I'M GONNA KICK YOUR UNGRATEFUL LITTLE ASS!"

"Ungrateful?" Zoro repeated.

"Everyone here was nothing but nice to us!" Luffy yelled. "They welcomed us and threw us a party! THEY GAVE US FOOD! AND YOU REPAID THEM BY CUTTING THEM ALL UP WITH THOSE SWORDS OF YOURS!"

"Well… yeah…" Zoro admitted. "But… there's something you don't know…" Luffy obviously didn`t know about the bounty hunter scheme.

"JUST SHUT UP AND FIGHT ME!" Luffy shouted.

"This guy's just a complete idiot…" Princess Vivi realized as she sat on her duck and stared in disbelief. Carue who was rather dim himself, nodded in agreement.

"You don`t know the half of it," you said laughing a bit.

"Now they're fighting amongst themselves," Mr. 5 commented as he stood in between the bickering pirates. "How pathetic."

"Kyahahaha!" Ms. Valentine laughed. "Maybe if we wait long enough they'll just kill each other."

"Uhhh… hold on Luffy," Zoro called out as Luffy waddled closer, "could you just listen to me for a second? They were actually…"

Luffy leapt up into the air and flew over the two Baroque Works Agents and launched himself at Zoro, "NO EXCUSES!" Vivi, Carue, and You just sat there as you all watched the two of them fight for a few minutes, until Zoro landed near the three of you.

"Okay, I`ll guard Vivi and you take care of your friend, uh Zoro was it?" you asked.

"No, that`s fine," Zoro said resuming the fight. They continued on for w few more minutes, knocking out Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine in the process, before they were both quelled by an orange-haired girl punching them both out of anger. Enter Nami.

"ENOUGH!!" she yelled. "What the heck do you think you're doing?" Nami demanded as she glared at Luffy and Zoro. "It's lucky for you that that guy was there to keep the girl safe! You almost lost us a billion berries!" Nami pulled the two of them up by their collars, "YOU UNDERSTAND?"

"What do you mean?" Princess Vivi asked. "What berries? Why are you helping me?"

"I think Igaram just hired you an impromptu guard force, and with her, I`d be scared of them," you said making a small joke to help ease the tension. The orange-haired girl just glared at you for a minute before she had a confused look on her face.

"Who are you?" Nami asked. "Aren`t you with those guys trying to kill her?"

"No, but I think a few introductions and confusion-clearing explanations are in order," you said calmly as you watched Zoro and Luffy acting like two fighting little kids. "Starting with the guy in the Straw Hat."

"Knock it off!!' Nami yelled as she clubbed Zoro and Luffy over their heads.
1113222111111.title: Your first real battle begins.

11132221111111.content:
****Author`s note: From now on, I`m going to be using [Hero] in place of the person`s name, so I can actually call the main character something without leaving his name out. Just imagine your name in place of [Hero].****

"SHISHISHISHI!" Luffy laughed once the situation had been explained to him while Nami was explaining things to Vivi while you sat a short distance between the two conversations."Oh! Why didn't you just say so Zoro? I thought you got mad and beat everyone up because they didn't have a dish you wanted!"

"THAT'S SOMETHING YOU WOULD DO!" Zoro snapped.

"Shishishishi! What a funny mix up!" Luffy exclaimed.

"You know, it kind of is," you said chuckling a bit.

"YOU GUYS, SHUT UP!" Nami yelled. Then she turned back to Princess Vivi. "There it is, in exchange for taking you home, I'd like one billion berries. You saw how strong these two guys are. I've got two more. If you ask me, it isn't a bad deal."

"Now hold on a minute," you said gaining a bit of attention. "I`m certain that right now, Vivi doesn`t have nearly that much money on her, nor does the royal treasury of Alabasta at the moment. Besides, I`m going to be protecting her for free, so don`t you think there`s strength in numbers?"

"That aside, [Hero]-kun is right, I can't," Princess Vivi replied. "Although I appreciate the help you've given me so far."

"Why not?" asked Nami. "Aren't you a Princess? Aren't you rich?"

"Do you know anything about Alabasta Kingdom?" you inquired of Nami.

"I've never heard of it [Hero]," Nami admitted.

"Then Vivi can explain things to you while I go get my things and stock up for later," you said making your gun boots, causing Luffy to go starry-eyed and Nami to get shocked a bit. "I`ll be back faster than you can say Alabasta!" You bolted off back to the house you were staying at and made it back in a few minutes. There was a backpack lying on the floor, and it was fairly large in size and had several pockets. "Perfect." You grabbed the bag and loaded it up with your original clothes as well as a few spare outfits from the dresser drawers. "But if I`m going to be going with them, I`ll need more ammo and some more weapons to get creative with later. Might as well raid the Baroque Works storage." You then bolted off to what you thought was the weapons storage and you found a cannon or two, tons of ammo, and plenty of swords and a few other types of weapons as well. "Man, how am I gonna carry this all? I guess I`ll take what I can hold." You managed to gather up a good deal of ammo and a few standard weapons, but the weight almost made it hard to walk. "Let`s hope my Magnum Boots can take this." You bolted off and in your run, you managed to see Igaram, now dressed up like Vivi and carrying three dolls. "Oi, Igaram!" You jumped down to meet him.

"It`s you," Igaram replied. "I see you`ve packed a lot for the journey ahead."

"Of course," you replied. "I`m going to need material for creativity if I`m going to protect Vivi."

"You`re going with her?" Igaram asked. "But I already..."

"I know," you replied. "But I still want to protect her. I told you that already, and my name is [Hero]."

"Then I think I have my answer to your offer, [Hero]-kun," Igaram replied. "Please, go with the pirates and protect Princess Vivi. I know they`re strong, but I`d feel much better knowing a man like you is along with her."

"Thanks," you replied sheepishly. "I think we`ll need all the help we can get if we`re gonna stop Crocodile."

"You... you know of Mr. 0`s identity?!" Igaram said shocked. "You must be well-informed."

"So I`ve been told," you said as you held out your hand to Igaram. "Let`s shake on it."

"Alright," Igaram said setting down one of the dummies and taking your extended hand and shaking it.

"I swear that I will protect Princess Vivi with my life," you said in confidence. "Igaram, that promise will be kept."

"Good," he replied. "I`m sorry I didn`t get a chance to mention this earlier, but it was Vivi who rescued you."

"Then that`s all the more reason for me to protect her," you said calmly. "Let`s get back to the others."

We made our way back near the others when we saw Nami storming back over to Luffy, Zoro, and Princess Vivi. "NOW THERE'S NOWHERE LEFT TO RUN!"

"I'm really sorry," Princess Vivi apologized again.

"She'll get over it," Luffy assured her.

"Where was she planning on going anyway?" Zoro wondered. "Looks like the three of us are going to be sitting right at the top of Baroque Works' hit list."

"Shishishishi!" Luffy laughed. "That sounds awesome!"

"Um… I have five hundred thousand berries saved up…" Princess Vivi offered Nami who was sitting in the corner being emo.

"Don`t worry about it Vivi," you replied.

"You have nothing to fear!" Igaram said, finally drawing their attention to the two of you, Nami, Zoro, and Vivi being a bit shocked at your backpack, but more shocked at Igaram in drag. "Ma~ Ma~ Ma~! It's going to be alright Princess," Igaram told Princess Vivi. "I've come up with a plan."

"Igaram, why are you dressed like that?" asked Princess Vivi as she and Luffy got up and approached him.

"Allow us to introduce you to your decoys," you continued as Igaram held up three simple dolls.

"Wow! That's a funny outfit, mister!" Luffy commented as he poked one of the dummies.

"They're all insane," Nami muttered, who was still being emo in the corner.

"Princess Vivi, please listen to me carefully," Igaram requested. "Once Baroque Works' intelligence network learns what happened here, agents will be sent after you immediately. They're aware that you know the Boss' identity…"

"Yes, and knowing them, they'll send a thousand of them," Princess Vivi reasoned, causing Nami to flinch in terror.

"Now here's my plan," Igaram continued, "Disguised like this I will pretend to be you. I'll take the three dummies on board with me and I will sail a straight course to Alabasta."

"So these things are us?" questioned Luffy as he stared at the dummy.

"While Baroque Works is busy chasing after me, the rest of you will take Princess Vivi and head to Alabasta Kingdom following a less direct route," Igaram told them.

"Hold on!" Nami objected, she finally stopped being emo and rejoined the conversation. "Who said we were gonna take her with us? We still haven't discussed the matter of payment."

"An entire kingdom is in turmoil and ready to tear itself apart in civil war, and you`re worrying about MONEY?!!" you yelled at Nami. "That makes you sound heartless!!"

"Payment for what? Take her where?" questioned Luffy.

"I promised Igaram that I`d protect Vivi, and since she`s going with you guys, I`m going too," you explained to Luffy.

"Hold on! We never said anything about taking you along!" Nami said yelling back at you.

"Oh, is that what all this yelling's about?" asked Luffy. "Sure, we'll take her, and the cool gun guy too!"

"CROCODILE MAY ALREADY BE AFTER US!" Nami yelled. "AND WE DON`T NEED ANY FREELOADERS!!"

"Is this Crocodile really that dangerous?" Luffy inquired.

"He's one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea," you explained. "That makes him a legally recognized pirate… I've heard that he's been based in Alabasta for the last three years and is seen as some kind of hero. When he was a pirate he had a bounty of eighty one million berries."

"EIGHTY-ONE MILLION!" Nami screamed, "THAT'S OVER FOUR TIMES WHAT ARLONG'S BOUNTY WAS! TURN IT DOWN!"

"Will you do this for us?" Igaram requested of Luffy.

"Sure!" Luffy agreed. "It sounds like it'll be fun!"

Nami palmed her face and looked depressed.

"He`s always like this, isn`t he?" you asked.

"You have no idea, [Hero]..." Nami replied a bit disheartened.
