The firing was intense, another trooper was shot down. Morris cursed as he pulled the jammed cartridge out of his Springfield. His throat was tight with thirst, body quivering in fear. Finally, the chamber was cleared. He pulled another cartridge from his belt, thumbing it into the breech. He just started to rise to fire at a charging Indian when...

"If you're not too busy Thompson-san, we have a disturbance at the front gate." You hastily put the pad of paper out of the speakers line of sight.

"Ah...Ms. Haya- I mean Hayashi-sensei. Sure, no problem." You stammer, quickly replacing the western honorific for a Japanese one. It's a relief that Kyoko has her back turned, so she won't see the blush on your face.

"Are you an inspiring writer Thompson-san?" She turns to give you a quizzical look. You feel your whole face heat up in embarrassment. You try to keep your writing secretive, feeling that it's no good for public consumption.

"There's nothing to be ashamed about. I would like to read your work sometime." She gives a disarming smile.

"Rea-really?"

"Of course. I don't know much on American culture than what's on television. I'm hoping to broaden my horizons." Turning back, she continues her stride towards the gate. You shrug in indifference. Secretly, you were hoping that her reading your work would signify liking you, but oh well. Besides, she seemed pretty happy with Teshima last time you checked, and your not the man to wreck a relationship for your own sake. Inwardly, you sigh. It's been over a year, as you still have little friends. It may have something to do with the fact that your the only American in the Academy, having been accepted into an exchange program just shortly after earning your Masters. You've been teaching the student world history while writing on the side.

"We're here. What's that man doing?" Kyoko's voice snaps you to attention. You see a strange man banging himself against the main gate. Off to your left, you see a group of P.E. teachers coming to meet him, Teshima included in their ranks. As the two groups merge to confront the threat, you can't help but feel uneasy toward the stranger. He seems...off.

"Hayashi-san, don't get too close." Kyoko perks her head towards your.

"What's wrong Thompson-san?" You shake your head at the gated figure.

"It's just a feeling, but he doesn't look right." Your not wrong, the man stumbles and flays uselessy against the iron bars. He looks drunk, but the pit in your stomach suggests otherwise.

Kyoko smiles, as if pleased that your concerned for her.

"Don't worry, I'll only warn him." With that, her face hardens as she speaks up to the trespasser.

"What do you think your doing? This is private property." The man moves as if he did not hear her. You see the redheads face flush with anger at the mans insolence.

"If you don't leave right now, we'll call the po-." She stops as Teshima lays a hand on her shoulder. You tense up slightly, deriding yourself for feeling jealous when the two of you are only co-workers.

"Relax Hayashi-sensei. We don't have to call the police yet." He rolls up his sleeve and gives her a wink. "We just have to show this guy who's boss." Inwardly, you groan. While you don't personally have a problem with Teshima, his mannerisms do rub you the wrong way. Still, you feel that it's a bad idea for the P.E. teacher to get physical with the vagrant.

"Hey Teshima, careful. Something about that guy is not right." At this, he laughed and shook his head.

"Come on, I thought Americans solved their problems this way." He turned his back to you, missing the look of fury on your face from the ignorant remark.

"Look here you son of a bitch!" Teshima grabs the man by the collar and slams him against the gate. You curse at the show of brutality. You move to stop Teshima when his face changes to one of worry. The next few seconds seem a blur, and you barely register that Teshima is on the ground, clutching his bloodied arm and screaming. Looking up, you see the man continue to flail at the gate, bits of blood and flesh dangling from his mouth.

Jesus Christ! Excited, you slip into your native English tongue. Teshima thrashes around for a seconds, before he stops moving all together. The rest of the group is silent, Kyoko is close to crying. She notices Teshima stirring again, and appears relieved. You, however, notice that he now has the same look as the vagrant. The redhead fails to notice this as she leans closer. Adrenaline is pumping through your body. You have to act fast.

1113322222222222222111.content:
You recognize the petite form of Yukari Sakuragi, the representative for Class 3-3. Her face is ghostly white, like something has frightened her. She starts to hurry down the stairs, umbrella clutched tightly in her left hand. Though she is not in your class, you can't help but be concerned at her appearance. You start to move up the stairs to greet her.

"Hey, ar-" Whatever else you have to say is lost as you see Yukari slip on a step. Her umbrella goes flying as she tumbles down the stairs. It seems as if time stands still as the umbrella sails besides your head. Out of the corner of your eye, you see the umbrella unfurl, as if possessed, and arrayed straight up with the metallic end pointed out. Your mind barely recognizes that the point is aimed at Yukari's neck before you spring into action. Your eyes briefly met with hers as you attempt to catch the class rep. There's a crash, and you hear a feminine scream as you hit the floor. There's a mass pinning your left arm to the floor. You struggle to get up and reorient yourself.

"Sakuragi-san, are you alright?" Your head is swimming, so you don't hear the whimpering for a few seconds. As soon as you do though, your gape at what happened. Your actions saved Yukari from certain death, but the umbrella is embedded in her right arm. Her eyes are welling with tears as pain wracks her.

"Oh god!" Your at her side in an instant. Yukari shifts in discomfort, causing the point to loosen. Blood starts pouring freely out, soaking her uniform. Her eyes widen in panic as the sight. Stopping, you ripe a sleeve off to form a crude bandage.

"It's okay, I'm right here." You place the bandage against the wound, restricting the flow of blood. Yukari is still in a lot of pain, but is becoming more coherent. You feel her squeeze your free hand as she speaks.

"Ple...please don't leave." She's still freaked out over the ordeal. You give her a reassuring smile.

"It's alright, I'm not going anywhere." Your words soothe her. Whatever else there is to say is lost as paramedics arrive. You look up the stairs to see a teacher and student, one of them must have called the hospital. You stay with Yukari until she's wheeled into the ambulance. You want to go with her, but the paramedics refuse. Your not a relative. You watch the ambulance take off into the rain, hoping...praying that she will be alright.

"Mikawa, are you hurt?" You turn your head, puzzled by the teachers question.

"I'm fine sensei, why?"

"Your shirt." Looking down, you see your uniform shirt covered in blood.

"Oh...sorry sensei." He pats your shoulder in sympathy.

"You did the right thing Mikawa. I'll let you out early today. Go home and get changed."

You spend only a few minutes to collect your belongings before heading home. You can't stop thinking about Yukari, and whether or not you should visit her.

"Then you have poor taste in words, or have a limited vocabulary."

"Never mind I'll just go."

"Hey whats the hurry?"

"Big day tomorrow, large groups going to clear floor 1."

"Oh your part of the front-lines? I know one of them, she'll be there tomorrow. In that case I'll let you go."

"Ok thanks, um?"

"Lisbeth."

"Kestrel."
111332222222222222222222111211.title: A month later...

choices: You and Kirito try to go help Diavel
1113322222222222222222221112111.content:
The very next day it was time. The time had come to take on the first boss. It was a long walk, but the boss room was right in front of you and you were ready to fight. You were on another team while Dodger was on another. At first you felt a little uneasy for not being with Dodger, but you knew that he would be fine. After all you and he leveled up so you two could handle yourselves. You looked around at all the people in your group. There was no one that you recognized except for Asuna. She was standing close to the side standing next to a young man in a blue with black hair. He was of course Kirito, but you didn't know this yet. You didn't know why but when you saw him, you could tell that he was unlike the other players. Something about him made you curious about him.

Kestrel thinking: I wonder who that guy is? He looks like he's got some experience on this. Could he be one of those beta testers I heard about?

Then a beta tester who was leading the battle named Diavel stepped in front of the door and turned to his comrades.

Diavel: Listen up everyone. I only have one thing to say to you. Let's win this!

With that, Diavel symbolically opened the door and you all entered the boss room. It was very dark and quiet. Suddenly the room lit up and a giant creature jumped out and landed right in front you. The creature was two meters tall, muscular, had bloodthirsty copper eyes and he wielded a giant bone ax and a leather shield. It was the first boss, Illfang the Kobold Lord. Just after it appeared a couple of smaller creatures called the Ruin Kobold Sentinels appeared next to him. Then all of the creatures charged at you at once. Diavel gave the command and everyone charged as well. Both sides grew closer and closer until both sides clashed and the battle began. The group was split into seven parties in groups of six named by the letters A through G. Groups A through C focused on fighting the boss while Groups D through F attacked the sentinels. Diavel stayed in the back giving out the orders of when which team was to switch and which team was to fall back. You were in group D so your group was fighting a sentinel. Dodger was in group E along with Asuna and Kirito. The sentinels were quick, but you and your groups were slowly getting the advantage. At the moment, you were fighting one of the sentinels. Your swords clashed again and again, but the sentinel was starting to overwhelm you.

Kestrel: Damn it! This guy is starting to get annoying!

Then the sentinel charged at you with incredible speed. It was so fast that you didn't react in time and you were about to get slashed, but then you were saved. Kirito got in front of you and defended you with his sword and Asuna charged in at the sentinel and killed it with excellent swordsmanship.

Kestrel: Whoa! Thanks! You saved me.

Kirito: Don't stop now! Keep on the pressure!

Kestrel: Right!

Kestrel thinking: Man! Those two are amazing! That guy saved me and had a good reflexes. And Asuna.....she's on a whole new level. I didn't even see her sword move! Awesome.

Then Dodger who was fighting another Sentinel snapped you out of your thoughts.

Dodger: Hey! Kestrel! Get the lead out! We still got a boss to beat!

Kestrel: Oh! R-right! Got it!

Suddenly, Illfang let out a roar which caused you to look back. From the looks of it, it was on the ropes and it's health bar which originally had four was know on his last bar and it was in the red. It threw aside his axe and shield and roared again.

Dodger: Hey! That boss is in the red! Alright! A few more hits and this'll be all over!

Kestrel: Be careful Dodger! We may be winning, but don't get cocky! The real fight is about to get started! Stick to the plan! We gotta get ready to surround it.

Diavel: No! Stand back! Leave this to me!

Kestrel: What?

Before you had a chance to react, Diavel had ran right passed you and charged straight at Illfang activating a sword skill.

Dodger: What the heck is he doing?!? Is he nuts?!?

You didn't say anything. All you could do was look on with worry. Then Illfang grabbed something from behind his back. You expected to be a Talwar, but you would soon learn that you were wrong. Then Kirito shouted trying to warn him.

Kirito: Stop! Get out of there! You're going to die!

But Diavel kept charging. Then Illfang jumped from pillar to pillar in blinding speed. Then before Diavel knew what had happened Illfang gave a mighty swing and hit Diavel. Then it appeared behind Diavel and slashed him again. Diavel was sent flying and sprawling to the floor.

Dodger: Oh no! It got Diavel!

Kestral: The fool! Why the heck did he charge in like that?!? We must help him!

Suddenly Illfang landed right in front of you and let out a ferocious roar.

Kestral: Damn it! There's no time for this1 Diavel needs help! I gotta get over there and give him a potion!

Dodger: No way! Are you nuts?!? Like you said we need to stick to the plan! We have to fight without him!

Kestral racked his brains trying to figure out what he should do. Without Diavel leading them, they might lose. Or worse. Then.....
1113322222222222222222221112111.title: The 1st boss

11133222222222222222222211121112.content:
"Dammit!", you held your ground but fell back a little preparing for a critical strike.

"Everyone hold your positions and get ready! Prepare for attack! 1st squads - 4 defensive positions and wait to evade on my mark!", Dodger yelled.

"The hell are you doing?!", you asked.

"Getting ready for that thing to attack and making sure our main force doesn't get wiped out! Honestly that's all I got! Welcome to throw me ideas."

You thought what to do when Illfang finished its attack but then it swung its sword and hit the ground causing a big shock wave in front of the attack force. The center units got wiped out with most of them being killed from the damage output. You and Dodger were lucky having been far enough to evade and not get too hurt from it. Then you saw Illfang roar again and snarl. "Everyone! I want all remaining to head straight for it in wedge formation! When it attacks we split up in the middle and go right for the bastard!", you called out.

With everyone just accepting any plan as a good one they just went along and followed your orders. You then all charged straight for the boss and waited to split up. "Wait for it!", you yelled. Splitting up too soon would result in it swiping all of you in half. Needed to move when he tries to squash all of you at ounce. Illfang held up the sword again and was going to attack. You weren't sure when, you couldn't predict it in time you worried. Then you heard Dodger yell, "NOW!"

Everyone split up and most managed to evade in time with a few getting caught in the attack. The players all ganged up and attacked the boss causing its health to lower. But not fast enough, then out of nowhere you saw Asuna and Kirito go right for Illfang super quickly. Their speed was incredible. In just mere moments they both dispelled the 1st boss.

With the boss destroyed the same way players die in-game, a screen appeared saying the 1st boss is cleared. After an entire month the first boss was beaten. You and Dodger were still alive. You looked around, players cheering and mourning the loss of their friends and comrades. You saw Kirito checking his inventory like he received something special. Everyone gravitated towards him for dealing the final blow, but then you and Dodger both got some pats on the back for leading the group. It all seemed like a victory until...someone yelled out, "Why did you let Diavel die?!"

"What?!", you said

"He knew the bosses pattern! If he told us he wouldn't have died! Your a beta tester aren't you!"

"Stop it! We beat the boss! So what if he knew, he warned him the moment he saw that thing attack. Get a grip guys!", Dodger said.

"Hehehehehehehahhahahahahahahhahahaaaa! Don't compare me to those scrubs!", Kirito laughed. "Out of the thousand testers they had no idea how to level up! I made it higher than any of them and I know things no informant or broker knows. I faced bosses much higher than this one. I know more than that too.", he boasted.

"What the hell Kirito?", you thought. Was he telling the truth?! Was he that good?!

"Your a cheater!" "No worse than a beta tester!" "Your a beater! "YEAH A BEATER!", random people said. Soon as the term beater seemed to be his main title, he seemed to relish in his new found infamy. He selected an item from his menu and out came a black cloak giving him a prominent look. "I like it. I am a beater then."

Soon as he said that he left to explore the 2nd floor. Asuna followed him but your attention was drawn away when Dodger came by. "If we ever see that guy again we have got to find out what he knows."

"Dodger, there is little chance he meant it."

"I believe he knows enough to get us ahead of the game! You gotta back me up on this dude."

"We'll deal with it later. For now lets see what we got from the boss and start building a guild."

"Great idea, we got the crowd on our side with how directed the assault. We got this game in the bag.", Dodger said confidently.
11133222222222222222222211121112.title: Stick to the plan

111332222222222222222222111211121.content:
After the first boss was defeated you and Dodger formed a small group named the Marauders. A group tasked with hitting the richest spots in the games with the best loot and experience. However while ambitions were high your results were a lot to be desired. While everyone kept leveling and sharing equally the group was mostly comprised of inexperienced and naive players. They lacked what brought the term high risk high reward to definition. For at least a two solid months your group held out on their own fine. But with each floor you all moved up to along with the people charging the front lines, it all began to strain. Dodger was under the belief that by aiding the front line guilds they would be strong enough to last through the game. As extra muscle it would be easier to find work for jobs and such. Being mercenaries for various jobs were consistent with simply body guarding, assistance in battle for high difficulty side quests, or bringing in wanted players. But it was clear that the guild was simply not strong enough to make it if they kept at the pace of the front-line guilds. A discussion was what brought you and Dodger to converse.

"We need to keep up with the Kestrel. We can do what they're doing just fine. They're just scared they'll die, which I don't blame them for. But they need to toughen up, if they want to go home then they gotta be willing to die trying. You know this better than most."

"I know but there should come a time to slow the momentum. I think, instead we should spend the next couple weeks staying in this floor and leveling up everyone. Also I think we need to begin refurbishing our equipment. Were out of extra weapons for the others, and we need to start getting some high quality weapons. Ones that will last, were spending too much on new ones that last about a few weeks."

"Your absolutely right. They're not going to survive if we keep this up, so we'll stay behind for a while. But when the next floor opens then we go back to helping the front."

"No, I think we should keep leveling until we go at least a 5 extra levels before we go to to aid the front line guilds. If we do that then were more liekley to stand together with them for the other bosses."

"Alright, but can I say something?"

"Shoot."

"I'm thinking of leaving the Marauders."

"What?!"

"You and me, leave them. I've been working with these guys for a while now and I think they can survive without us now."

"Dodger you can't be serious."

"I'm just so tired of those guys weighing me down. It's easier when it was just you and me, in other games we knew what we needed to do to look out for each other. So why have them holding us back?"

"Sigh....listen dodger there is nothing more than I'd love than to go back to that. But we have a responsibility to them. And were what's keeping them alive. Look, were both at close to 27 lvl, and the others are behind by about one or two lvls. That doesn't mean they have the skills and experience to survive like us."

"To be perfectly honest they annoy the shit put of me. And that one girl is barley up to snuff, she'll never make it. Besides I overheard about them changing our names from the Marauders to the Black Cats."

"They're trying to match pace with us Dodge. But maybe we should start going at theirs for a little while. We need to be a team."

"Kestrel I love your optimism and your a goody two-shoes. But your also my bestest bud in the world, or game whatever you call it. They are not. And besides it's not uncommon for people to bail out after a while. Just you and me. And we'll get more loot, exp., and best of all we worry only about ourselves and our troubles are only our troubles."

You and Dodger were friends way back IRL and it still carried over in game since the day it all changed when SAO was a death game. You saved him from ending it all right at the start. You knew that he made some sense and you felt bad about leaving, but ultimately Dodger's argument to leave proved to be too convincing and you agreed. Before however leaving the group in charge to the second in command, you all had a heartfelt goodbye and no hard feelings. They appreciated the techniques and safety strategies you helped them learn which they planned to use to keep each other alive. And as you left them, there was a matter of looking to get your own equipment refurbished.

You and Dodger asked around looking for a decent smith to revitalize your weapons and armor, but they all pointed to NPC shops. "Thank you. Gah 8th person that pointed us to the same place. NPC's are good for the cheap stuff but we need someone who KNOWS how to make great stuff.", you said.

"A player smith? Wait a second, I remember on that one assignment while we hunted a player."

"Was it the one who stole all those fat loots or the one who swindled five guilds who ended up being a hot woman?"

"That still shocked me why was it that person was like a playboy model in a VRMMO? Never knew why, but yeah that one. See when we asked around I talked to this one person who said they had some mace wielder in his group that was leveling to be a smith. At least that's what I got from what he said."

"You know how we can reach him then?"

"I know what to do. Hang around town for a while I retrieve that number of our new smith friend."

"Alright good-luck Dodger."
111332222222222222222222111211121.title: Continue

1113322222222222222222221112111211.content:
You waited patiently when you received a message from Dodger, "Come to floor 48 I'll meet you at the village square." From the sound of things Dodger was successful in his en devour. Soon as you made it to the floor you were immediately greeted by Dodger who acted like all your problems were solved. "Kestrel my man we are getting the greatest deal since we bagged that bounty alive for twice the profit."

"Explain quickly."

"I found that guy I told you about, I tracked him down and we got to talking, and he hooked us up with a sweet deal. And it all hinges on you dude. You play along we get an enormous discount on what we get there. Top grade equipment at a low price with the best smith in all of SAO. We are freaking set."

"Good, what do I need to do exactly?"

"Just say you heard she's the best smith in SAO and she'll cut us a deal."

"OK, since you told me exactly that, I don't feel the need to con my way into this."

"HAHAHAHAAAA! Oh jeez you are funny bro, that's why I love you."

Soon you made it to the smith shop, the sign said Lisbeth's blacksmith shop. "Hope she's hot."

"Dodger could you maybe keep that to yourself and not speak it out loud."

"Just saying so were on the same page. Your thinking the same thing."

"Not really."

"C'mon you ever think about women like they're attractive?"

"Yeah but I'm subtle with my thoughts on that. A word you are scarcely aware of.", the moment Dodger opened the door you were greeted by a pretty cute girl with pink hair, a pin in her hair with freckles and welcomed you with a pleasant greeting. "Welcome to Lisbeth's blacksmith shop how may I help you today?"

"So lovely...", you said dazzed. Dodger was trying his best not to burst into laughter but tried to remain composed.

"Hi my friend and I are hehe looking to get our stuff improved. Pfffffft, sorry I need a moment."

Lisbeth turned to you wondering what was the deal. You looked like you had seen a miracle but you came back to life when she waved her hand near your face. "Hey, hello? Anyone alive in there?", she asked.

"Absolutely that weapon right there is the most lovely craftsmanship I have seen in game.", you tried saving yourself from embarrassment.

"Oh wow I guess you have a great eye. I call this little sword my masterpiece.", she replied.

In your head you couldn't believe that worked but kept it going trying not to look awkward. "I heard your the best smith in the game so we went here to get the best.", you said going off of what Dodger said to say.

"He, I'll bet someone told you to say that thinking you could get a bargain. Well nice try.", she said with snark.

"I specifically was told that you were the best smith in this game. I'm no genius at this but the finest weapons I have seen which are ranging from one decent axe to a moderately feasible sword pale in comparison to the common expert level quality made weapons I'm looking at right now."

"Hehehehe. Ok that deserves a shave off the price. So what do you looking to get fixed up?", she asked.

Before you answered you noticed a staff on display which caught your attention. "Hey...what's that?"

"Of that's just a cheap wooden staff. It's useless but looks nice so I hang it like a decoration. I was experimenting with different types of swords."

"What were you making with his one?"

"A regular bow staff but it's not very effective."

"Ever think about housing blades on the ends of it, like a double balded staff?"

"Gasp! Why didn't I think of that? Gah that's what I was missing! What are you interested in one. Cuz I'll make it for you, but it won't cost cheap."

"Trust me we got enough for this. Also there is something I'd want that would be very useful if possible to install."

"Well give me the details later right now how about I fine tune your default weapon you got right now?"

"Sure.", you took out your sword and handed it to her, she went to the back and began working on it.
1113322222222222222222221112111211.title: A few hours later....

11133222222222222222222211121112111.content:
The two of you waited while she went to work, Dodger went to browse through her collection but wanted to pass the time with interesting conversation. "So lovely. She is that much of a knock out huh?"

"SHUT UP!"

"Hey, I'm not dissing you with your tastes. She's a looker man, she's cute."

"Dodger I will bury you if you don't shut your trap."

"You are just so easy to tease my friend. I mean it takes great skill to poke fun of how you act all responsible and adult like, yet when your out of your element your a deer in headlights. Women is not your element, neither is doing 'adult things' which is ironic since you seem to be so mature and all."

"Look I may not jump at the chance at having my first beer like you did when were not even legally allowed, but I defended your secret because your like a brother to me man. So one of us has to be responsible on some degree so we don't get ourselves killed."

"Eh no worries. I've always hated but respected that about you. Now what weapon should I start getting proficient with? Axe! No. Lance! Nawwww, to many compensating assumptions. AH! There it is, the jousting one."

"I would associate that with somebody who has class."

"Exactly. Look at me ladies I'm the classiest man in the online world. Just look at these muscles and my 4-pack.", Dodger kept showing off but you were smiling and trying to hold back your laughter. But not because his showing off was ridiculous when it was, but because Lisbeth came back from her backroom with an awkward expression. Dodger turned to see why you were laughing and was completely embarrassed by having done that while she was there.

"Uhhhh.....", Lisbeth answered.

"Yeah I'll just take my weapon and go now.", Dodger said sheepishly walking out of the shop.

"That guy is just all sorts of weird."

"When you've known him as long as I have, you tend to see MUCH weirder. Worse thing is he's a lot saner than you'd imagine so that means were surrounded by wackos more nuttier than him.", you joked.

"Hehehehe. Well anyway I'll take your sword now."

"Oh wait a sec. I have had an idea of what I need, I need it so.....whisper whisper..........possible to manage that?"

"Uh I don't know. Frankly I doubt I could craft something like that to a double bladed sword."

"Hey I am willing to go fight tooth and nail for that thing because single swords aren't my thing."

"If you'd be willing to help me make it then I suppose I could try. But you help me EVERY step of the way, I won't bust my butt alone on this."

"Ok then, knew it was a good thing to come to you for this. But I'm more interested in seeing how good you really are Lisbeth."

"And you better be something spectacular if your planning to use something as heavy and complicated as a double edged sword, Kestrel was it?"

"Yes, that's my name Kestrel. Pleased to get to know you. So where do start?", you asked.
11133222222222222222222211121112111.title: The quest for your sword...

111332222222222222222222111211121111.content:
The trip to the 55th floor felt, cold. It was like the Himalayas only less frigid but you never ounce enjoyed the cold even when you were a kid, you just always felt so freezing when it went below average temperature. To Lisbeth's confusion you were extra bundled up for your quest not wanting to deal with the cold. "Is it that cold to you? You look like your about to climb Mt. Everest."

">I hate the cold and the cold hates me. I can't stand it when it's like this so yeah it is that cold to me out here.<", you replied a little muffled from the extra layers of coats covering you except your eyes. You still had your sword and Dodger to accompany you.

"Where do we find this dragon? We kill it then we can get a massive exp. boots when we kill it.", Dodger said.

">Were not killing it! We came for the crystals lying around near it Dodger.<"

"Fine. Let's just get moving, this place gives me the creeps."

You, Lisbeth, and Dodger went through the icy mountains sticking close as possible to make sure nobody fell. However while things seemed quiet for a long period, you heard a loud roar nearby. "What was that?"

">The dragon.<", you all stayed in place listening for it's wingspan to bring notice of it, but nothing else could be heard. ">Were fine, we gotta hurry before it finds us.<", you said leading on.

The winds grew more irritating as you kept going finding the crystals, Lisbeth and Dodger were getting worried as well as freezing to which you started noticing. "Lis, how much farther?"

"Should be close."

"That's only amounted by horseshoes and hand grenades. Were lost."

">Not lost, we go back when we get it. We'll head over the next ridge and we'll make a fire.<"

"We gotta use our crystals to teleport the hell out of here.", Dodger said.

"Were not that far by now c'mon!", Lisbeth insisted.

"No dammit! Were being followed. Holy shit, we gotta leave now!", Dodger said looking around the path.

"Who's following?", she asked.

"Bad guys! Real ones. Kestrel its laughing coffin!"

You lowered your coat from your mouth to communicate properly and pulled out your sword, "Oh shit. Dodger let me go ahead and you guys head back."

"Not a chance dude we have to-"
111332222222222222222222111211121111.title: 55th floor

choices: Meanwhile Dodger is looking for the leader
You and and Lisbeth fend off the lackeys
1113322222222222222222221112111211111.content:
Suddenly out of nowhere a player with a black cloak leaped from a cliff and headed straight towards you with it's sword raised. You immediately went on the defensive by wielding your sword and blocked the attack. Then a few more people with black cloaks popped up. You were all now completely surrounded

Lisbeth: Oh no! We're cornered!

Kestrel: Damn it. They're got us surrounded.

Dodger: Crap! Be on guard! Here they come!

Kestrel: Lisbeth stay close to me!

Lisabeth: Right!

The lackeys from Laughing Coffin then went on the attack. Dodger using his wrist swords knocked away a lackey before it had a chance to hit him. Then he parried another attack from an incoming lackey and slashed him in the stomach knocking him back. You stood next to Lisbeth protecting her. Lisabeth wielded her spike mace and bashed a lackey with it. Another lackey came at her from behind and attempted to hit her with his ax, but you blocked it using your sword and then attacked with by slashing him in the shoulder. You made quick work of him, but then two more lackeys came. You just knocked back the first lackey when the second came at you wielding an ax. You dodged the ax narrowly missing your shoulder and then you slashed the second lackey on the torso with your sword. The third lackey took advantage of the opening and went on the attack and went straight for Lisbeth with it's sword raised.

Kestrel: Lisbeth! Look out!

Before Lisbeth could react, Dodger came from out of nowhere and saved her by knocking back the attack.

Lisbeth: Thanks!

Dodger: Damn it! These guys are stubborn, I'll give them that!

Lisbeth: But what do we do? They have the advantage when it comes to numbers and we can't fend them off forever.

You wracked your brain trying to come up with a plan. Then you got an idea.

Kestrel: There must be a leader somewhere. If we take out the leader, then the rest of them will fall.

Lisbeth: That sounds like a great idea, but will that work?

Dodger: It's better than what we're doing right now. I say let's do it! You guys focus on these bozos. I'll take out the leader.

Kestrel: Dodger, wait a second!

Before you could try and stop him, Dodger had already slashed his way past two the lackys and had gone ahead to search for the Laughing Coffin leader, leaving you and Lisbeth by yourselves.

Kestrel: Damn that idiot! Always running off on his own without a plan!

Lisbeth: So now what do we do?

Kestrel: Well... The only thing we can do. We're gonna have to keep fighting these guys. We're just gonna have to hope that Dodger can find the leader and beat him.

Lisbeth: Do you think that he can?

Kestrel: I wouldn't worry. Dodger's a pretty strong player. He can handle himself. Now get ready. They're coming again!

Lisbeth: Um...right!

Then you and Lisbeth braced for battle as the lackeys attacked again.
1113322222222222222222221112111211111.title: Continue....

11133222222222222222222211121112111111.content:
Dodger stormed ahead looking for who was leading the PK guild. The mountains still felt cold, even in the virtual world the sense of chill and shivering could be felt inside the game. Dodger gripped his arm blades tightly cautiously scouting ahead. He soon ran into a pair of Laughing Coffin players, they were caught off guard but Dodger didn't hesitate and stuck first. He sliced through them but not enough to kill them. However when they both recovered they lunged at Dodger, Dodger bolcked both of their strikes and their weapons clashed in a small stalemate.

"Don't make me kill you guys! If you force me to attack I'll do it!", Dodger warned. They didn't let up, Dodger couldn't prolong it any more. He swiped his arms in opposing directions and cut straight through the players' sides. They vanished as a result, they were now further casualties among the many who died in this death game. Dodger while conflicted, didn't feel much remorse over his action. In fact he felt nothing, not justifying it to himself, no guilt, he killed two players who would have killed him. He knew he must be close if he ran into some players, therefore he pressed onward.

As he continued trekking through the snow, he saw a small cluster of Laughing Coffin players whom were huddled around one player, he was a skinny guy but carrying a big ax. Clearly physical prowess was a bit toned down to accommodate with whatever class you were inside the game. One of the players spotted Dodger and quickly ran right for him. Dodger blocked the attack in time and impaled the player and ripped him in two killing him. "Who ever you are get out, you have no business here!", said the ax wielder.

"Call of your goons, your attacking my best friend a ways back!"

"We can't leave any witnesses, kill him.", the ax wielder ordered his group.

Dodger was running low on energy, his health was a little lower than preferred and the other couple of players were not the type to go after with a class like his without back-up. A swordsman and spear man were out of his element. They PKs ganged up on Dodger, however while they landed some damaging hits on him as they assaulted him, Dodger was too fast and chipped at their health little by little until he could land decisive blows.

The spear player stabbed at Dodger but missed by a milometer. Dodger counter attacked and stuck his arm blade into the players own neck. The shock of Dodger murdering the other player caused the swordsman to fall back to his leader. "You aren't one of us are you?", asked the ax wielder.

"Call off your boys! Now!"

"I don't thinks so. See you killed on of my guys, and that means I should take your life to make the difference. But tell me, you don't have any problem killing other players."

"I'm NOTHING like you freaks. Killing random innocent people, you know damn well that we die for real if we die here! Except when you guys try to kill me I don't have any issue."

"Ha! You know what, lets just kill this ass-hole and get this over with. Your out matched!"
11133222222222222222222211121112111111.title: Dodger's growing pain

111332222222222222222222111211121111112.content:
Back with you and Lisbeth, you both were still fighting the other soldiers. You were feeling a little tired because you were not only fighting the lackeys, but you were also trying to protect Lisbeth. You knew that she wasn't much of a fighter, so you did everything you could to fight off the lackeys. Unfortunately your stamina was running a low.

Kestrel: This is bad. At this rate, I won't be able to fight them off much longer. If we don't end this soon...

Lackey: What's wrong? Running a little low on steam?

Lisbeth looked at you and could see that you were getting tired.

Lisbeth: Hey. Are you okay? Can you still fight?

Kestrel: To be honest, I don't know. One things for sure, at this rate we won't last much longer. If only I had more stamina.

111332222222222222222222111211121111112.title: You and Lisbeth

1113322222222222222222221112111211111122.content:
With the two lackeys aiming to kill you, you waited for them to make the first move. They lunged at you thinking that they could one hit kill you if they all attacked at ounce. But while the combined attack power was useful it was predictable. You parried the one on your right while dogging the left's attack. You impaled the parried lacky but pulled out your sword before you killed him, you shoved him into the snow knocking over the other attacker leaving the one holding Lisbeth to the wall. You threw your sword into the guys leg forcing him to wince in pain forcing him to let go of Lisbeth. Freed, Liz swung her mace and knocked out her attacker. You got back your sword and grabbed Lisbeth's hand trying to find Dodger.

Meanwhile...

Dodger was still facing against the one calling the shots and while Dodger was hard to hit, he wasn't doing enough damage to his opponents to make a significant difference. Their larger health bars, and defense made the too strong for hi alone. Dodger was running on fumes and they knew it, all they were waiting was for him to make a mistake before they could do him in with one attack from their weapons. Dodger kept on the defensive falling back farther away more and more. "Stop prolonging this! C'mon and fight!", the leader said.

As the wind grew more intense, Dodger smiled and made a run for it. The Laughing Coffin members chased after him but the wind was blinding until finally the snow and wind ceased its bombardment. Dodger lured them over to where the Dragon was and it saw them. The guild made a run for it knowing they were ill equipped and weak to face the beast. The dragon blew its fire setting the guild party ablaze. From the ashes only a couple managed to survive it's first attack. The dragon flew away soon to make another pass. The leader holding the ax opened his inventory and drank his health potions. His other party member said, "What are you doing lets get out of here. We won't last with that thing after us!"

"I'm going to kill that son of a bitch!", he yelled in response. Dodger hid behind the fields of crystals laying around in the snow. He hid from the ax wielder trying to scroll through his inventory for health potions. He managed to access them but they were too small in regenerating his health. Soon you and Lisbeth saw the dragon spewing fire around the crystals. Suspecting Dodger was there you called out to him as loud as possible, "DODGER! DODGE WHERE ARE YOU?!"

The leader however heard your calling and figured he would take his frustrations on you instead. Dodger looked cautiously over his cover to see the leader running towards your voice. He got up and lunged at him from behind stabbing him with both of his arm blades. The leader shook him off and swung his ax at the ground. From all the fire and steam coming from the snow it was difficult to see.

You and Lisbeth stuck together while searching and calling to Dodger. As he fought the LC leader Dodger heard one of your calls and yelled out where he was. Finally having an idea where your friend was you ran over to his voice as fast as you could. You could hear the sounds of weapons clashing and swinging around. At last you finally found Dodger but everything stopped when a loud noise echoed. The dragon was close by and was looking through the steam, everyone stood still hoping it would go away.

But the LC leader noticed with Dodger's attention aimed right at the beast he readied to swing his ax but the sound of the weapon was loud enough to make it aware of their location. The dragon blew fire at the sound forcing Dodger to move out of the way but incinerating the Laughing Coffin leader in the process. Just as Dodger managed to land, the snow beneath him sunk in just the span of a moment. You saw Dodger sinking and in reaction leaped to his side and grabbed his hand.

The snow collapsing revealed a large and wide hole in the ground, a trap for the prey of the Ice Dragon. You held on to Dodger and pulled him up but as the Dragon ascended his wings caused the heavy winds to make it harder for you to hold on. The snow and sweat from your hand made hanging on to your best friend all the more harder. Lisbeth reached out to which Dodger grabbed, but he saw the Dragon fly and knew it was coming for another pass. "Hurry up gggggrrrrhhhh!", he panicked as he feared for his life. They were almost there but the last laughing coffin guild took advantage and tried stabbing Lisbeth. He succeeded and got Lisbeth to have a knife sticking out her shoulder. But ounce she reflexively let go of Dodger's hand in trying to remove the knife, the attacker tried finishing the job but ended up causing both of them to slip and fall down into the hole.

"NOOO!", you reached out with one of your arms and barley managed to catch her. but you couldn't hold the weight of two people.

"Kestrel! Pull me up I can't hold on any longer!", Dodger cried out.

"Help me Kestrel! Help!", Lisbeth yelled in terror.

You felt anchored to the edge as their pleas held you down as did their weight. You couldn't lift either of them up now even if you chose. But with the dragon about to breath its fiery breath it made you forcefully make a choice.

In that moment you couldn't remember what you felt from the stress on your arms and hands, but somehow you felt in one second the removal of the life your right hand, the life of your best friend Dodger. You watched as he screamed and flailed his arms and legs while descending into the darkness. "DOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOODDDDDDDDDDGGGGGGGGGGGGGEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEERRRRRRRRRRRRRR RRR!", you screamed. Lisbeth pulled herself up and tried to make it up, which now having lost one you used all your might to save the one you kept hold of. You yannked her up and used your teleport crystal to escape leaving behind Dodger.
1113322222222222222222221112111211111122.title: Fire and Ice

1113322222222222222222221112111211111122.content:
It was a full week since what happened to Dodger, you hired a tracker to see if he survived but after searching for days it was safe to assume that Dodger had been another victim to the death game. You waited in the alleys of the 48th floor to hear from the tracker and as you waited your arm shook uncontrollably. The same arm that gave out when Dodger fell into the pit. Finally it stopped when the tracker finally came back, but the brief moment of joy turned back into horror as he returned empty handed. "Did you find him?"

"Nothing could be found, the pit was empty and I searched around the 55th floor for days. I'm sorry but your friend isn't alive.", the tracker left having been already paid for her services. With no hope left to the chance Dodger escaped or survived it left you all but destroyed.

Meanwhile in Lisbeth's shop her friend Asuna came by to purchase some upgrades for her weapon...

"Hi Lisbeth!", Asuna came in a bright and cheerful fashion. Lisbeth may have been feeling upset about the incident last week but her normal demure around her friends and fellow customers didn't dent her personality. But seeing her best friend in the game brightened her up more than usual today maintaining her composure of recent of events.

"Asuna! Welcome, what can I do you for?"

"I've been saving up and thought you could forge my sword with a thicker metal. Also line it with some materials to make it lighter and faster for me to stab while I'm fighting.", she requested.

"Well frankly my skills with forging preexisting materials are a little low right now. However if you give me some time to level that skill up I will message you I'm on the job. However that's if what your willing to pay is worth retaining my services hehe.", she snickered.

Asuna smirked, "Is this enough?", she showed Lisbeth the amount she was willing to shelve on her menu and it was a heft sum.

"Lisbeth's jaw nearly dropped. Yeah that would do it. Holy smokes you find a rare money chest or something?"

"I'll tell you all about it after you level out that skill."

"AHHH! Asuna you meanie! C'mon I need the small talk."

"I'll give it to you but only whats been happening to you."

This resurfaced her downer mood changing her attitude and tone, "Well something did happen."

"What?", Asuna inquired. Lisbeth explained to Asuna the story about her, you and Dodger on the 55th floor. To Asuna's horror and shock it fueled her to take serious action against this PK guild. For a long time the Laughing coffin has been murdering players like death was an illusion here when in all seriousness every bar they emptied was another murder in this long torturous game.

"Where was this Kestrel when you last saw him."

"Said he hired a tracker and was waiting in town on this floor.", Lisbeth answered.

"Listen to me Lisbeth, stay in your shop for the next few days, they might come after you until this dies down. Meantime I'll go talk to your friend and try to help him. Asuna took off and searched across the floor's town where after a while she found you crying in an ally. "Pardon, but are you Kestrel?", she gently walked toward you.

"Get the f#$% out of here!", you yelled wanting to be left alone.

"I'm a friend of Lisbeth's.", Asuna exclaimed.

"Liz? I'm sorry, I.....I'm...."

"I heard about the Laughing Coffin and your friend. I'm sorry you lost a friend to this."

"Not the games fault. I let him go."

"Lisbeth told me how you carried her and your friend. You just lost your grip, you didn't let him go. She told me exactly what happened."

Her words may have helped dealing with your survivors guilt but you still couldn't find the strength to go on. "Listen to me, I am a leader of the Knight of the Blood Oath. If you were to bring your case to the other members, we would have enough cause to make sure the guild that attacked you never does this to another player in here ever again."

You wanted revenge on them for causing the whole thing to spiral out of control, and this could allow you a chance at it. "One condition, if your planning to raid them. I participate in every raid, lead, anything until they are dealt with.", you answered.

"I am not saying we commit genocide."

"I never said I meant that either, I want pay back for Dodger but I want the whole Guild destroyed in whatever way makes it happen faster. Be it every last one of them dies or they all are locked up until this game ends."

"Does it mean if I accept your condition, you won't be inclined to stoop to their level unless we tell you?"

"Yes."

"Then you will get your chance."

1113322222222222222222221112111211111122.content:
Date: December 24th, 2024

Current Guild Party: Knights of the Blood Oath

Weapon: Single sword

Status: Dodger (Deceased)
Pulsar (Alive) - Leads missionary group of protecting the youth trapped in game
Kestrel (Alive) - Working with the KOTBO to dispatch all traces of Laughing Coffin

It was Christmas eve and every floor in the game had the holiday coated in snow and bright colored lights. The cold of the snow and weather didn't seem too painful now. But the chills still wormed their way into your coat, and for the last month and a half the anger never left. Asuna and the other members had been keeping track of Laughing Coffins activities with you leading the charge at every possible crime. But it wasn't enough the PK guild still murdered and tortured people as if it was nothing but sick fun. Ever day you wondered why they do it when it is clear they are murdering innocent people, the answer was obvious, when you sign up to join them you aren't a human being but a monster.

It was getting late, it was 7:30 at night and your patrol was over for the night. You reported back to your post and was free to spend your evening however you pleased. You went to the 1st floor, in the area where Kayaba had announced your fate. You starred up to the sky pondering if you were ever going to make it out alive, when suddenly you heard someone. "You came here too?", it was Asuna, "You think that maybe he will ever show up again?"

"I don't know."

"Any plans for Christmas Eve?"

"No."

"Well do you want to come with me to the 37th floor? They're having a choir from the youth center sing carols for everyone. I think it would be good to see something lift everyone's spirits while were trapped in this death game."

You thought maybe it would be a good idea and agreed, upon arriving at the floor you saw Pulsar with the children preparing for their performance.

"Hey Kestrel.", you both hugged, "Glad to see you here."

"Yeah me too. How's your center?"

"It's...getting dicy."

"What happened?"

"Honestly there just comes a point where you keep doing what your doing but then somewhere down the line you ask yourself why do I keep doing it. I've been asking that ever since Dodger died. And the center has been harassed by some other guilds for supplies."

"I'll talk to the Knights and pull some strings to give you some protection."

"Thanks, oh who's this?", Pulsar noticed Asuna yanking you to the seats.

"Asuna, this is Pulsar my best friend. He's the one responsible for tonight's entertainment."

"I'm really happy to see what your doing. In all the sadness it is really inspiring to see such optimism."

"You two here as a date?", Pulsar asked.

"Oh no no no! We just work together.", Asuna explained.

Pulsar smiled, "Ok I gotta set things up enjoy the show."

While Asuna brought you to a nice bench where you could watch the choir she sat on your left and grabbed your face for some odd reason. You blushed wondering why she was doing this and after she clarified you two were only friends. "Kestrel look behind you and promise you won't get mad or depressed.", she said with a stern but snarky smile. Confused you nodded and then she immediately released her grip. You turned to see...Lisbeth!

"Liz?!", you said more shocked than what Asuna expected you react.

"Hi.", she seemed a bit shy given how things ended off last you two spoke. "I was in around here and saw Asuna and now your here. I wasn't expecting this."

"Eh if it makes this better I'm happy to see you.", you spoke in earnest and actual joy. Having her here made this trip a much needed distraction from all the hunting down of Laughing Coffin. Having Lisbeth around with Asuna all about to enjoy a pleasant performance was the best thing to happen all year since the game began.

"Oh? I...I guess the feeling is mutual then.", feeling surpised by your reply she smiled and sat a bit closer to you. It felt warm. And finally the choir sang...

1113322222222222222222221112111211111122.content:
He looked just like a normal player, but the moment you saw that orange cursor you immediately walked toward the player. You put on your best game face you could and started to talk to him.

"Hey there friend," you said. "Mind if we chat for a minute?"

The male player turned towards you and then he scowled as if he thought your face had something disgusting on it.

"What do you want punk?" he sneered.

"Now come on don't be like that," I said. "I just wanna talk to you. I couldn't help, but notice that you have an orange cursor above your head."

"Yeah? So what?"

"So that means you've committed a couple of crimes here and there and got away with it right? I could use a guy like you."

"What do you mean?" asked the player his curiousity peaked.

"Here's the deal," I said. "I'm looking for a someone like you. I'll get right to the point. You interested in joining Laughing Coffin?"

The moment he heard Laughing Coffin, the player looked at me in shock.

"You're a part of Laughing Coffin?! You gotta be screwing with me!"

"Nope. I'm quite serious," you said.

"Hey... if you're a part of Laughing Coffin, then how come you look like one of those goody two shoes players from a guild and stuff." he asked.

"Oh. That's because I'm undercover," you said quickly coming up with an excuse. "Can't just go all willy nilly flashing around that I'm a part of laughing coffin or whatever."

The male player glared at suspiciously as if he was searching me to see if I was telling the truth, but then he eased up.

"Well... I guess that makes sense," said the player. "So anyway, how do I get in?"

"It's pretty simple really," you said. "Word on the street is that there's a place where red players go to hang out in peace. A place called... The Black Market.

"The Black Market?!" the player said paling a little.

He looked around nervously and then whispered furiously to me.

"Seriously?! Why the hell do you need to go there of all places?!"

"I can't really say," you said quickly coming up with another lie. "My superiors told me to locate The Black Market, so I can locate some red players and have them join up with us. Which is why I need your help. The problem I have is that I need a password to get in. If you can tell me the location and a password to get in, I'll personally see to it that my superiors can make you into a high ranking general."

The moment he heard what you said, the player smiled. You smiled in your head internally happy that the fish had taken the bait.

"All right," said the player. "I'll tell you the location and the password, but you didn't hear this from me got it? The last thing I need is a guild breathing down my neck. Plus if anyone else found out about me, I'm a dead man."

"Don't worry. You have my word," you said.

"Alright," said the player. "I know about the location because I happened to see one player head towards it. It close to a bar a dark part of town. Just go down the alley and make a right and you'll see the door to the place in the corner."

"Good," I said. "Now what about the password?"

"OK. Listen closely. This is the password," said the player.

Then the player whispered in my ear the password. When I heard it, my eyes widened a little in surprise.

"Are you serious?" I asked. "That's the password?"

The player nodded. "Yeah. It sounds weird I know, but trust me I got the password for a reliable source. It's guaranteed to get you in."

"I... see," you said. "In any case, thank you kindly."

"So... am I in?" the player asked. "Am I in Laughing Coffin now?"

"Not just yet," I said. "First I have to confirm if what you told me is true. If it is, I will come and introduce you to my superiors. Until then, pretend you never saw me. Got it?"

"Um... yes sir," said the player.

And with that, I turned around and walked away. As soon as I was far enough away from the player, I set out a shaky breath.

"Holy shit... I can't believe I managed to pull it off. I didn't think I would be able to get the info," you said to yourself. "In any case, I gotta go and find Asuna and relay the information I obtained. She's gonna have a field day with this."

Then you raced off to find her.

1113322222222222222222221112111211111122.content:
"Hey you there," said the player. "I ain't seen you around these parts. Where you come from?"

"Oh nothing special," you replied. "I was invited by another member from Laughing Coffin. Apparently he recognized my skills as a player and so here I am."

"Oh really?" said the player who sat down next to you. "How do I know that you ain't some good to shoes player? Need I remind you that you have a green marker."

"Don't be deceived by appearances," you said. "My marker may be green, but I'm a lot more evil than you think. Why do you think I'm here in the first place? I'm here because a player ripped me off the other day by stealing some of my gear. Boy did that make me mad. So I got even by setting him up in a trap. I lured him to a dragon's cave and left him there for dead. Little bastard got what he deserved."

The player stared at me. Then he smiled.

"You know what? I like you kid," he said. "You take no crap for no one and have even mastered the undercover business. Welcome to the club kid. Hey come on over and meet the new guy boys"

The player beckoned a couple players over and three more showed up much to your dismay. You wanted to tear these guys apart, but you kept your cool and stayed silent.

"So he's the newbie eh?" asked one. "Doesn't look much to me."

"Not so fast," said the leader. "This guy lured a player to his death and he didn't even have to do anything."

"Hah. Come on. This kid don't look like he could hurt a fly," sneered the first. "I can top that."

Then the player began telling the story about how his crime was worse than yours was. You rolled your eyes underneath the cloak.

"Oh please," you thought. "Just what I needed. Story time in the killer bar."

Then you got an idea.

"Wait a minute... maybe I can find some information on these guys... if I can find the one who attacked me and the others..."

And so you listened in on their stories. The first one told me how he killed a couple of players just for the hell of it. Another player told me the story of how a player stole a girl he liked and then killed the player she loved without her knowing. You squeezed your hands really trying hard not to kick their asses for their crimes. You wanted more than anything to make these players pay for their crimes, but you stood still listening to everything they told.

"And so I... kill him and took it back!" finished another.

When he finished telling the story, all the players oooed in admiration.

"That was just evil."

"Heartless."

Then another voiced chimed in. This voice sounded gruff and sinister in some way.

"Oh please. I can top that story. Let me tell you boys a real story," he said.

"Oh brother..." you thought. "I'm not getting anywhere listening to these stories. I better get out of here before I get sick to my stomach."

You were just about to get up when you heard the player speak.

"This happened to me back at the 55th floor in Western Mountains..."

Your eyes widened and you felt your heart jump as the player continued.

"Me and a group of players were assigned to take out this guild called the Marauders. Reason being was because two players are considered to be in leagues with the beater Kirito maybe even beaters themselves. These players that were supposed to take out were named Dodger and Kestrel. We found them along with some girl. She was a nice piece of work if you get my drift. So we tried to have some fun, but that Kestral guy was tough. He got back up and tried to get away, but then... all of a sudden a dragon attacked!"

Everyone who was listening to story was quiet taking in everything what the player was saying. You on the other hand stayed silent your fist shaking from anger as the memories of what happened before resurfaced in your head.

"Then that's when things went to hell," the player continued. "The dragon incinerated everything in it's path. All of us fell one after the other including out leader. Everyone was gone either from running away or dead. Everyone except for those bastards Kestrel, Dodger and that little bitch."

Your eyes glinted and flinched a little from the player calling Liz that name. You kept silent telling yourself to keep calm, but you were very close to snapping any minute.

"Those guys in a trap laid by the dragon and were desperately trying to pull up their friend. That's when I took advantage and got my revenge on the bastard," said the player with a twisted grin on his face. "So I attacked the girl. I stabbed her and tried to push her off, but I ended up falling in the process. Luckily I fell in the snow so I was lucky to survive. After that I teleported out using a crystal."

"What happened to that Dodger guy? He die?"

"Who the hell cares?" said the player. "For all I know that bastard got impaled by a crystal and died for all I care."

"What really was a shame was that you let that girl go."

"Yeah. I should've taken her with me. Then she and I could've done lots of stuff together."

Everyone laughed except for you. At this point your anger reached a boiling point. There was no way you were gonna take these guys talking crap about your friends. Especially Liz. That's when...
1113322222222222222222221112111211111122.title: A player comes up to you...

1113322222222222222222221112111211111122.content:
You took out your sword and then shoved him into a chair with a bunch of players staring. "Been a while, hasn't it? I heard that little tale of yours. We need to talk.", you threatened.

You heard someone unsheeth their blade, to which you quickly drew out yours and knocked the player flat on the ground. From that point on, most of the players either ran for it, or teleported out of there. A few though stuck around to finish you off. A couple players lunged at you, but you swung at them so hard they knocked into each other on the fall downward.

Just as you turned to check on your lead, he was seen running off while a few more players went to try and muscle you out. Luckily Asuna, finally ditching her disguise along with other Knights of The Blood Oath, fought them off. Just before the scumbag could exit the Market, you stabbed your sword into the door, cornering him. He walked back slowly seeing your sword cutting off his way out. You took him by the neck and rammed him onto the wall.

"Where's your buddies?", you asked.

"Who knows, bullying a player for some loose change.", you squeezed his throat tighter. "Uhhggghhh. I don't know honest! They just got stated weeding out the weak over there and screw-ups like me don't know shit no more. We got nothing to do with them now."

Just then a hand with a black sleeve placed itself over the arm choking the life out of your prisoner. "That's enough. I think you got your answer."

"Were taking him in. I want hideouts, names, everything you knew.", you kept going.

"Kestrel! You're finished here. Go home.", Asuna ordered.

"Fine. Get back to me."

"Keep that attitude up, I might forget.", she replied. You left the Market feeling overwhelmed with anger, so you headed somewhere to clear your head.

"Hey Kirito."

"I heard you guys are plotting to wipe out the biggest PK guild in SAO. I figured this was a start, but you beat me to it.", he said.

"Thanks for stopping him. He's letting this be too personal."

"I don't do the whole counseling thing too well. But I'll keep an eye on him.", he said.

While you were walking to the floor square you couldn't help but be peppered with flashes of how Dodger died back on the 55th floor. You thought for the longest time, putting away that monstrous guild would be enough but it only made you more angry. So you felt the best way to heal from that experience was to go and meet with a friend.
1113322222222222222222221112111211111122.title: Other...

1113322222222222222222221112111211111122.content:
Kirito followed you as you stormed off out of the black market. As you left, the unbridled anger for Laughing Coffin only boiled inside, venturing on the precipice of exploding. You teleported to the first floor, where your friend Pulsar was still tending to the younger players. You entered his establishment where you saw him making supper for the children.

“Hey Kestrel. What’s new?”, Pulsar acknowledged.

“We got a lead. Someone can take us to their old hideout.”

“That’s good news.”

“Getting it wasn’t very easy for me.”, you said as your hands started shacking a bit uncontrollably. Your tried to suppress it without Pulsar noticing.

“Why is that bud?”, he noticed your hands much to his concern.

“Sigh…. This guy, he was there the night they killed Dodger. He fell into the nest before Dodger did.”

“Does that mean-“

“No. He used a teleporting crystal. Which means Dodger got incinerated from the fire. No way he could be alive.”

“Sigh….. Sorry I just-“

“I know buddy I miss him too. Not a day goes by that I don’t think about wanting to go back and think of a way to save him.”

“Hey Kestrel, do you think we will ever go back to reality?”, Pulsar asked.

“If I’m being real, I have no clue. If our guild goes down, then I think nobody will ever be able to make it out. Asuna says those of us leading the charge have to live and preserver so that with each level conquered, we get closer to going home. I’ve only been with them a few days, and I trust those people with my very life. We all want to get out of here and were the only ones who can make it happen.”, you confessed.

“That’s great to hear. For a moment I thought you thought it was impossible.”

“Pulsar there won’t be a day spent here that I won’t find a way to break us out of this thing.”

“I know man. I just don’t want to spend the rest of my life living it easy here, while you go storming off and getting yourself killed. Hey man, you still using that old sword? What happened to the one you had from –“

“Still in the works. She said that we need to go back and get that material again. I’m thinking of sending an escort to accompany her there. I don’t think I can go back there. Not until I get justice.”, you declared.

“Well good hunting (Name).”, for the first time in months you heard someone call you by your real name. It gave you a brief pause as you were reminded of what was awaiting you out of this virtual nightmare.

“You too Jack.”, you said calling him by his real name.”

As you walked out you found Kirito facing the front door of the orphanage. “Asuna wanted me to make sure you didn’t do anything reckless.”

“No, I’m good. I just needed to see a friend to help me shape up.”, then you had an idea.

“Hey do you need a new weapon?”

“Not really. My sword is fine.”

“Well either way, check over to Lisbeth’s Blacksmith shop. She’s the best I know of.”

“Hmm. I’ll check it out when I get a chance.”

“Sure, but later down the line can I ask a favor from you, hehe I kinda need some help.”

“I’m not really big on doing favors for people I don’t know, but I guess Asuna would appreciate it. Alright. When I’m free just ring me up.”

“Thanks.”
1113322222222222222222221112111211111122.title: You go to see Pulsar

1113322222222222222222221112111211111122.content:
A few days later, Lisbeth was sitting in her shop inspecting her swords. She had nothing else better to do, so she decided to take a once over with her inventory. Just then she heard the chime of her door open, she came to the door and was greeted by Asuna.

"Hey there Asuna. What can I do for you today?" asked Lisbeth.

"Sorry to bother you Lis, but could you give my sword a tune up?" asked Asuna.

"Sure thing."

Then Lisbeth began sharpening Asuna's rapier. After a few minutes she was done. She sheathed the rapier and handed it back to Asuna.

"There we go," said Lisbeth. "All finished."

"Thanks Lis. You're the best," said Asuna paying her.

"Anytime," said Lisbeth. "You know... that reminds me. How come you're not at the front lines today? You're supposed to be out hunting with the guild."

Asuna looked to the side before giving Lisbeth a response. "Well... I had to take the day off. Let's just say I'm going to meet someone today."

Lisbeth raised a brow and then noticed that Asuna was wearing a pair of earrings that she had never seen before. She smirked and nudged Asuna in the arm teasingly.

"I bet you have a meeting. Who's the lucky guy eh?"

"No it's not like that," said Asuna who was slightly blushing.

Then they both heard the chime of a bell.

"Oh no! I have to get going!" said Asuna as she quickly dashed out towards the door.

"Must be nice having some precious," said Lisbeth quietly to herself.

"Huh? Did you say something?" asked Asuna.

LiIsbeth quickly shook her head. "No it's nothing. Hurry and go on. Don't keep your date waiting."

"It's not like that! You're misunderstanding!" said Asuna. "See ya!" And then she left leaving Lisbeth alone.

"I wonder if I'll find someone special?" she said to herself. She let her thoughts drift until you cam into her mind. "Speaking of which, I wonder what or how Kestrel's doing? It's been a couple days since I've seen him."
1113322222222222222222221112111211111122.title: Continue..

1113322222222222222222221112111211111122.content:
You were still hunting for some information about the people who were there the day that Dodger died by going through raids and quests. So far there was next to nothing as far as information goes. However it wasn't a total loss. You got some half-way decent gear as well some good money. Eventually you decided to take a break and try and rest. You were in a tavern in town on the 47th floor drinking your worries away.

"Haaah!" you sighed. "Even though this is only a game, this drink's quite refreshing!"

As you continued to drink, a certain player came inside and saw you drinking. He sighed and then came to your table sitting by you.

"You must be enjoying yourself," he said.

"Oh hey Kirito," you replied setting your cup down. "Don't worry. It's non-alcoholic. Then again in this game, everything's not really real anyway. So. You got any news for me or did you jut come here to check up on me?"

"A little bit of both I guess," said Kirito. "Asuna wanted to know how you were doing considering the fact that you've been working your tail off."

"Well I'm fine," you said. "No need to worry about me."

"I see," said Kirito. "By the way, have you gotten any good gear lately from your raids?"

"Not really," you said. "All I got was some of the lousy stuff. If anything the only thing I got that was actually worth anything was the cloak I'm wearing. I was actually hoping I'd get a decent weapon, but I have rotten luck."

"If you're looking for a good weapon then why don't you get one?" asked Kirito. "I mean you instead of waiting for a drop in a raid, you could just get materials to make gear yourself."

"I guess that's not bad idea," you said. "But where am I gonna find some good material for a weapon?"

You sipped into your cup thoughtfully trying to come up with some ideas. Then you got an idea. You got up and left the money you owed on the table and left the table.

"Where you going?" asked Kirito.

"To get a new weapon," you said. "And to do that, I'm gonna need help and I know who to ask.."
1113322222222222222222221112111211111122.title: Back with you....

1113322222222222222222221112111211111122.content:
She was dusting her swords and display cases making sure that were extra clean and neat. When she finished, she stood back and admired her work.

"Job well done Lisbeth," she said to herself. "Now your store's looking nice and clean."

Then she heard the door open and the bell chiming after and you entered. Thinking that you was a customer, she immediately bowed politely smiling showing good customer service.

"Hello and welcome to Lisbeth's Blacksmiths Shop," she said.

"Hey there Lisbeth," you said. "Nice to see you."

"Hey! Kestrel! It's so good to see you!" said Lisbeth. "It's been a couple of days since I saw you. How have you been?"

"Pretty fine," you said. "More or less. Lisbeth I have a favor I need to ask you. You mind helping me out?"

"Sure. What's up?"

"I need a weapon. Well a stronger weapon then what I already got," you explained. "I was wondering if you did custom orders."

"Well... I can," said Lisbeth thoughtfully. "But the metal prices are kinda expensive these days and you don't look like you have much money Kestrel."

"I don't care about the price. I just need a good weapon made as soon as you can if possible," you replied.

Lisbeth hummed putting a finger to her chin in thought. Then she had an idea. "Well I think I... no wait. Never mind."

"What is it?" you asked. "I'm willing to try anything. Please tell me Lisbeth."

Lisbeth hesitated then she looked at you with a serious expression. "I can get you the material needed to make a high caliber sword, but... we have to go back to a certain location and I think you're not gonna like it."

There was a long silence. You knew exactly where Lisbeth meant.

"I'm aware of where we have to go. Which was why I was thinking of sending you with an escort."

"But why?" asked Lisbeth. "Why can't you come with me?"

"You know why Lisbeth," you said looking away from her. "I... can't go back to that place. Not after what happened."

"But... I don't want an escort to go with me," said Lisbeth. "I can understand why you wouldn't want to go, but I'd much rather go with you. Besides it's not really your sword if you don't work hard to get it don't you think?"

"I... guess so, but..."

"Look. I get it. You don't wanna go because of what happened to Dodger, but... I think it's better that you come with me. It's your sword and it wouldn't feel right if I went with someone else and... it's pretty much my fault as it is yours that Dodger's gone. So I think we both should go. For Dodger's sake."

You looked at Lisbeth a little surprised at her words. Everything that she had said was true except for the part of her sharing the blame. It wouldn't be right sending someone else to do your request for your sword. You looked at her placing your hands on her shoulders.

"First of all, it wasn't your fault," you said. "Secondly, you're right. It wouldn't be right of me to send an escort to do my job for me. I'll go, but... don't expect me to like it."

Lisbeth nodded. "Alright. This time I'll do my best not to slow you down. We will get that metal no matter what!"
1113322222222222222222221112111211111122.title: At Lisbeth's shop...

choices: She decides to listen to you.
She refuses to listen to you.
1113322222222222222222221112111211111122.content:
You and Lisbeth soon arrived at the 55th floor. It was as cold as you remembered and you still couldn't stand it even when you were bundled up. Lisabeth looked at you in a blank stare.

"Seriously? How could you feel so cold?" she deadpanned.

"Speak for yourself!" you snapped. "How are you not cold?! You're practically wearing nothing, but a skirt!"

"I'm just used to it is all," said Lisabeth. "Now come on. We got a dragon to find so try to keep up OK?"

"All right I'm coming."

As the two of you walked along the path, you couldn't help but remember the bad memories you made here. Especially the part where you let Dodger fall to his doom. This made you clench your hands tentatively. You didn't want to be here more than anything, but you kept on walking.

Soon enough you both came to a field of crystals. Lisbeth couldn't help, but admire them as she looked at her reflection.

"Wow... this place is beautiful!" she said as she ran forward spinning around looking like child finding a brand new place to explore which also caused her skirt to flutter. You didn't pay attention to Lisbeth. You were busy staying on guard in case the dragon came attacking.

"Come on Kestral. You could lighten up a little," said Lisbeth.

"Listen Lisbeth," you said. "I know I said that you could come with me, but if that dragon happens to show up, I want you to have your teleportation crystal ready OK?"

"What? Why?! Don't tell me you're planning to send me back cuz it's a little late for that," said Lisbeth.

"I don't plan to. I just want you to stay out of the way. I'll deal with the dragon by myself," you said.

Lisbeth's eyes widened. "You can't be serious! I'm not a baby or some kind of newb!" she said indignantly. "If I want to help you then I'm gonna-"

"Just do as I said alright?!"

Lisbeth jumped with surprise from you raising your voice at her. Feeling a little bad for yelling you then explained.

"Look. The last thing I wanna do is put you in danger," you said quietly. "So many people have already lost their lives in this game. I already lost Dodger in this place. I don't want to lose you either. So please do as I say and stay hidden. And if things get too crazy I want you to teleport out of here and leave me behind, OK?"

Lisbeth stared at you. Then...
