11133222222222222222222221122211.content: As you go about your normal day a strange looking oval sphere appears in the middle of a public area. To your confusion nobody except you sees this anomaly. You begin to get curious and touch it to see if it would react. At first nothing happens, but suddenly it opens and in the blink of an eye pulls you inside! You begin to fall into darkness until you could see that it wasn't a bottomless pit but a 20 story drop from the sky, in just mere seconds you were about to hit the ground but once you did...you didn't feel anything. You were completely devoid of harm, and all that surrounded you was smoke. But now your life was about to taken on a unique turn...
11133222222222222222222221122211.title: Welcome to Tristain

111332222222222222222222211222111.content:
"Ah?! What on earth is this? Under what kind of circumstance would a mere peasant be summoned as MY familiar?!", said the girl in front of you. You could not understand her as she was speaking a mysterious unknown language, or not. You didn't take any language courses in your world. You sat on the ground in confusion trying to figure out what was happening, why you wound up there and, who the heck were these people.

"Hey can anyone tell me what's going on in english please?", you spoke. Apparently the language barrier was a problem on their end as well. As they seemed to not understand what you just said.

"Mr. Colbert I am a triangle class fire mage and I refuse to have this peasant as my familiar. Can't I just summon something else again?", the girl spoke out in disdain.

"I'm afraid that is not possible.", Colbert answered.

"HA! Take that Zerbst now watch me beat you at your own game!", a girl with long pink hair boasted.

"Oh please at any rate I doubt even you can't summon a familiar any better than mine! Louise the Zero."

"Hey I can't understand a word you are saying can we get a translator or something please?!", you asked.

"Ms. Zerbst you now must complete the ritual.", the other students laughed a bit much to her annoyance. But she went along with it regardles, she waved her hair back and spoke the incantation.

"My name is Kirche Augusta Frederica von Anhalt-Zerbst.", she pointed her wand at your forehead, "Oh triangle the rolls through my powers, bless this individual and make him my familiar." She kneeled down and placed her hand onto your cheek. She came closer to your face and was going to kiss you.

"Hey wait! I don't know you, whats going on! Hey stop! What-mmmph", she placed a soft kiss on you sealing the contract as your familiar. Then all of a sudden you passed out.
111332222222222222222222211222111.title: You become the familiar of Kirche von Zerbst

choices: Run into another oddly dressed person
1113322222222222222222222112221111.content:
You woke up in a room, you felt weak for a bit but you felt seriously hot and felt yourself lying on the floor. It was dimly lit so it suggested that it must be night by now. Looking around you finally noticed the girl from before who kissed you. Still confused and demanding an explanation you quickly stood up and yelled out the usual questions who, what, where, why and how.

"Oh? Finally awake. Honestly the fact that I needed to carry you myself without anyone lending a finger was outright insulting. Just who are you and where exactly do you hail from?", neither of you could understand the other still as it grew irritating to the both of you.

"What I want to understand is WHERE AM I? And what was with the first base treatment?"

"Ugh you can't seem to pick up our language. Must have learned to speak through grunts and moans. Oh well maybe this spell will fix that.", in a jiff she flicked her wand and finally both could speak the same tongue. "There, casting that language spell was all that I had to do in order to get you to understand me."

"Hey! NOW I can understand you. But wait what was with the spell sort?"

A short explanation later...

"Ok I'm in Tristain, you are Kirche, I am your familiar, you summoned me here through magic, and I must do whatever you tell me to."

"Exactly. Now I know I may look irresistible to you but I am reserved by a lot of suitors whom I have plans to meet with around the afternoon. So I am pretty much taken, and don't worry I will be sure to lock the room whenever I have company. But of course you may be a familiar but still a peasant none the less."

"You mentioned that peasant nobility system you live with. So basically I have about as much rights as a slave?"

"Well not to that extreme. I mean most masters treat their familiars with affection and respect. But a peasant won't be given that treatment since after all peasantry still applies even to familiars I suppose."

"Well that is not something I will not stand.", you replied with heavy snark and sarcasm.

"Oh don't act like that. I mean I won't treat you like a pet it's just hard to deal with taking care of a human who happens to be a peasant who turns out to be a familiar. Huh? Where did?", she saw you had left the room and most likely dashed off. "RRRRRRRRRRRRRRRGGGGGGGGGGGHHHHHHHHHH! How is it that I got stuck with this familiar?! Surely this should have happened to Louise the Zero!"
1113322222222222222222222112221111.title: Continue....

11133222222222222222222221122211112.content:
You clearly wanted to get the hell out of this crazy place and knew the best way was to leave on your own and find a way to call someone that you were kidnapped by a bunch of occult freaks. But as you were running down the staircase leading to the grounds, in your haste you crashed into someone else. You both fell and collapsed on the ground like you tackled each other in a football game. A little wind knocked out but fine regardless you noticed you ran over a small pink haired girl wearing another black robe. She was in much worse shape than you were, out of compassion you asked if she was ok but she couldn't speak or breath.

Just as it hit you that you needed to keep moving you found yourself frozen in place. You wanted to move your body but it remained still as a statue. "Hey!", you gritted your teeth as even your mouth was immobile. Turns out Kirche caught up just in time after you bumped into, "Louise the Zero? What are you doing?", Kirche said.

Finally coming to she angrily replied to you, "YOU UNCIVILIZED DOG! HOW DARE YOU ATTACK A NOBLEMAN!"

"Sorry, ie ault.", you answered.

"Zerbst did you try and send your familiar to attack me! That is low even for you!"

"Your mistaken, my familiar ran off on his own. It's not my fault."

"Speaking of which I wasn't able to summon any familiar at all after you had summoned yours! Yet here you have this peasant instead of something more in line with your distastful personality."

"Don't blame me for your failings as a mage. You didn't summon a familiar plain and simple, which means you are never going to be full fledged one in your life."

"THAT IS UNCALLED FOR! I know you have something to do with it I know you do and I am going to get to the bottom of it! Unless you admit you stole my familiar!", Louise threatened.

"Go ahead I have nothing to hide. You are just grasping at straws in order to justify your pathetic magic skills. And as for you, you are coming with me and staying put."

"I not a statue! Get e outta hereeeeeeee!", you screamed.

Kirche placed you back in here room where you still remained in that running pose. "Hehe, you know I think you would make a decent decoration.", she joked.

"Ery hunny now quit with the sell!", you demanded. Kirche waved her wand and you were back to normal. "Whew. Ok I want to go home! I don't know what you did to make me stiff or where on earth I am but I know you can take me home!"

"Earth? What's that a peasant fictional world? Look like it or not you belong to me now. If you behave I can allow you to see your family but not if you run off again. And for the record I find running away from your master to be a serious offense. So I will punish you later when I think of a good thing to balance the scale. For now I have a date by the indoor fountain and am already running late because of you.", she left frustrated but you were just as agitated.

You opened the door ounce she left but somehow the door knob couldn't twist, probably a 'magic' trick to keep you from leaving again. You though tmaybe out the window would do the trick but as soon as you saw the sky you knew escape was impossible. TWO MOONS! One red and one blue one clearly larger in size and one significantly smaller. Tatooine this wasn't, but just as hopeless to escape from in your current situation.

You looked around to find a blanket and pillow on the floor, your sleeping arrangements you assumed. The blanket was big enough to wrap around to make the floor a softer place to lay so it wasn't too bad. But in all seriousness, this place and these people were from a whole other world.
11133222222222222222222221122211112.title: Not in Kansas anymore

choices: A maid comes to your defense...
111332222222222222222222211222111121.content:
"Wash women clothing? The things you don't expect to do when you wake up in the morning.", you said aloud to yourself. After you tried running away Kirche gave you the punishment of doing her laundry for your disobedience. She let you out with it early before the academy had their morning meal with this world's sun rising over the walls of this fortress. You weren't very pleased with your current circumstances as you were literally stuck in a whole new world you had no idea existed and you were being treated like a second class citizen. Finally when dawn wrapped over the school, you had finished. You brought it back up to the right floor but you forgot exactly which room was hers.

You laid down Kirche's laundry and tried remembering which one was it. They had no number system so it made it a little harder to find. You tried knocking on one but you were met with some hostile greetings. The one you knocked on was the wrong one, "Oh! You. Your Kirche's weird familiar, sorry but Kirche's room isn't this one."

"Mind pointing where-", the girl slammed the door right in your face. "Ok then, still lost and apparently people here are ALL jerks.", soon as you said that Kirche peeked out her door seeing you trying to get in the wrong room. You picked up her laundry while she glared at you with an annoyed look.

"Good. You did a fair job, you can assort them in my drawers when we return."

"No thanks, I'm done looking through your wardrobe thank you very much."

"Fine. I suppose you washing and folding was enough. Now come, were having our morning meal."

"Oh thank goodness I am starving!", later you made your way into the cafeteria where a bountiful feast was awaiting at very long lunch tables. You were dying to eat what was on the plate when Kirche finally sat down, however she halted you from sinking your teeth into anything. "Hey, I'm hungry what's the idea?!", Kirche pointed down with the same annoyed look. You saw a broken plate covered in dirt, the other students who were watching this laughed at your position. However you drew the line there and then, "Ha ha! Not happening, I'm sitting and eating like the rest of you."

"Grrrr! You ARE aware you are a peasant! A familiar does not have the same perks as a noble.", Kirche explained.

You postured and sat on the chair next to her leaning back, "If I'm stuck here I will sit and eat where I please! Hear that! No one tells me what to do!", you said acting large and in charge enjoying the role reversal however you found yourself incapable of moving once again. "Mmmph mmph MMMMMPH!", you fell back landing flat on the ground. The loud laughter from the other students only made you detest the people here more and more.
111332222222222222222222211222111121.title: Morning...

1113322222222222222222222112221111211.content:
After that humiliating display you stormed outside when you finally could move. Personally you were sick of how you were being treated and grew to really hate Kirche. She showed no respect and used her magic to enforce her will twice, it was by this point you hoped that you could get a chance to give a piece of your mind against some noble to let a little bit of anger out of your system. But then again, not every person there probably deserved to be randomly told off to so you decided to walk around the grounds and vent your anger.

"Oh waiter!", said a student dining outside.

"Not a waiter moron.", you replied griting your teeth.

"Ah! Well clearly, huh? Oh wait your that peasant familiar Kirche summoned. Nevermind, my honest mistake. I mean clearly a mere peasant like you must be less refined."

"Oh wait I mistook you for a moron, uhh."

"Lord Guchie to you."

"Riiiiiiiight, sorry for mistaking you for a moron when you were Noblemen of pristine, snooty, and prikish stature.", you snarkly remarked.

"Ah! Now hold on you! You dare insult a Noble? If you have any manners I'd suggest you apologize or suffer the consequences."

"I'm not going to. I only give what I am delivered by others, so if you act like a jerk then I'll return the favor."

"Apologizing to a peasant is beneath me. You without kindness deserve none from a respected Noble like me."

"Guiche was it?"

"Mm? OOOFFF!", you hurled a chair right at him.

"Like I said, I treat people how they treat me.", you smugly smiled crossing your arms. Guiche got up and pointed a rose at you in defense like you were threatening his life. Being a real mage meant he might be prepared to fight to the death if you meant to seriously harm him but a flower didn't look that harmful as a means to retaliate.

"You cad! How dare you strike a Noble! If you intend to fight then how about we settle this for real instead of cheaply taking shots when the others back is turned!"

"Oooooo! I'm shaking in fear.", you mockingly gloated.

"Grrrr! Do you accept a duel sir?"

"Yeah I'm going to show you and everyone else that I am not some pesky familiar who can be ordered around like a lap dog. I accept!"

"Very well then.", a crowd of students all huddled around you and Guiche. Guiche waved his flower and a petal came out and touched the ground. It then glowed and suddenly an armor plated knight came from the ground. Apparently that rose was his wand. "I am Guiche the brass so the brass knight shall be your opponent. I have no intention of letting you back out after you assaulted me with a chair!"

"Hold on!", Kirche said nonchalantly stepping in. "Guiche my familiar is a little hot headed but he meant no disrespect."

"Yes I did!"

"He is just getting accustomed to how things work around here being a familiar and all."

"Not a chance!"

"And I swear he will apologize."

"Negative!"

"Forgive me Kirche but he attacked me, and therefore he finishes what he started.", Guiche formally explained.

"Bring it you mook!", you egged him on to start the duel but then that brass knight knocked the wind right out of you shutting you up. ">Gasp< Hookay now were even.", you gasped. Then it kept whaling on you hitting and kicking you all over. It stomped you and you had nothing to fend it off with.

"I suppose that equals the pain you inflicted on me, therefore I shall be more fair now.", Guiche waved his wand again this time he created a sword. "If you wish to continue fighting pick it up. Or say your sorry and then I shall be merciful.", he offered.

"Guiche as interesting as this may be, he is still my familiar so I would prefer you not kill him even though he offended you.", Kirche said.

"It is up to him. Even if he refuses to yield I won't kill him, just teach him a fair lesson.", Guiche boasted.

You felt your arms and face sore and bruised. You had a hard time standing and moving but you were determined to prove yourself. You weren't a slave! You stood up, picked up the sword and yelled, "Shut up and fight!" Kirche was shocked as soon as you said that knowing Guiche wouldn't let his minion pull any punches. But to everyone's surprise when you slashed your sword it cut right through the knight! Suddenly now, you felt the pain go away, you felt nimbler, more adept with the weapon. Guiche and Kirche were utterly amazed as were you.

Guiche then summoned a half dozen more knights to stop you but you carved right passed all of them and held your sword over at Guiche! "GAH! No! Please! Don't kill me! Ahhhh!", he cowered and fell on his bum.

"Not going to do that! Just proving a point, so don't go below the belt like that again. And hey," you extended your hand, "I got too hostile with throwing a chair at you."

Guiche was unsure of what to do or say. First you insult him, fight him, now wanting to make peace? Frankly he was too afraid to do anything. The crowd cheered at the fact a peasant beat a Noble. Kirche looked at you with much more interest now, perhaps she pegged a better familiar then she had thought.
1113322222222222222222222112221111211.title: Defending your Honor

11133222222222222222222221122211112111.content:
For the next few days things had started getting better for you, since now you were the talk of the servants and students. Some either ignored you while others whispered about their opinion of you winning against Guiche. But out of all the people who showed the biggest change it was Kirche who had a change of your treatment as a familiar. Now she let you sit beside her eating the same meals she ate along with her classmates, she appreciated your work when she tasked you with her extra requests, and didn't mouth off at you.

"Finished folding the laundry. Gotta say I had no idea how much I took washing and drying machines for granted back home. Doing it all by hand is a pain.", you said after delivering her laundry.

"Thank you (Name), you are such a great familiar.", Kirche replied.

"Is that all?"

"Actually your not going to sit around all day until I ask you for something. From now on you will accompany me to my classes."

"What why?"

"Well we see each other around when I'm attending to my studies and only interact every so often while were working. I feel we should interact whenever we can. Being your master I feel the need to get to know you (Name). After that duel with Guiche, you had me so...interested in you.", she said.

"Sigh....well fine I guess."

You attended her class with you sitting in an extra seat next to Kirche while the teacher lectured about how many elements a mage can use at a time. it meant nothing to you but it was interesting to know how mages operated. The teacher then said that most of the students could actually use at least two, but then Kirche rose up and said, "Excuse me but that isn't entirely true since one student here actually can't handle any element." The whole class starred at Louise who sat alone. Given the context it seemed that her attitude from before manifested from her lack of popularity or infamy as the underdog.

Soon as class ended you walked to the grounds with Kirche but you noticed Louise wandering off by herself. "Kirche may I be excused?", you asked.

"Oh not now when we finally can get to know one another my dear familiar. Are you sure you have to leave now?", she asked.

"I won't be long.", you headed off.

"Hurry on back!", she waved however her smile turned to anger when she noticed you went to see Louise.

"Louise!", you called to her.

"Oh what do you want familiar of Zerbst!"

"I just wanted to say that I'm not a fan of what Kirche did in class earlier. I just figured out that your not the most liked girl in school because you don't have a strong affinity to magic."

Louise was taken aback by reaching out with your sincere kindness which she hadn't expected. "Uh thank you, but I still stand by with that you were meant to be my familiar. Kirche somehow stole you from me."

"When did you summon your familiar?"

"Exact time Zerbst decided to summon hers they said. I only tried to summon mine in front of her to shove it in her face that I could. I know you had to be mine because I asked for a familiar unlike any other with a strong and noble heart."

"What did Kirche want in hers?"

"Probably something that could stand her."

"In that case she didn't get that from me. Hehe.", you shrugged.

''Well as much as I'd like to figure out why I have no familiar I should go now and you should return to your 'master'."

You two left on friendlier terms this time which made you happy that someone other than Kirche you could on some level casually speak to. You went back to Kirche who was sitting down with her two other friends Tabitha and Montmorency. Kirche invited you to sit with them and join in on their conversation, "It's fascinating to officially meet you (Name), I'm Montmorency."

"I'm Tabitha.", she introduced herself without making eye contact and starring at her book. Behind her was a big blue dragon perfectly sitting without making much movement. Montmorency's familiar was a total contrast in size with it being a little toad.

"These are my friends (Name).", Kirche introduced them.

"Pleasure.", you simply replied not sure what to say. You weren't sure how mages talked casually, seriously, or sensitively. It felt best to just let them continue and be in the background but it didn't help your case since you were the main topic and Tabitha was doing the same thing. So you answered any questions as detailed as possible to try and get a fix on what you could start leading in with.

It finally became comfortable when Kirche began asking, "What do like about being my familiar?", it seemed very odd given the master was asking the sort of slave if he liked his job. Things may have improved but it still was a job you got forced into without knowing anything about it.

"How often do you see her in her best outfits?", Montmorency teased.

"Not often since I walk out of the room until she's dressed and in bed. And no I don't care how nice looking she is that still won't shake my opinion on being your familiar."

"So you think she's nice looking? Most of the men would say that is a total understatement.", she teased again.

"Hey! Don't drive this where I think you're driving this!", you replied.

"Oh now I must say I'm shocked and hurt. I'm only nice looking to you?", Kirche started getting in on the teasing.

"No! You look much better than nice! Wait! What am I saying?!"

"The truth.", Tabitha interjected.

"Not you too!"

"Oh now I must say I'm starting to be a little flattered now (Name). Tell me more.", Kirche inquired.

"Yeah tell us.", Montmorency said.

"Listen! Kirche doesn't work me to death and at least is letting me be part of her group of friends which I appreciate. But at the start she was rude, snobby, and used magic on me which I was seriously mad about both times!", you softly but directly spoke with a raised volume. Kirche reflected on her treatment and knew she had indeed treated you poorly at the start. Montmorency was fascinated by your experiences and and enjoyed your company. Finally the time slowly came to return to the room for the night, but Kirche asked you to wait 10 extra minutes before coming back. Montmorency asked if you could walk with her to her dorm room and then going back to Kirche's after. You agreed thinking it would kill time.

"So where do you hail from?", she asked.

"Huh?"

"What kingdom?"

"I'm from earth.", you answered.

"Earth Kingdom?"

"No no no a planet called earth. I didn't come from this world at all."

"Ha, you don't say. Who ever heard of a peasant from a whole different world coming to ours and being a familiar?"

"Let me guess not many?", you joked.

"None. If anything you must come from a nation enemy to Tristain if you are so secretive.", she deduced.

"I'm not from another nation I'm telling the truth."

"Well I have studied much of our worlds legends and history and I can tell you there is nothing relating to that crazy theory."

"Then your talking to a major discovery. Eh anyway what type of mage are you?", you asked trying to change the subject.

"Water, which makes sense given my familiar. Isn't that right Robin?". she stroked her little toad.

"Cute guy."

"Yep and the only guy who doesn't bug me."

"Who's the guy that does get on your nerves?"

"You met him already, Lord Guiche. He and I kind of dated but after your duel I learned he was two timing me with a first year. That jerk! I was so happy how you humiliated him after I pieced it together."

"That guy was a jerk."

Finally Montmorency was at her room she said goodbye and that it was nice meeting you and you went back to your room with Kirche.
11133222222222222222222221122211112111.title: Expanding Cast of Characters

111332222222222222222222211222111121111.content:
The moment you got into the room and returned from walking with Montmorency the room was dimly lit, and to top it off Kirche was in her night gown which was very provocative. You thought you walked in on her by accident but she waved her wand and shut the door. "Uhh Kirche did I come at a bad time because I should have knocked."

"Don't be silly (Name) I want you be here with me right now."

"What? Gah!", she walked toward you slowly, which suddenly in all the days you spent together never made you feel nervous.

"(Name) when I said I was interested in you, I meant that in a far more deeper way. I want to know everything about you (Name). And when I saw defend against Guiche and stood your ground against not only him but me as well...I found it so...attractive."

"You must be joking. Hey Kirche I know for sure that how you feel about me is one-sided so maybe you should hit the brakes on whatever it is your doing.", you said getting scared about where she was taking this.

"Oh don't try and deny it. You said so before I was more than nice looking. You may not know it or admit it but you feel as passionate as me. I went from Kirche the fever to Kirche the passion is just a small amount of time. But they say love comes so suddenly and (Name)....I am in love with you.", she said. Finally she pinned you to the wall with her arms leaned against the wall.

"No really don't feel that way about you Kirche. Besides master and servant relationships I hear never work out. So maybe your confusing compassion with admiration. Besides I can't like someone like you.", you said nervously but hastily.

Kirche stopped but reacted in a 180 fashion, "Can't love someone like me what is that supposed to mean?! Oh you can't tell me you prefer small ones to big! Is that why you met with Louise the Zero?!"

"There! That's why!"

"Oh so it's true! Well if your going after smaller breasts at least try and get with Tabitha. Vallier and my family are rivals so you being with them would be an embarrassment on my reputation."

"No! I mean that rude attitude toward Louise. She made a lousy first impression but I know what it feels to be ganged on by others, especially snotty people like you.", you explained.

"Now just hold on! I've given you more privileges than any familiar here! Yet you dare call me snotty?! Is that how you intend to speak to me?!"

"I said so before, I give what I am dealt."

Get out then sleep outside for all I care. A woman goes through all this work to make this night special and this is how you treat her."

As she said you slept outside, which was a lousy night as a result. It was cold and you were angry at how she was convinced what she said and did to Louise wasn't hurtful for her. It made you sick to think she was your master, but even more so she claimed to love you. You had no clue what to do now.
111332222222222222222222211222111121111.title: Unexpected turnout

1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.content:
Kirche was furious at having you resent her and rejecting her with gusto. She had never been so insulted or humiliated before that the fact that it occurred still seemed unbelievable. She paced around her room venting her fury trying to comprehend why you acted the way you did. "Grrrr! That ill-bred, uncultured, unclean, shabby looking familiar! No one in the history of my life has made me this irksome! Sigh....although he still is making it a challenge I find fetching.", she was mad but still attracted to how hard you were making it for her. (No pun intended)

Kirche was in a rare situation where she needed advice and she knew only one person whom she trusted most of all. She got dressed into her uniform and flew out her window thanks to her magic. She levitated herself to her friend Tabitha's room and gently knocked on her window. Luckily she was still awake so Tabitha let her in soon as Kirche knocked. "Tabitha, I need your help.", Kirche said with a mixture of excitement and plea.

"What?"

"(Name). I told him how I felt and now he won't talk to me. He thinks I am rude and snotty at Louise the Zero. And said he can never love anyone like that. What do you think he wants?", she asked genuinely wanting an answer to figure out your resentment.

"Your mean to Louise."

"So she's the worst mage in the academy. I only call it whenever anyone forgets this.", Tabitha stayed quiet, "Oh what? You think he would like it if I stopped advertising it?"

"Maybe."

"Maybe isn't good enough.", Kirche replied back.

"Yes."

"What? You think he wants me to be all buddy buddy with Louise the Zero?! I would rather befriend a dead cat! Yet he tries to make friends with her of all girls!", Tabitha remained quiet. "What is it? C'mon Tabitha don't make me guess what your thinking.", Tabitha remained silent. "Ugh! Do you really expect him to make me make peace with her?"

"Louise is (Name's) friend?"

"From what I gather, yes I believe so."

"And me?"

"What? Oh Tabitha darling of course he is your friend. He said nothing bad about you, and after all if anyone disapproved of you-", soon as Kirche heard what she spoke it hit her what you probably meant. To Kirche, Tabitha was her best friend and she would never leave her side for anything. Upon considering your connection to Louise may be similar or at least relatable Kirche learned she made a mistake. Kirche hugged Tabitha goodnight and went back to her own room. Kirche opened her dorm room door to see yo sleeping in a stack of hay beside the door. She waved her wand where you floated upward and gently landed in Kirche's bed. You were fast asleep so you didn't notice.

"My darling (Name) I think I see why you defended Louise. So now I will try to understand why, so that you will love me back. My darling.", Kirche whispered to you.
1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.title: No friend is thrown under the bus

1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.content:
You woke up comfortable in bed feeling very rested and refreshed. You wanted to stay in bed letting the weightlessness of the cushions lull you back asleep. Then it hit you, you didn't sleep in a bed last night. And the softness wasn't from the cushions. And the cushions weren't cushions at all! They were D cups at least! "AAAAHHHH!", you sprang out of bed in shock.

Kirche woke up scared thinking there was a drill or an attack only to learn you freaked out. "Oh? Ya know I figured the last thing you would do was flip out after sleeping with a girl."

"What the hell?! What is your malfunction?! Make up your mind on whether you want to punish or reward me if you consider that a reward!", you cried out.

"Listen I thought about what you said last night and I think you are right."

"Yeah well FYI I think- huh?"

"You heard right. No more tormenting Louise. I can't see the picture yet but I won't take down the frame. I will accept you two are good pals and I will deal with it. Just don't go pursuing any relationship though. I draw the line there."

"Since I don't plan to I suppose that is fair enough. And thanks?"

"Oh darling don't thank me. Tabitha deserves the credit. She should be a psychiatrist, after how remarkable her advice was."

"Uhh well ok I defiantly will."

"Now leave I have to dress for the day so if seeing me naked still makes you uncomfortable wait outside."

"Will do."

You waited for her and finally she was ready. Now to go and mingle, hopefully today brings us closer together darling not only as master and servant but as lovers fated to become a couple by the powers that be! Ahhh I yearn for the day I get to hear you reciprocate my affection.", she said with very big dreamy eyes. You rolled yours in a 'oh brother' manner.
1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.title: Next morning....

1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.content:
You walked with her socializing with her Nobility friends. Along a table sat Guiche, whom you had no enjoyment seeing, Tabitha who you had the exact opposite reaction toward and finally Montmorency who you were in the middle on. To your surprise though Kirche intentionally left a seat for you so you could mingle with everyone. "Sit here darling."

"Please don't call me that."

"Ugh what is a loathsome peasant doing sitting at a table of nobility Kirche. This is so uncivil."

"Want another duel Guich?"

"Oh hahahahahaha of course not!", he panicked.

"A real hero here.", Montmorency remarked.

"Oh but Montmorency I was merely discussing the glaring issue to clear the air which I have addressed and no longer linger on. I see it as a matter of courtesy!"

"And I make shoes with elves.", everyone looked at you in confusion. "I was sarcastic." Everyone laughed upon the clarification but you still seemed like you said something out of context.

"So Kirche how is your familiar doing? Are you two getting along?", Montmorency asked.

"Were improving and I'm doing my best although he isn't making much of an effort."

"You weren't helping rolling the welcome wagon for me."

"Oh but you've changed me darling. I'm a new woman now and I hope one day you'll see. I promise you the wait will be worth it for both of us my darling familiar.", she said hugging you snugly into her breasts.

"Stop it!"

"Immune to flirtation.", Tabitha remarked.

"Oh please Tabitha no man can resist my wiles."

"Aha! I for one have the most ironclad devotion on whomever my heart belongs to.", Guiche boasted. A second later Kirche lowered her shirt to reveal a tiny bit more of her chest to which Guiche's mouth watered. Montmorency let out an very audible hmph at him angrily tapping her foot.

"See, and it amazes me how you are willing to not be affected."

"Well I'd rather date him than you Gucihe."

"Wha! You must be joking!", Guiche yelled out in outrage.

"I'm bored. I'm going for ride.", Tabitha announced.

"Oh wait! Bring me and him with you pleeeeeeease. Tabitha pleeeeeeeease.", Kirche begged.

"Hold tight."

"Wait were going on that giant dragon?!"

"It'll be fun (Name). Don't say your master doesn't give you generous favors."
1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.title: Continue...

1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.content:
Meanwhile somewhere outside of Tristain was the renowned country of Germania. Their greatest merits were their women and their military strength. Kiche's home country was the strongest nation in the world. Among its inhabitants was one whom would be soon thrusted into the coming conflict. "Presenting sir Count Renouf Dewitte!", as announced this young man was a Germanian noble who was respected for many qualities and was being summoned for a special task. "Master Dewitte, a message from your mother.", said the messenger. "Speak it then.", said the young count. "She and the other noble families have made the consensus to have you make the journey to Albion during its most darkest time. We need you to head to Tristain and take with you someone personally selected by their princess.", the messenger said. "Prepare my horse. I will leave first thing.", a looming cloud hangs over the young count now being burdened with this responsibility. His role has finally begun.

Meanwhile back with you and Kirche....

"I guess now would be a bad time to say I have a problem with heights!", you yelled.

"Don't fret darling we both know some air magic to keep you from falling. I won't let anything happen to my darling (Name)."

"Stop calling me that!"

"Hey Tabitha where are we going?"

"Town."

"OH just perfect. A place for us to have some alone time darling."

"Oh for- ahhhhhhhhhhhhhh!", Tabitha's dragon accelerated downward heading into town. You all landed safely but you went out of it still holding tightly on to the great beast. "Never leaving the ground again.", you muttered.
1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.title: It has begun...

1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.content:
You, Tabitha and Kirche arrived at the town and started hanging out together. You started it off with lunch by a fancy noble diner. The food there smelled exquisite and it all looked so tempting. But of course you knew they wouldn't let you eat anything besides Tabitha and Kirche. When you three were seated the waiter came by and asked for your orders. When Tabitha and Kirche ordered the waiter took the menus and was about to leave however Kirche stopped him. "Pardon me, you forgot my darling."

"I'm sorry but we don't serve the lower-class. Nobles only madame."

"This is my familiar and he deserves to be treated with as much respect as a Noble. I will not pay a single bronze coin for this level of indignity.", she protested.

"We reserve the right to refuse service and you are forcing me to exercise it."

"Look I'll make it simple, either take my darling's order, or else."

The waiter looked at her with a disgusted look. And in 4 and a half seconds the three of you were kicked out. "Kirche next time when you say "or else" know what you that "or else" is going to be.", you said.

"I'm sorry he was getting on my nerves. Besides how was I supposed to guess they'd throw us out?", she naively answered. From there you decided to have lunch at a vendor. It wasn't the food of nobles but it was filling. "By the way, thanks for standing up for me back there.", you said. Kirche's face turned into a warm smile feeling happy.

Once that was done, you all walked around town but one glance and Kirche pulled you with her, to do a little shopping. You rolled your eyes with the knowledge you would be carrying a lot of stuff. When you got in she saw so many gowns and dresses that thinking about her wearing them would admittedly make look quite dashing. She picked out 3 that were her favorite and went to change. You sat around waiting for her to change and she came out finally. The first one was all black with the chest area covering her entire bust. "Hmmm I don't like this one now that I'm wearing it. Maybe if I cut part of it I'd be able to-"

"No I like it."

She paused interested in your input. "Go on."

"Well I wouldn't mind you wearing something that wasn't too...revealing."

"I like wearing cloths like that. But maybe I should stock on a few if it would make you feel better. Were stuck together after all so no need to make it unbearable.", she closed the door and put on the next one.

"How about this?", this one was an all blue dress that most women would be seen in. It wasn't fully clothing her but it didn't feel like it was being teasing as she wore it. you gave that description to her and she enjoyed hearing your opinions. Last one took a bit longer to put on and at last, she....was.....near indecent. The dress was an all white gown but the lighting made it appear as if she was naked.

"Ohh this is a charmed dress. I would have killed for one. They call this collection, The Censors."

"Yeah, but isn't it....ummm...distracting?"

"Oh please (Name). Don't tell me I look bad in it."

"Not that at all! Just I don't feel comfortable with you wearing that."

"Sigh. Well I suppose I can be flexible.", you were taken aback by her accommodating your needs you felt her being hurt by your opinion.

"Wait! I don't...mind if you get it. Save it for...something. I don't know but don't leave it because of me.", you pleaded.

Kirche exploded in joy and slammed the door. She got back on her school uniform ran to the clerk and paid for all 3. She took the bag and felt incredibly happy, you were about to take the bag, but she stopped you. "Uh uh (Name). You may be expected to carry my things, but these dresses I'm carrying myself."

You left the store but couldn’t find Tabitha seeing you ditched her. Of course you tried searching all over the place but she wasn't around wherever you looked. Kirche then decided to do one last thing before calling a cab back to the academy in case you couldn't find Tabitha. "(Name), have you ever seen a magic show?"

"Isn't that redundant here?"

"Huh?", she responded. You realized back in your world magic was all parlor tricks. Here it was the real thing. "Its just local mages performing fancy techniques. The peasants often enjoy seeing these despite their envy."

When you found one by the fountain in the town square a water mage was manipulating the water in various forms. Then followed was a fire mage tranforming the fire into various forms that were opposite of the water. It was like a stage fight only with magic. You were finding it very entertaining and cheered on for the fire mage's creations. Kirche found that flattering. As the battle got more intense, you looked at Kirche getting just as invested. When you did you saw her, like she was a genuine friend. This whole day was you two and nothing was bothering you about her. You realized you were finally connecting. Though not romantically as she'd like. When it was over fire won the day and still no sign of Tabitha.

The two of you went to call a cab back to the academy shortly after that. It was a long but pleasant day. Kirche in an attempt to flirt with you, nudged herself closer to you in your seat. You knew what she was up to, but this time you didn't mind. In fact you nudged yourself to her in kind. Kirche blushed and wanted to show her affection but restrained herself. "I had a very fun time today (Name)."

"Me too.", you smiled.

Unknown to either of you a blue dragon hovered over the caravan you were taking. With Tabitha still expressing nothing beyond her blank facial expression, but inward she was smiling at having let you two connect after ditching the two of you.
1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.title: You and Kirche on the town

1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.content:
Just as you two were on the carriage back to the academy a messenger hawk perched onto the cart. "Huh how strange. Normally a messenger hawk would only go to a destination, if it is addressed to me then that would mean somebody must be familiar with my magical aura.", she said.

"A message from your parents?", you asked.

"Gasp! No it's my old friend Count Renoulf Dewitte! Ren I called him for short. He says that he is coming to the academy in a few days. Oh how wonderful to see him again.", she said excitedly.

"You knew him?"

"He and I were best friends in basic training while I studied in my home country of Germania. He was a wind mage and a powerful one. I wonder what exactly made him want to come here to Tristain?", Kirche wondered.

"Maybe he wanted to see you?"

"Nonsense, he's been engaged to someone in another family. He is fond of her so whatever he is here for must be important. He was a serious rule-follower and very compassionate. Also very kind and understanding I think he would like you despite your status.", you were impressed by how she talked about him. He sounded like a well-rounded guy to her. She spoke with such passion that he sounded like an idol to her.

"Sounds good. He wasn't, um.....one of the guys....", you couldn't help but ask.

"I didn't date him. But I did try ounce or twice. But he kept the whole upholding his honor. So even though I did get his attention, he cared more for his honor. Respected his commitment where I just left home. But I don't regret it, I just didn't want to be forced into a marriage I'd want no part of."

"You fit in very well."

"All from my looks, but at least Ren kept reminding me that that wasn't just me."

"Seems like a great guy.", you said in a downer tone.

"Don't let that worry you darling, I may be getting googly eyed but I am not leaving you darling. No, you have given me so much.", she hugged you tightly.
1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.title: Continue...

1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.content:
Its been a few days but soon the time came for Kirche’s old friend to arrive at the academy. You were a little excited to see how he measured up to Kirche’s expectations as she gave him a ton of praise in the past. You could see someone riding in the distance and sure enough Kirche spotted him on sight.

“Ah my old friend Ren. Be sure to be on your best behavior darling, he may draw out some jealousy in you.”, she said.

“I’ll be sure to try.”, you answered.

Her friend made his way to the gate and got off his horse to greet the both of you. “Count Renouf Dewitte at your service.”, he introduced.

Kirche walked over and hugged him, “Oh Ren it is so good to see you again. But why did you need to come here in person? Am I needed back home to marry some old geezer like they planned?”

“Hehe, if only it was that mundane. No the situation I come to you with is very urgent. I must speak with a Louise Françoise Vallière. She has been given a special request from her majesty the Princess of Tristain.”

“Louise?”, you were curious why she was being called upon from someone from another country.

“It is best we find her and discuss matters in private.”

With that we rounded up Louise and met in her room where Dewitt started talking about this request the princess called on Louise.

“Tristain is in a state of uneasy tension between the continent of Albion. There is a group of rebels trying to overthrow the government there and if they succeed, they will most likely declare war on the state.”

“Why is that?”, Louise asked.

“They seek to abolish corruption across the world and they view Tristain as one of their targets. Therefore the princess has decided to marry into a Germanian family to ensure an alliance.”

“Who’s the prissy aristocrat who gets that honor?”, you asked poking fun of the nobility.

“That would actually be me.”, the count replied dryly.

“Ren? You are marrying her? But I thought you were engaged, and the king would be the one for her to marry.“

“Complications between families made the engagement plans too little too late. The king gave me the honor instead as a courtesy.”

“Ren are you going to be happy with her? I would be against the union if you were making a heavy sacrifice to ensure peace.”

“Non-sense Kirche, I hold high respect for lady Henrietta, it is nothing I am holding disdain for. My place is here making so that war does not come to Tristain’s boarders.”

“Then if Vallière is needed, then so am I. Including my familiar and darling (Name).”, Kirche announced.

“I didn’t need her to speak on my behalf to say I wish to come with Louise on this as well.”, you stated.

“Zerbst?”

“Don’t misunderstand, my darling would be sore if I didn’t lend a hand to you. But I am doing this for a close friend of mine, something you are doing aren’t you?”

“Without question.”, Louise answered with enthusiasm.

“Well I wasn’t expecting the extra company but this is fine by me. Ok, lady Henrietta needs you to deliver a message to the current prince of Albion so that the marriage can go ahead. We may be facing trouble so be prepared to face the worst.”
1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.title: 3 days later...

1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.content:
It's weird how different things are when you stand above so many at a high-enough altitude. You can see so many lives, so many people, just moving but nothing else. You can tell they are alive, but rise high enough and you wouldn't even guess there was anything down there. Is that how we see our minds when we dream? Is this, what feeling powerful feels like?

A lone figure stood over the edge of the floating continent starring down like a mythological god, observing its subjects.

"Has there been any word from them?", a young man with blonde hair asked this figure.

"No your highness, my guess they are going to reach the continent by tomorrow evening. We should expect them in 2 days. Meantime, get back to the church. You're putting yourself in danger.", she replied.

"You're right. I'll prepare for our guest's arrival."

"I'll escort you back lord Wales."

Wales left but the girl followed only after taking one last look below over the edge. "Is this what it feels like?", she glanced at her arm with runes inscribed into her skin. She turned away and headed back to the rendezvous point where she would be expecting Wardes' arrival.
1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.title: In Albion...

1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.content:
The journey across was lengthy but it gave you time to see how the young count measured up to Kirche’s standards. The whole time they were reminiscing and catching up with how well they have fared in the last few years. You didn’t have much to add, in fact Kirche didn’t even bring you up once during their whole conversation, besides her introduction of you.

You rode on your horse a little ways back from Kirche, feeling unsettled with things. Guiche rode next to you, noticing your discomfort. “I do know how you feel.”

“You don’t know squat Gucihe, shut up and back off.”

“Listen, I can see someone being jealous a mile away. I should know, I have seen it in ladies eyes many times over.”

“When they learned of your two-timing antics?”, you smirked.

“Ehehehehe! Rumors aside-“

“Or written facts aside.”, you teased.

“MY POINT BEING! Ehem. It is understandable of your situation. I mean he’s a young count from her own country. And she does seem to fancy him. When someone swoops in like that, you best assert yourself.”

“Not that I do feel jealous, but how would you suggest I assert myself?”

“Reminding her of your finest qualities. Thus letting your dear love, know that you are seeking her affections. She will be forced to choose. And then she will test to see who is the most worthy of her grace, and take a long, methodical process of elimination. Taking years and years of processing until the choice is-“

“Is that what she is thinking or just you justifying your two-timing nature?”

“Eheheheheheheheee!”, he laughed nervously.

Meanwhile Kirche looked back at you and Guiche. She noticed your displeased look, but she knew it wasn’t from being around Guiche. She pulled back to talk with you. “Excuse me Ren, I should give my familiar darling some much needed attention.”

You lit up a bit when she went to talk to you. Guiche had his horse gallop ahead to the young count to grant the two of you some privacy. “Hi darling.”

“Hi Kirche.”, you answered.

She knew you were not feeling to happy with her and Ren, “Listen to me darling, Ren is a very cherished friend of mine. But nobody can measure up to you.”

“Uh-huh.”

“Oh great. I’m glad you understand.”, she said cheerfully.

“I do. Sorry I’m bothering your time with him.”

“No need to apologize darling.”, she said thinking that whatever was bothering you wasn’t anything to do with what she believed. Guiche noticed the exchange and intercepted Kirche before she could talk to the count again. “Something wrong?”

“I would trod carefully with your interactions with the count. It is clear he takes your flirtatious manner with much sensitivity.”, he warned.

“But darling said he-“

“He is quite heavy on sarcasm. So I would read deeper into everything he says.”

“I’m not after my old friend. He’s certainly grown up but-“

“As (Name) promptly reminded me earlier, reminding someone of your less desirable qualities, only will increase his anger. While were both Nobility of passion and love, it has been shown that our most desired prey prefer us most when were are seen as loyal to our future lovebirds. Even though refraining from the flaunt and flirt nature can be hard to dismiss.”, Guiche wisely elaborated to Kirche.

“Hmm. I’m not certain I could give it up. It is still who I am.”

“I know what your saying. Montmorency won’t even talk to me anymore. That’s why us loyal believers of passionate love need to stick together. Although, I would be open to compare “notes” for how to treat our lover.”, Kirche smirked and waved her wand at Gucihe’s horse, sending a little fireball. His horse reeled back and bolted across the path with Guiche straining to hold on to the saddle.

You noticed her little stunt and let out a notable fit of laughter, much to Kirche’s delight.
1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.title: People devoted to "love"

1113322222222222222222222112221111211111.content:
"Ok, this is where we will stop for the evening. We'll stay the night, then take the next ship to Albion tomorrow evening.", Ren explained.

"Guuuuhhhhhh finally.", Guiche moaned out in exhaustion.

“Look at this place? The mountain is literally fused into the town it seems.”, you said admiring the scenery.

“(Name), our quarters for the night will by that ridge. You head down now, while me and Kirche make a quick detour.”, Ren ordered.

“Ok.”, you agreed. Maybe you wanted to avoid him so you could vent or just assumed Ren wanted to talk in private with her. Guiche just followed and only heard very audible grunts and half spoken frustrated sentences.

Ren and Kirche headed off but Ren started off a thought he had wanted to have answered since he first saw Kriche with this human familiar.

“He’s lucky.”

“Hmm?”

“Your familiar. Forced to be with you all day and night, I’d say he was the luckiest man alive.”, he said feeling quite envious.

“Of course he’d be if anyone were familiar to me. But, not at first Ren.”

“Why’s that?”

“Well not that I’m complaining, but when I left I had quite the reputation for fetching the finest young men this country had to offer at their most prestigious academy. But my darling has preferences for a more, reserved kind of relationship. And needless to say I haven’t had experience on that side of love. Frankly my parents aren’t always the best at that either.”, she explained.

“So you need advice on how to show him you’re serious about being with him?”

“Exactly Ren. But I don’t just want to learn so to bag another boy. He’s different, I want to be better for him. I want to be closer, I want to be just with him. It’s that feeling that all hopeless romantics strive for. I want to earn that from him.”

“My god, you are serious?”

“Yes. Real love. Not that infatuated love. Honest to god love.”, Kirche said cupping her face to hide the very present blushing that had grown on her cheeks.

“Well what have you done so far?”, Ren asked hoping to help.

“I’ve stopped seeing other men, devoted my free time to making him fall for me, and trying to do what he likes. But he hasn’t taken the bait. And I’ve left him some very tantalizing bait.”

“I believe you erm…Well anyway, it’s a start but far from close.”

“You think I should try giving him some of my jewelry?”

“No Kirche, that’s the problem. Your heart’s in the right place but it can come off as… well you don’t care. You don’t bribe them into it, you have ease yourself in. You need common ground to start building a relationship from.”

“Oh. Alright. Well… I invited him to sit with my friends, and spent a day with him between the two of us.”
“Ok, not bad. I think you got his attention, but I still don’t think he sees that your serious. What you need to do is ease into his interests without looking like your trying. Be yourself, make sure he puts in the same effort your making. Next time, try to make him do something you like, and see if he will take the bait to show he may be interested. See how far you get without nudging him too much.”, Ren said.

“Ren you have the emotional intelligence of a spirit.”

“A natural gift I guess, one of the many reasons I’ve come so far.”

“I really can’t tell you how much I appreciate what you do for me, thanks.”

“Never you mind it Kirche. I’m always there for you.”

11133222222222222222222222112212211.content:
In the capital you grew up in the middle class where you were forced to join the nation as part of its conquest. Your former village was taken over by the Imperial army but was lucky enough not to be conquered by their general who was rumored to be unrelenting and sadistic. You have been living for the past 3 and a half years in the capital and it has been a struggle to have a decent life with the army's oppression over its own people. You were sick of their tyrannical leaders and how recently it has been unsafe with a rebellious group, Night Raid, attacking various parts of the capital against its political leaders. For a while you just went through the motions until one day....

BOOOM!

In a densely populated area Night Raid was facing an Imperial arms wielder holding an experimental tube of some kind. You tried escaping the fighting but the tube broke when the Night Raid assassin with long blonde hair knocked it out of the Imperial's hands killing the soldier. Unknown to you at the time the contents made it on to your clothing which meant you would become involved with the revolution in due time...

The tube contained a living Imperial arms that latched on to your jacket and had the power to increase your strength and agility and use its body to attack along with mimicking and or altering the host's appearance to a degree. Its trump card was the power to cause it to spread itself around an area and control all who were infected like a hive-mind. It would take the appearance of a symbiotic organism and be a dark reflection of the wearer. It has three main weaknesses. The first was it is weak against all elemental attacks. The second the longer the wearer uses it the organism will exert its own control over its host. And third it will be exhausted within 30 minutes and needs to rest for 3 hours before it can be used again.

Do you accept this Imperial arms and this journey?

111332222222222222222222221122122111.content:
A couple of days passed after that incident with Night Raid. You were shock up a little but you counted yourself fortunate for not being a casualty. You noticed the next time you went to town some wanted posters of Night Raid. You recognized one of the sketches of one of them, the one who attacked the soldier. You looked at it with resentment but then a messenger came by and pasted a new poster on the wall. You inspected it closely wondering what it was about. A tournament coming to the coliseum tomorrow. You laughed knowing you would stand no chance at it but unknown to you, your chances were fairer than you realized.

As you walked back home a small street gang ambushed you into an alley. 5 against 1, you panicked thinking they'd kill you and steal what you had. Then out from your shirt oozed out a black substance. You screamed thinking they had shot you with some kind of Imperial Arms so you tried shaking it off from your arm. It began forming around your entire body covering every inch of your skin almost like you were being suffocated. A couple of the thugs ran the others stood in horror watching what was going on.

Finally you could breath as the substance formed around you like a suit of armor, only it felt like a literal second skin. It felt exhilarating, you could feel a surge of strength in your bones now like you had a rush of adrenaline. One thug tried stabbing you but you grabbed his arm reflexively with a quickness you didn't even react to. You crushed the thug's arm causing the last two to try and attack at once. You grabbed the both of them in the air, it was incredible! A euphoric rush filled you as you were effortlessly dominating these worthless hacks. You tossed them across the ally and stood to bask in suit.

"This thing feel unreal! I feel stronger than I could have dreamed!", you jumped in excitement but you leaped 5ft off the ground reach the top of the roof in the building across. You tumbled down when you just realized how high you jumped and took a deep breath trying to gather yourself. "Wherever this came from I can think of something to use it for."

The next day you entered the tournament...

You were finally up for the next match, because every other opponent killed either each other or were too injured to continue it was down to only you and one other monster. A danger beast with a cross between a giant buff looking guy and a bull. "Do you think you can take me? I will smash you! You cannot escape me!", it roared.

"I'm not feeling very friendly right this second so better worry about who smashes who.", you threatened.

The referee announced you, "In the right corner (Name) the mysterious!", a fitting title given the costume but now the gloves were off.

Without any further delay, you ran towards the bull and started attacking with a flurry of fists. Punch after punch, kick after kick, you didn't even give him a moment to retaliate. Even though you were wailing on him, he began shrugging it off by the time it was all you were doing. As you continued going, everyone in the stadium began to scream out wanting for more, so the beast began fighting back mercilessly. It took you aback and forced you on the defensive. For some reason the suit at various points made the moves for you like you were on auto-pilot but most of your skill was shown as the fight persisted. After dodging an incoming punch, you knee kicked him in the leg and uppercut him with both hands, causing him fall off the ground and land flat on his face.

You wiped your hands thinking that was all but he got back up and roared aloud. He was hoping to get tackle you, but failed when you slammed your right fist into his jaw and it connected so well he flipped in mid-air. Afterwards it made contact with the ground, causing an imprint on the floor. Finally with the battle won you felt the suit coming off your body. It occurred to you it was not permanent but you somehow knew a few basics about it like how long it could be used in battle and various other bits of info that it somehow embedded in your head. It felt strange yet seeing how many Imperial arms has special properties it didn't seem much to dwell concern on.

However when the ref stated your victory you smiled and cried out, "I'm a natural!"

In the spectator booth you saw that the famous General Esdeath was coming down. You heard of her insidious reputation and felt chilled to see her in person. Truth be told you felt a bit reluctant to act nicely around her, but you were willing to keep up appearances for the reward money. "(Name) was it. It's a nice name.", she said.

"Thanks."

"I must say to you first off...", she said before taking any further action....

Soon as the gate leading into the dungeon rose the ground beneath you rumbled, coming out was a 8ft giant with a broken chain and a bag full of rocks and boulder, an untamed danger beast of some kind. "If you manage to kill this danger beast without that item you procured then you won't be arrested. Survive and win, then you won't be charged for harboring an imperial arms.", she stated.

"Fine then.", you spoke. Your suit was unable to be used seeing you used up your time with it but all the same you had an idea or two. The beast roared and raised its massive arms and chucked a boulder at you. You threw yourself out of its way but the shock-wave still sent you back a little. It threw another big one at you, this time you couldn't completely get out of its way but you could dodge it enough to not have it land a hit. The shock-wave from the impact this time threw you closer to the giant. Instead of throwing rocks it was going to smash you into paste! You ran underneath it and punched its ankles. The giant felt none of them and tried grabbing you. You rolled away by his side and went for the kneecap. Still it felt like air was breezing through his body but no pain.

It smacked you sending you out of bounds of the arena. You got back up feeling your arm and ribs sore from that blow. The giant was about to start throwing again, it reeled its arms and took a step to gain power in the throw, then something incredible happened. The giant's ankle broke from pressing it on its side then the giant fell down and hit its head on its knee as it couldn't move it. The blow and pain from the knee and ankle forced its grip to release and the boulder dropped on its head. With that the danger beast fell.

"Holy hell that worked?", soon as you said that the whole crowd cheered in total disbelief and excitement. "TOTAL WIN!", you yelled out raising your arms high and smiling the biggest smile. You never felt so prideful in a one on one fight like this. This one was earned and with no help from that imperial arms. Esdeath came down and had a lighter smile on her face. She seemed impressed it felt like.

"(Name) was it? You impressed me. I would say you earned your pardon."

"Glad I made an impression with just my bare skill."

"I WOULD say but you were out of bounds in the arena and therefore lost. However you survived and in the end it was bested by you. So I will make this technicality work for both of us.", she then placed a collar on your neck with a chain leash attached.

"Wait what?!"

"From now on you belong to me (Name)."

"Hey this is ridiculous! Ack- what kind of cra-ugh!", you felt her hit your neck causing you to slowly pass out. She caught you from hitting the ground and whispered, "Don't worry we'll talk later when we are alone."

1113322222222222222222222211221221111121.content:
You regained consciousness and found yourself tied up to a chair with Esdeath and a bunch of other people in a room. "Ah you've woken up. Everyone this is (Name), my true love."

"She doesn't represent me in this.", you stated.

"Yes I do and there will be no exceptions.", she fired back. "I want him to be treated as a member of this team because he will be joining it as of now."

"This isn't what I agreed to!"

"Why do want him here?", asked someone in a blue jacket.

"The good doctor's experimental imperial arms made its way to him and he used it to win the tournament. But I tested him to see if he can fight without it and he succeeded. He has a long way to go but I'm certain he will be a force to be reckoned with when I'm finished with him. Now I'd like you all to introduce yourselves to our newest member."

The guy in the jacket spoke first, "I'm Wave."

A big guy in a creepy white mask came next, "I'm Bols."

A girl in a dark dress with short hair then spoke, "Kurome."

Then the doors busted open revealing two more individuals, "No need to tell me I already know the situation, and the name IS DR. STYLISH! With my other test subject is Seryu Ubiquitous." The doc had dark hair with a streak of white and wore a typical lab coat and the girl had brown hair and had both of her arms as metal prosthetics.

"And lastly I am Run. Pleasure is all ours (Name)."

"I'd feel a lot more welcome if I wasn't still tied up."

"I don't want you to escape so that is why your restrained.", Esdeath answered.

"How would I escape?"

"Your imperial arms for one and you would slip out in the middle of the night. Frankly I see plenty of reasons."

She already knew both of your ideas for escaping due to not wanting to be here and your disdain for the empire. However you needed to convince her to let you out of the chains she had you bound in. "If you want for someone to fall in love with you, binding them up to a chair isn't the way to do it."

"Hmm do any of you agree with his statement?", Wave and Bols both raised their hands while the others had theirs down in indifference. "Very well but don't run off because I'll punish you if you do.", she warned almost like a mother would her child. "Everyone we will pull an eight hour training session tomorrow to get oour new recruit up to fighting condition. Get some sleep for we'll have a long day ahead."

You left the room with the others but Esdeath grabbed your hand stopping you, "You don't have your own room, your quarters are my quarters."

You felt incredibly uncomfortable with this but you let her take you to her room. She let you sit on her bed and sat beside you, "Wait here for a bit I should freshen up myself before we sleep."

She went in her bathroom and from the sounds she was taking a shower. You wanted to leave but judging from her seriousness you felt the best place to be was here until a better chance came up. With you in the middle of the capital, even with an imperial arms escape was impossible. You were wondering if you could try to find some way to escape during a mission far from the capital, maybe then you could leave. You heard the door open from the bathroom you turned around only to see Esdeath with only her shirt on and everything else uncensored by anything else.

"Sorry to keep you waiting."

You stayed silent not having any idea how to answer with her being very exposed. "You seem so nervous, how just adorable you are. Don't worry I feel just as much new to this as you are. Experiencing these feelings is so confusing but if we let ourselves just follow our instincts then we should have no problem. But first I must ask you what do you think of my team? They will be like family now after all and I want to accommodate them as best I can for you."

"Well they all appear friendly so I guess there's nothing to change."

"That's good to hear, your optimism makes me excited to see you work together with us.", she said.

"But uhhh.", you wanted to express your thoughts on being with the Jeagers but you hesitated fearing her response.

"Hmm what?", she said with concern.

"It's just I really don't want to be here."

"Why is that?", she said not out of anger but interest.

"Your army conquered my home and I lived here for years and it is terrible! You fight for an empire that nobody would mourn for if it fell tomorrow. In fact they'd cheer if that were the case."

"Hmm hmm. I can understand your resentment, it must not have been easy for you but no ordinary person could survive being conquered by our forces, live within our streets and find our way to the ranks of their elite squadron. It takes strength and that is what it takes to survive. I can't change the empire now but I could give your family an easier life here."

"I don't have one anymore.", you replied.

"Oh. I'm sorry.", she placed her hand on yours. You realized that she must be serious about her feelings about being in love with you but you asked her directly to see if she was.

"Esdeath do you really...like me?"

She took you toward her bed and was on top of you keeping you down with one hand. "If I didn't you wouldn't be here with me all alone like this.", you get scared wondering if she was going to have her way with you. "I don't think I want this!"

"Oh don't worry I won't force myself on you. In fact I shall be faithful, you are the only one for me and no one else will have the pleasure on my love."

"But I don't care about this empire Esdeath, so why should I fight with people who do care?"

"You are so naive. I don't pretend to see where your coming from but the fact is this is where you are. But", she grabbed you in a tender hug and spoke softly, "If you can't find any reason to fight beside us then please let that reason be that you have found someone in this empire who has feelings for you and does genuinely care about you. For now lets get some rest."

You couldn't help but be touched by her pleas to make you stay. You laid down on the bed facing away from her. But she wrapped her arms around you and laid right behind you spooning with you. "You said you wouldn't force yourself on me!"

"This isn't so bad now is it? Its as far as I'll go."

You felt uncomfortable but when you stopped shaking it felt nice. Warm. Peaceful. Esdeath's heart beated fast until she drifted to sleep. You were so confused by her advances but still they had an effect on you that you were oddly touched by. You were too exhausted to break free so you fell asleep in her arms.
1113322222222222222222222211221221111121.title: The newest member to the Jeagers

1113322222222222222222222211221221111121.content:
The next day Esdeath had trained you to fight without any assistance from you imperial arms. You may have beaten a danger beast with your bare hands but that wouldn't always what saves you in battle. So she had you train with a sword to feel similar to her own weapon outside of her power over ice. She kept you going for eight hours without any breaks. She had you spar against the entire team and herself all day and to your shock you didn't die yet. When training was over you collapsed where you stood the instant Esdeath announced that was all for the day. She couldn't help but laugh at how cute it made you look but at the same time hated seeing a sign of exaggerated weakness. She came to you and carried you to the conference room. By the time you woke up after Esdeath gave you a light slap to wake you she began explaining a new developing situation.

"Good your up. It's important you hear this (Name)."

"In the morning."

"Stay awake or else I'll punish you tonight and make sure you lose even less sleep than you crave.", she threatened almost as serious as she would threaten an enemy. "Ok now we just got a report that a bandit outpost is just outside the capital. If we attack now we can end their annoying raids once and for all. I trust none of you are too tired to face this petty band of rabble?"

"Ugh think maybe I could sit this one out.", asked Wave.

"No all Jeagers must be present and deal swift justice. So that includes you Wave."

"AW c'mon we have been training for hours and I was the one sparring the most with (Name)!"

"I made sure I spent the most matches with him."

"By counting them together yeah, but not in length of time!"

"(Name) won't be taking a backseat to this Wave."

"Ok good."

"He'll have a front view of the action while we sit on the sidelines watching you all work as a unit. He's seen how you are one on one but he must witness the when you all fight as one."

"Uuuuuu why do I even bother negotiating?", Wave complained internally.


Later...

You all found the bandit outpost with Esdeath and you sat back to see the show. You felt nervous being alone with Esdeath however this was business for her so to a degree she kept a serious focus on the mission. That didn't mean she would leave out a chance to show her affection by placing her hand on yours. "Just watch, pretty soon they will storm that stronghold and wipe away the enemy in mere minutes."

"Yayyy?", you said.

"Does violence make you uncomfortable?"

"No just...nevermind.", you couldn't answer.

"Hmm I can tell you feel reluctant to fight with us even when you know it will be futile to resist. But really watch on how the win. I promise it will leave an impact."
