She rubbed her hand over your back trying to comfort you and in respect she did. But only until when you saw for the first time in a while the face of your old friend, Cassie.

She was with her limiter, Kyoichi Minase, sitting together on a bench having lunch together enjoying each others company. She seemed very happy, she was smiling brightly and the mood seemed like it may not be so hard to get through. But when she noticed everyone arriving her smile went away snapping her back. "Kazuya Aoi, Satellizer el Bridget, (Name). Thank you for coming upon my request.", she bowed. You all bowed in respect for her. "(Name) if you would be kind as to join me on a walk I would appreciate it to be allowed time alone with you first."

"I'd be fine with that.", Creo was a little shocked and deep down a bit jealous. You walked with Cassie alone in gardens.

"Hi.", she said first.

"Hey.", you replied.

"Who's your pandora?"

"Creo, very strong and quick. And were together, as in TOGETHER together."

"So soon after Makoto?", Cassie seemed surprised.

"It wasn't falling back, we agreed to not have it be that way but we couldn't help it in the end. Sigh....she's wonderful."

"Well at the very least if she does reciprocate the feelings then I couldn't be any happier.", she said feeling genuinely relieved to hear the news.

"I could say the same about you, you seemed to be having the time of your life back there."

"Oh Kyoichi has been wonderful. Were planning on making it official soon."

"I'm very happy for you Cassie."

"Me too. But still...did it feel terrible coming back here?"

"Cassie I want to leave as soon as were finished here."

"I would have come to you but when I heard you were friends with Aoi and Satellizer I figured having you all here would be simpler."

"It's fine. Btw does anyone here ever mention me?"

"Not as bad as before. But whenever they slander you I stand up for you. Look whatever happened here that gave you that defect is something those bastards running the place will never admit screwing up. And Makoto should have been up front about how she felt about you so that what happened didn't happen and that you could let it go."

"I'd have gotten her killed every chance we were sent out there. I loved her too much to recover from that. Fact....", you paused.

"What?", she inquired.

"Nothing. thanks for inviting me. I'm just happy to see you've turned out well."
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.title: You meet with Cassie Lockhart

1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.content:
After that, you and Cassie headed back to the group.

"Have you handled your business Mr. (name)?" asked Sister Margaret.

"Yes I have," you replied. "Now if you don't mind, I'm gonna head back to the chopper OK? It was great seeing you again Cassie. I'll talk to you later."

"Oh. OK."

Then you left heading back to the chopper. Creo was about to follow suit, but then she felt someone hold her hand. She looked back to find that Cassie was holding it.

"You're Creo right? (name)'s pandora?" she asked.

"Yes that's me."

"I need to ask you favor. Could you please take care of (name) for me?"

"Don't worry," said Creo. "You have my word. I'll treat him like a treasure."

Cassie smiled. "Thank you." Then she turned to Kazuya. "Mr. Kazuya. May I speak with you now?"

"Yeah. Of course," said Kazuya. "I'll be right back Satella."

Satellizer acknowledged with a nod and Kazuya and Cassie went off alone so they could talk. As they walked away, Satellizer couldn't help, but feel a little jealous herself. Sister Margaret who noticed this couldn't help but chuckle.

"Feeling a little jealous are we Ms. Bridget?"

Satellizer blushed. "What?! Absolutely not! I'm not jealous! I just... I was worried for Kazuya that's all."

Sister Margaret smiled then her smile turned into a thin line.

"Satellizer? Mind if I ask you something?"

"What is it?"

Sister Margaret paused. Then she asked...

"What do you think of (name)?"

"Well... he's a good friend and a strong ally I guess," said Satellizer.

"Do you think that he will become a strong limiter even after everything that has happened to him in the past?"

Satellizer was puzzled. "I... don't understand what you mean."

"Let me explain. You are aware about (name)'s previous pandora Makoto correct? Including how she died?"

"Yes. She died in battle because of (name) right?"

Sister Margaret sighed. "As I thought, you don't know the full story."

"What do mean? I heard from the sisters that (name)'s pandora died because they let an amateur like him out in battle. Isn't that what happened?"

"Yes, but at the same time no. Makoto did indeed die on that day, but it wasn't because of (name). I feel that it was somehow my fault."

"What do you mean?" asked Satellizer.

____________________

Back with Kazuya and Cassie they went in the gardens just like what you and she did a while ago.

"So what did you want to talk to me about Ms. Lockhart?" asked Kazuya.

"Please call me Cassie," she replied. "And... I wanted to pay my respects to your sister."

"Wait, you know my sister? How?" gasped Kazuya.

"Let me explain. After the Eighth Nova Clash, the stigmata that came from her were considered Sacreds and given to select pandora. Including me."

"Hold on. Does that mean... you have my sister's stigmata?"

"Yes. As soon as I heard that you were Kazuha's brother and were at West Genetics, I had to have you come right away so I could thank you."

"Um... there's really no need to thank me. I really didn't do anything... Hey Cassie. Mind if I ask you something?"

"Sure. What's up?"

"Well... you know (name) right? I mean are both of you are friends?"

"Yes. I've known (name) for a while."

"Then... can you tell me something? It might be just me, but... (name)'s been acting really strange. Ever since we came here... well in fact ever since we embarked on this trip, he's been acting... tense. And not just that, I noticed that the headmaster was looking at him the wrong way like he holds a grudge against him. So... do you know what's going on with him?"

Cassie looked at Kazuya before looking down at the ground solemnly. "I guess he doesn't know."

"Yes," she said. "I know exactly what's going with (name). He's still feeling the emotional scars from back then."

"Emotional scars? What do you mean?"

Then Cassie turned to Kazuya looking serious.

"Kazuya. Listen to me closely. What I'm about to tell you is not only sensitive information, but (name) can't know that I told you. He'd be very upset with me if he found out."

"Um... OK. I won't tell," said Kazuya.

"OK then. It all started about a year ago. Back when (name) was a first year and attending here in East Genetics. He was a very promising student. Smart, kind, and skilled in battle. He also was friends with most of the students including me and was popular with the third years, but there was one person that he cared about more than anyone else in the whole world. That was Makoto. Out of all the girls in the world, she was his whole world. There wasn't any moment where they would not be together. They were like two peas in a pod. They did everything together from talking, helping with schoolwork and even fighting together. They seemed to be the perfect pair and coupe, so one day (name) asked Makoto if he would become his limiter and Makoto agreed. (name) was so happy. He thought he had found his dream girl, but sadly... he didn't. You see (name) thought that when a limiter and pandora were baptized, they would be lovers and eternal partners. Unfortunately (name) found out the hard way that it wasn't true. You see one day, (name) confessed his feelings to Makoto. He assumed that Makoto would feel the same about him, but... she didn't. It turned out that Makoto was in love with someone else who was already in a partnership. She also told him that they could still be intimate together as friends with benefits. Disgusted and heart-broken, (name) went to his dorm and stayed in his room all day without ever coming out.

Then things took a turn for the worst. For the day after that, a powerful Nova attacked. The Nova wiped out everything in it's path intent on destruction. The main platoon was forced to retreat so reinforcements could be sent to help them. (name) and Makoto were among those reinforcements. When they got there, Makoto was the first to engage the Nova. (name) was still feeling the shocks from his heartbreak and that was causing problems with his freezing. It was so bad that his freezing grew weaker and weaker. He tried his best, but it was too much. His powers gave out and then...

Cassie paused cringing from remembering what happened next.

"What happened?" asked Kazuya.

Cassie took a deep breath and resumed her story.

"By then another platoon of reinforcements came and they were able to stop the Nova, but... it was too late. On that day, Makoto lost her life. I can still remember how (name) looked on that day. He was filled with so much grief and things kept getting worse from there. Because of what happened, the higher ups speculated that Makoto's death was caused by (name)'s 'flawed' stigmata. This caused everyone to blame him for what happened. He was bullied, ostracized in class, and was treated very horribly. Then the sisters decided that they would have (name) sent back to the academy in hopes of strengthening his stigmata. This gave birth to two things regarding (name). The first was his hatred from the system for what they did to him and Makoto and the second was his title; 'The Imperfect Limiter' ."

Kazuya stared at Cassie in shock not believing what he had just heard.

"Cassie... is all of this true?"

"Yes and what's really sad about it is that (name)'s heart has never fully recovered. In fact, he swore that he would never fall in love again or make friends which is why I find it a miracle that he's with Creo and is friends with me, you, and Satellizer."

"It also explains why he was such a loner back when I first met him." said Kazuya.

"Yeah. It seems like no matter where he goes, (name)'s past will come back to haunt him and what really makes me upset that it wasn't even his fault. I just wish that I could've helped him. Some friend I was."

Cassie squeezed her hands in frustration, but Kazuya gently placed his hand over them to calm her down.

"It's okay Cassie. If you think about it, you're already helping him by being his friend," he said gently. "You stick up for him even when he's not around. I'd say you're a great friend and I'm sure (name) would tell you the same thing."

Cassie frustrated frown turned into a smile. "Thank you. That means a lot Kazuya. In fact, I feel a lot better knowing that (name) has a good friend like you."

Kazuya blushed. "It's...no big deal."

"In any case, I guess we better head back. Satellizer and Sister Margaret are waiting. By the way Kazuya, how's Satellizer doing?"

"Oh. She's doing well. Why do you ask?"

"Oh no reason. Just curious," said Cassie and she and Kazuya left the garden.
___________________________

Sister Margaret had just finished telling the exact same story that Cassie told Kazuya and Satellizer was shocked.

"No way... that's how (name)'s partner died? I... I had no idea."

"Yes. It really was tragic," said Sister Margaret as she stared into the sky.

"But there's one thing I don't get though," said Satellizer. "If (name) was sent back to the academy then why have him at West Genetics?"

"Because I have hoped to mend his heart and have him find a partner that not only suits him, but loves him too. I also think that he has what it takes to become a strong limiter. He just needs time and love is all."

She turned to Satellizer.

"Now I want you to please keep what I told you a secret from (name). If he were to find out about it, then I'm afraid he would be very... agitated."

Satellizer nodded in understanding swearing she would keep her word.Then Kazuya and Cassie came back. After saying goodbye to Cassie, the three made their way back to the chopper.
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.title: Kazuya speaks with Cassie

choices: Meanwhile back at West Genetics in the Command Center
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.content:
In the chopper, you and Creo were sitting in their seats in waiting for the others. Neither one of them said a word. After a while, Creo spoke breaking the silence.

"(name)? Are you OK now?"

"I'm fine. I... was just thinking. Creo? Let me ask you something. Do you have any regrets of becoming my limiter?"

Creo looked at you in surprise. "Why would you ask me such a question?"

"It's just that... I feel like it's something that I don't deserve. Even though it was an accident, people think it doesn't change the fact that Makoto died because of me. I can still remember what happened after the incident. The glares people gave me. How they treated me. Even the teachers including the Headmaster hated me. They all kept treating like a criminal, even calling me a murderer. At first I ignored them and endured it, but eventually I started to believe them. I felt like scum. Scum that didn't deserve to live. Someone who didn't deserve to have what we have right now, but... something changed."

"What was it?" asked Creo.

"It was when I talked to Kazuya the other day. Back when I first met him and Satellizer. I saw how he kept going to Satellizer even thought she was dangerous. I told him to get away from her if he wanted to live because I didn't want him to end up like me. Then... Kazuya said something that made me think. He told me that he kept going to her because he knew that she was good even though she was The Untouchable Queen. He wanted to be with her because he saw the good in her and he wanted me to see it too. That made me think and inspired at the same time. So I decided to try and see the good in Satellizer too and as chance had it, I saw the good in her. It gave me hope. Hope that someone would see the good in me too. And someone did. You. It didn't matter what I did. You accepted me without a second thought. You even became my partner and my lover and it wasn't just you. Arnet, Kazuya, and even Satellizer. You all became my friends. It made me feel...happy and it helped me ease the pain of Makoto's death. I still feel terrible about it when I'm here, but... I feel like I'm finally getting some closure on Makoto's death. And it's all thanks to you Creo. I know I'm probably just rambling, but... I want to thank you. For becoming my friend, becoming my partner, and most of all becoming my lover. Thank you."

And with that, you planted a kiss right on Creo's lips. Creo was a bit startled, but she returned the kiss. When you both separated Creo couldn't help but smile.

"Well, well. Someone's being forward."

"And who's fault is that?"

Creo embraced you in a loving hug and squeezed you lovingly.

"I'm glad I met you too (name). No matter what anyone says about you or what they think, my feelings for you will never change. I'll love you always and forever."

"Me too."

Then Sister Margaret, Kazuya, and Satellizer came back on the plane. When you saw them, you immediately separated from her and pretended that you weren't doing anything much Creo's disappointment.

"Oh. Sorry about that Mr. (name). I guess we came at the wrong time. We were inruding?" asked Sister Margaret.

"No you weren't," you said. "You're timing's perfect."

"I see," chuckled Sister Margaret.

Satellizer and Kazuya couldn't help, but chuckle a little too. You looked away and pretended you didn't hear them. After that the chopper took off and took off enroute to West Genetics.
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.title: In the chopper...

choices: Soon they arrive and it begins...
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.content:
Then all of a sudden just when the chopper barely left the ground, they suddenly heard an alarm.

"This a level one alert!" a woman's voice said on the loudspeaker. "I repeat, this is a level one alert! This message is for all Pandora and limiters currently on campus! Pandora, equip all Volt Textures and prepare volt weapons immediately! Limiters, change into battle uniforms and assemble in the auditorium!"

"What the hell?" you said leaping to your feet.

"A level one alert?" said Creo. "That means..."

"There's been a Nova sighting," said Sister Margaret. She quickly turned to the pilot. "Quickly take us down."

"Roger," said the pilot as he dropped the chopper back to the ground. Then they also heard a voice coming from the radio.

"Hello! This is Yu-Mei from West Genetics calling Radar 1. Do you copy?"

Sister Marget immediately took the headphones and spoke with Yu-Mei.

"This is Sister Margaret and we copy. What is it?"

"Sister Margaret. We've detected Nova that are close to your vicinity,"

You heart immediately felt like it was frozen and even Sister Margaret showed signs of shock, but she remained calm.

"Are you sure? Over here in East Genetics?"

"Yes," answered Yu-Mei. "The dimensional interference we picked up turned out to be the Nova."

"Damn it," you cursed under your breath. "Not them."

"There's more Sister," said Yu-Mei. "I have a message for you and that is for you to return to West Genetics immediately."

"I see," said Sister Marget. "Very well. I will head back as soon as possible. Make you have all third year Pandora and their limiters on standby Yu-Mei."

"Understood. Over and out."

Then the radio was cut making it emit nothing, but static, Then Sister Margaret turned to you and your friends.

"Listen up. I must return to West Genetics for I am needed there. I know that you're all from West Genetics, but I need you all to go and assist the East Pandora any way you can," said Sister Margaret. "Do whatever it takes to stop the Nova.

"Understood," you all answered as you all immediately left the chopper and went to prepare for battle. Sister Margaret watched as you all leave. Then the chopper took off and soared off into the distance back to West Genetics.

Soon after you, Creo, Satellizer, and Kazuya along with the East Pandora and limiters were at the auditorium awaiting their orders. Then Milena Marius stood before them with grave news.

"This is live footage," she began as a display of the outside appeared before them. What you saw made your eyes widen in horror and shock. Even Satellizer couldn't believe what she was seeing. There on the display wasn't one nor two nor three, but four Nova! And they're just your run of the mill Nova. All four of them were S class Nova.

"Four Nova?" Cassie breathed not believing what she was seeing too. Everyone in the auditorium began murmuring to each other having the same reaction.

"This is insane!" you thought your fists trembling. "As if one Nova wasn't bad enough! Now we got four of these damned things?!"

"As you are all aware," continued Milena. "We are under attack from four Type S Nova. The defensive line is engaging them as we speak. We will receive out orders if all else fails."

Then next to Milena on the podium, a phone rang next to her. Milena answered the phone.

"Yes? Milena here..." she paused listening to the person on the other end. "Understood." Then she hung up and turned to the Pandora and Limiters.

"We have our orders now," she said. "General Headquarters wants all students to move out to serve as back-up limiters and Pandora. All of you prepare to depart and get ready for battle."

"Yes ma'am!"

Everyone left the auditorium and boarded in the choppers. The choppers took off and flew towards to the location to where the Nova were seen. One thing was for sure. This was going to be one hell of a fight,
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.title: Suddenly the nova appear...

choices: Back at West Genetics in the Command Center...
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.content:
In the chopper, you, Creo, Satellizer, and Kazuya were sitting in chopper along with a few other dozen limiters and Pandoras. Everyone in the chopper was quiet. Not a single word was spoken.

"Damn," you thought. "Even I gotta say, you can cut this kind of tension with a knife. Then again I can't blame them. After all, this might be our final battle."

You looked around at all the other Pandoras and Limiters. They all wore neutral expressions. All except someone you didn't expect to be in the same chopper as you. Cassie. She on the other hand wore a worried expression on her face biting her lip.

"Even Cassie looks scared. I guess even the strongest person has moments of weakness. Especially when you have to deal with Nova for real." you thought.

Memories of you and Makoto came into your mind. The moment where she and you were picked in a platoon and when she died right in front of you. Just remembering it made you squeeze your hands into fists.

"Damn it. I wish I didn't have to do this. I feel like I'm repeating the past all over again."

Just then a hand fell on top of yours causing you to look up. The owner of that hand belonged to Creo who could see that you were feeling stressed about the upcoming battle. She looked at you with reassuring eyes as if she telepathically telling you that everything would be okay. You looked at her and you gave her a nod.

"No way. It's not gonna be like before. Not this time," you thought. "Because now I have a partner that I care about and that loves me. I promise you, I'll make sure that nothing happens to you Creo."

Then Creo whispered to you so no one could hear.

"(name)? You OK?"

"I'm fine," you whispered back. "Just thinking about something. Listen Creo there's something I want to tell you before we enter to battle."

"What is it?"

"I want you to stay close to me and not take any risks in fighting the Nova, Stay close to me as much as you can."

"But why?" asked Creo looking a little annoyed. "We've fought one of these things before and we beat it no problem."

"That was because it was a type R Nova. Not to mention that me getting activating my freezing was nothing short of a fluke. We're talking about S class Nova here. Four of them in fact."

"So what? We were trained to deal with them with simulators, so we would know what to do."

"This isn't a simulator Creo! This is for real! I can tell you right now that these Nova are nothing like the ones in the simulators! That's why I want you to play it safe and stay close to me!" you whispered with a harsh tone.

Creo glared looking hurt. "You make it sound like I can't defend myself. Is that it? Do you think that I'm so weak that I can't handle myself in a battle like this!?"

"No! I just don't want you to end dying for risking your life for me!" you snapped squeezing Creo's hand. "Listen to me. I already lost someone because of these damned things and because I was naive. I don't wanna go through that again. So please... promise me... promise me that you'll play it safe and not take any risks. I don't wanna lose you."

Creo look of anger subsided now understanding your feelings.

"I understand," she said. "I promise. I'll be careful."

Suddenly the pilot's voice broke the silence and made everyone snap into attention.

"All Pandora and Limiters! Prepare to deploy! I repeat prepare to deploy!"

Everyone immediately got ready to depart. The hangar doors slowly opened and pair by pair, everyone left the chopper. Soon only you and Creo were left. You looked at each other.

"You ready?" asked Creo.

"Yeah," you replied. "Remember, if things look bad I want you to get out of there. I'm not losing you."

"Same goes for you." replied Creo. "We're gonna get through this alive. Count on it."

You both shared one last tender kiss savoring the brief intimacy even if was for a second. Pulling your lips away, you both looked at the ground below you and then you both jumped off the chopper to the ground below.
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.title: A promise to be safe.

1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.content:
Sister Margaret had made it safely back to West Genetics and met up with Yu-mei. They both quickly made their way back into the Command Center. When they came in and saw the four nova on display, Yu-Mei's face was wracked with shock. Even Sister Margaret's face was etched with fear and worry.

"Impossible," she gasped. "I've never seen anything like this."

Then another teacher Elize Schmitz came to them.

"Sister Margaret. You made it back."

"Yes," said Sister Margaret. "I was told that I was ordered to return here as soon as possible. Who was the one who gave the order?"

"I don't know," said Elize. "He didn't say who he was. All he said was that he would be joining us shortly."

"I see. What's our current status?" asked Sister Margaret.

"The targets have breached through the defensive line. Civilian evacuation on is on schedule and is currently 95% complete. We have a fleet of choppers about to intercept the targets in about a minute and thirty seconds."

On the monitor, the nova proceeded towards East Genetics not intending to stop. In the distance from them just as Elize said, a fleet of choppers came towards the nova. They zoomed straight at them and fired all their missiles. Smoke and explosions filled the air. When the smoke pulled clear, the nova could be seen without a single scratch on it. Then the nova began to glow and then suddenly it realized a giant force of energy. The whiteness of the light completely enveloped the screen. When the light dimmed, the screen regained it's picture. There was nothing left, but the nova themselves. The choppers were completely destroyed.

"Damn it," cursed Elize under her breath. "All of them were destroyed? Should have known that would happen. We can't even slow these damned things down."

"The poor solders never stood a chance," said Yu-Mei clenching her fists.

All Sister Margaret could do was watch the screen her eyes filed with worry.

"What now?" asked Elize.

"For now, We'll have to let the East Pandora handle it," said Yu-Mei. " You there, Have they arrived on site yet?" she asked a woman.

"Yes ma'am. Chevalier platoons 3, 7, and 8 and just completed deployment and are nearing the target as we speak. We'll make a full-force assault in a hundred and eighty seconds."

"Good," said Yu-Mei. "Prepare for the operation as soon as you can."

"Yes ma'am."

As they prepared to get the operation underway, a phone began to ring. Elize went over and answered it.

"This is Yu-Mei.....yes.....yes.......understood."

Then she hung up and she turned to Sister Margaret.

"Sister Margaret. There's someone that's coming to here to speak with you.

"Who is it?" asked Margaret.

"He wouldn't give me his name, but he's on his way here as we speak," the woman replied.

"In the middle of a nova attack?" asked Elize. "Now of all times? Wonder who could it be?"

Her answer came sooner than expected for right then, the door opened and someone walked in. When Sister Margaret saw who it was, for the first time in a long time, her face turned into a scowl.

"So it's you again," she said.
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.title: Back at West Genetics in the Command Center...

1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.content:
A man with brown hair and white streaks on both sides entered the command center. "Margret we need to speak in privet.", she was reluctant to excuse herself in the middle of a battle but followed as directed. They went to an office not far from the center with the brown haired man sitting down and folding his hands looking disappointed at Sister Margret. "We have an issue regarding The Imperfect Limiter."

"There is no problem Davok. He is fine and he is with someone who won't break his heart."

"That's not the issue. You see his influence with the other pandora may spread his story regarding his previous partner, will encourage others to take more time selecting their pandora. We need the students to continue supplying us a steadily fast growth of pandora partnerships. If they hear incidents like these they will doubt the system and our only method of stopping the nova will be lost."

"It is true what you say but your plan to sweep it under the rug is the wrong way to go. We must show we are still willing to help the students become the strongest they can be in order to renew their faith.", she protested.

"Think what you like but your the unpopular opinion. I sent another pandora to aid east genetics and will be assigned to the imperfect limiter, similar to the Aoi boy with Rana Linchen.", Davok explained.

"Who is it then?"

"Isuzu Sawatari."

"NO! How dare you! She will kill them both you fool!", Margret yelled in outrage.

"She only attacks other pandora in self defense but she is no murderer."

"I think you underestimate your stupidity Davok. She clearly is after the reports coming with a pattern of how those deaths occurred."

"The decision has been made and you are not to breath a word of Isuzu's history to the boy and his fellow classmates.", she lowered her head in grief. "Return to the command center and continue monitoring the battle."
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.title: Continue...

choices: Back at West Genetics in the command center...
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.content:
The nova continued on slowly heading for East Genetics, but lying in wait lurking in the shadows were all the East Pandora ready to attack. The plan was simple. A Decoy strategy, Pandora who were the decoys were assigned to distract the Nova and keep it busy so the strikers can attack. Then Pandora who were strikers had the job to attack the Nova and to expose it's core. Finally were the strikers. When the core was exposed, they had to attack the core and destroy the nova. You, Creo, Satellizer, and Kazuya were assigned to be decoys and were waiting for everything else to be ready. Cassie had the job as a finisher considering that she's is the top tanked third year in East Genetics it was a job fitting her. Soon everything was ready and Milena was ready to commence the operation.

"All right. Decoys and strikers are in place and it looks like the finishers are in place as well. Is everyone ready?"

"Yes ma'am!"

"All right then. Get ready everyone. Operation will commence in thirty seconds."

"Roger that."

You and Creo were below behind a building while Kazuya and Satellizer were behind another a few feet away from you. Cassie and the finishers were at the end of the block ready to attack at the ready. You clenched your fist and took a deep breath.

"All right. Let's do this!" you thought to yourself.

"All right then," said Milena. "Operation will commence in ten seconds. Decoys get ready!"

Creo, Satellizer, and all the other Pandora deployed their volt weapons. Then Milena through their earphone started the countdown.

"Five... four... three... two... one! Decoys, spread out! Keep it busy so the strikers can attack!"

The decoys leaped into action and charged straight at the Nova. The Nova sensing the Pandora coming retaliated with it's tentacles. Some of the Pandora were able to dodge using acceleration. Others like Creo and Satellizer were able to deflect them by breaking through them. The Nova then released a freezing field immediately catching them off guard. You, Kazuya, and the other Pandora's limiters sprung into action.

"Freezing!"

You all activated your freezing disabling the freezing area and set all the Pandora free. You tried your best using your freezing area, but after a few seconds it started to fail you again.

"Damn it! Why now of all times?!" you cursed as your freezing began to dim down. "I can't... keep this up!"

Then a even powerful freezing overtook yours. You looked to right and saw Kazuya who amped up the power of his freezing to make up for yours.

"It's OK (name)! I got your back!" he called.

"Thank you! Don't push yourself too hard!" you called back.

"Strikers! Now's the time! Move in now! Expose the core!" called Milena.

At her command, more Pandora moved in and attacked the nova. Using their volt weapons, the striker Pandora attacked the nova until it's surface broke and the core was exposed shining brightly.

"All right finishers! Go! Get to the core and destroy it!"

The finisher Pandora leaped into action and went to the core. Cassie leaped into air and began to glow in a blue light.

"Quadruple acceleration!" she shouted as she shot towards the nova heading right for it's core like a rocket. You were amazed seeing Cassie use her acceleration for the first time,

"Incredible! I can't believe how fast she is! No wonder she's called the Godspeed of the East," you thought.

Milena watched as Cassie grew closer and closer to the Nova's core.

"Come on Cassie... We're all counting on you!" she thought clenching her fists.

"This will finish it!" Cassie yelled as she prepared to strike the core, but suddenly before she could, she was struck down by the Nova's tentacle and sent to the ground.

"No way!" you thought. "I knew that it's a Nova we're talking about, but how was it able to get Cassie during her acceleration?"

Cassie straightened up from the rubble. She wasn't hurt, but she was more surprised from what had just happened.

"Did... it time it's attack to intercept me?" she wondered. "The filthy monster knew my quadruple acceleration was coming!"

Back with you, Creo and Satellizer rushed to you and Kazuya's side.

"(name)! Kazuya! Are you two okay?" asked Creo.

"We're fine Creo," you said. "Thanks to Kazuya backing me up."

"What happened?" asked Satellizer. "The Nova was somehow able to predict Cassie's acceleration and stop her attack."

"I don't know," you said. "One things for sure, this is definitely not like the Nova me and Creo fought before."

"Wait... you and Creo fought a Nova?" gasped Kazuya. "When was this?"

"It's a long story, but back in the Ingrid incident, me and Creo fought a Nova and it was nothing like this one," you explained. "These Nova are on a whole different level the one from before."

Then Milena called out again.

"Decoys! Time for round 2! You have to distract the Nova one more time!

Suddenly the Nova's core began to glow in a bright light. It grew brighter and brighter. You immediately jumped to Creo and tried to save her from the impending doom,

"Creo get down!!"

But it was too late. Before anyone had a chance to react, it fired a devastating beam of light. The beam ripped through the entire area destroying everything in sight.
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.title: At the battlefield...

1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.content:
Everything was dark for a few seconds. Then you felt someone shaking your body and calling your voice.

"(name)?! (name)?! (name) can you hear me?"

You slowly opened your eyes the first you saw Creo's face hovering above yours. When she saw that you were waking up, she sighed with relief.

"(name)! Thank god you're okay."

"Ow... damn it. That hurt," you groaned as you slowly sat up. "What happened?"

"That Nova fired some kind of beam attack," said Creo. "It's destroyed everything around."

"I see. Wait, how is everyone else?"

"I don't know," said Creo. "Let's just hope that they aren't dead."

Then when you and Creo got up, Creo let out a groan of pain and ended up on one knee.

"Creo?! Are you okay?"

You reached to Creo's trying to help her up, but when you touched her arm, you felt something warm and wet on your hand. You looked at it to find that there was blood on your hand and it wasn't your own. You immediately found the source of it all. Creo's right arm had a giant gash on it dripping with blood.

"Oh no! Creo you're hurt!"

"I'm fine..." hissed Creo applying pressure to stop the bleeding. "It's just a scratch."

"That is not a scratch!" you cried. "You need a doctor right now! Come on! I'll take to Milena so she can...

You were about to help Creo to her feet, but then you finally noticed the battlefield around you. Everywhere you looked, rubble, debris, as well as fire was everywhere. Screams filled the air and what you saw made eyes widen in horror. Pandoras and Limiters laid everywhere. Their bodies were either bloody and charred or twisted in agony.

"Someone help me!" one screamed a Pandora who's leg was burned completely off.

"I'm blind! I can't see!" another said whose eyes were completely unfocused.

"Get the medics out here now!" Milena shouted to her radio. "What do you mean how many?! Get them all here right now!"

Seeing of this destruction and panic in front of you frozen. Your skin felt cold and a cold sweat ran through your body. To make matters worse, your PTSD kicked in again seeing all of this horror. You mind recalled the last Nova battle you were in with Makoto. The battlefield was a lot similar to the one you were in right now. You were all alone holding Makoto in your arms as the reinforcements had arrived and were engaging the nova. She was badly injured and was fading quickly.

"Makoto! Please hold on! The medics are on the way!" you cried tears running down your cheeks. "Just please hold on!"

"(name)... it's no use... I'm done for..." said Makoto weakly. "Leave me here... save yourself..."

"No I won't leave you!" you said. "It's my fault anyway! If my freezing hadn't given out, none of this wouldn't have happened! I'm so sorry!"

Makoto weakly placed a hand on your cheek and wiped away the tears falling on the right side of your face.

"It's okay... It's not your fault. Don't blame yourself... (name)...listen...I'm...sorry...for everything..."

"Please don't talk. Save your strength and hang on," you begged.

"(name)... I'm sorry...but I'm afraid this is... it for me...I just want... to say....that...I may not have...loved you the way...you loved me...but I was happy...that I was your Pandora... and I wish... that I could've... returned your feelings..."

"Makoto..."

Your squeezed Makoto's hand not wanting to let go of her. Then Makoto's hand went limp as she took her last breath. You shook her trying to wake her up, but she didn't. Your eyes filled with tears once again and bit your lip almost drawing blood. You let out a sobbing scream that echoed throughout the battlefield.

"(name)... (name)... !"

Then you heard a voice snapping out of your PTSD. Creo was standing in front of you with a hand on your shoulder trying snap you out of your daze.

"(name)? Are you okay?"

"Yes. I'm fine. Sorry I just tuned out a little," you said. "Come on, we gotta get you to Milena. Let's go!"

You were about to help Creo to her feet, but suddenly a tentacle zipped by right past you. It grabbed a Pandora that was a few feet from you and lifted it up into the sky. You watched as the Pandora was whisked away into the air and brought straight towards where it came from. The Nova. It also wasn't just her you saw. There were others too. The Nova collected all the Pandora in the area and the placed them on the surface of it's body. Then slowly one by one, the Pandora began to merge into the Nova's body disappearing.

"What the hell?!" you gasped. "Is that thing...absorbing them?!"

"My god..." gasped Creo.

Suddenly a huge burst of energy came from the Nova's surface. It was Cassie. She was trying to use her acceleration to break free from the Nova, but it didn't work. She couldn't move either. Then she too was absorbed into the Nova.

"Oh no! It even got Cassie!" you cried. "Is this thing gonna absorb every Pandora here?!"

Suddenly five more tentacles came out from the Nova and they were heading straight for Creo. You were already moving racing towards her desperate to get to her in time.

"Creo look out!!!"

You tackled Creo moving her out of the way making the tentacles get you instead. They wrapped around your arms and legs and lifted you up high into the air. You struggled to get free, but they held you tight.

"Damn it! Let go! Let go of me!"

Creo who recovered from being tackled saw you being lifted into the air.

"(name)! Hang on! I'm coming!"

She tried using acceleration to try and save you, but a couple more tentacles attacked her making her dodge the attack. Soon you were placed on the Nova's body just like the other Pandora. You tried once again to get away, but you were stuck like a fly caught in a fly trap. Then you felt a prickling and numbing sensation from the tips of your fingers from the top to your head.

"What...?! It's like... the Nova's getting inside my head!"

Slowly your body began to melt into the Nova's flesh. You couldn't break free and you couldn't move. Your vision began to darken as you sank into the Nova more and more.

"Someone help me!" you yelled. "Creo!"

"(name)! No!" Creo cried as she tried again to save you, but then she was assaulted by the tentacles again. She dodged and she dodged not wanting to suffer the same fate while at the same time trying to get to you,

"(NAME)!"

"Creo!"

Both your eyes met one more time in a brief moment. Then you vision became darkness before you were sucked into the Nova for good.
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.title: Continue...

1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.content:
"(NAAAAAAAAAAAAAAMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! !!!!!!!!!)", Creo cried out. She was about to dive in after you not able to withstand the thought you were beyond saving. Just as she was about to reach into the Nova she found herself tackled by someone.

"C'mon Creo! We have to retreat! I'll be damned if I let that thing take another friend.", said Satellizer.

"Grrrrrrrrr ragh! Let me go! He's still inside I can still save him!", Creo shrieked to Satellizer but to no avail would she release her.

"We need to cut our losses Creo. I swear we'll finish it but not now. Kazuya give us an opening!"

"On it!"

With that Kazuya enforced his field to allow the tendrils to slow enough for Satellizer to escape with Creo still refusing to leave. In the end the three of them managed to escape along with any surviving limiters and pandora making a full retreat until a new plan could be made to account the Nova absorbing the combatants.

A couple hours passed...

Kazuya and Satellizer sat together holding each other comforting the other. They had just lost a dear friend and Creo was a mess. She was in the infirmary recovering but was given heavy sedatives to calm her due to her violent reaction. News already made its way to west-genetics of the current list of known casulties, Rana, Arnett, Elizibeth, even Attia mourned for you when news reached them. Arnett took it the hardest but she coun't imagine the grief she knew Creo was going through.

Kazuya and Satellizer finally started to talk after the news finally settled in. "Kazuya..."

"Hes gone...hes gone."

"He.....sniff......I never..........He saved her."

"But Creo...what can she do? What else can we do?"

"I couldn't say."

"Oh god Satellizer I can't belieeeeeeheheheheheeevvvvvveeeeee.", Kazuya couldn't hold it in. He broke into tears, a mix of your loss and the reality he could have so easily lost her there at any moment. Satellizer couldn't hold her tears back but managed to contain her sorrow from overwhelming her.

Somewhere sister Margret simply saw the report and with a cold silent reaction slowly sat in her chair and lowered her upper body. The shame of her failure with you being taken in at full force...
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.title: Being mourned for...

1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.content:
Everyone in the control room was silent after what had just occurred. Then a woman on the radio broke the silence.

"Speed of targets remain unchanged. They're still en route to East Genetics."

"Damn these things," said Elize. "As if having multiple Nova wasn't bad enough, but now they have beam attacks that are wiping us out and now they can absorb Pandora? I don't even know if the med team can help the Pandora that were absorbed as well as (name). Not to mention they've never targeted a specific location like this either."

"If this is the new precedent then things are definitely not gonna be good for us," said Yu-Mei. "We need a new plan."

"Well on the bright side, we have our support team heading to East Genetics as we speak," said Elize turning to Sister Margaret. "Preparations are also being made to intercept the Nova as well."

"We also have the problem of the Nova's ability to absorb the Pandora," added Yu-Mei. "but I'm sure that West has obtained some data on it by now and is working on a countermeasure against it. There's no way the Nova won't beat us a second time. We'll make them pay."

Sister Margaret who had kept quiet finally spoke. "May God help us all if you're wrong."

Yu-Mei and Elize looked at each other with worry from Sister's Margaret's response. Then there was more trouble.

"Targets lost! I repeat targets lost!" A woman's voice shouted. "Readings have disappeared from all tracking systems!"

Yu-Mei, Elize, and Sister Margaret immediately snapped their heads toward the screen. Just as they heard, the Novas had completely disappeared from the map. Not a single one could be seen.

"Now what's going on?" wondered Elize.

Then suddenly the alarm blared out again and then the Nova reappeared on the radar, but the location they reappeared made Yu-Mei, Elize, and even Sister Margaret's eyes go wide from shock.

"This... this is impossible!!" cried Yu-Mei. "How can this be happening?!

"It can't be!" said Elize. "They just disappeared a few minutes ago and now this?!"

They double checked their eyes to see of they were playing tricks on them, but they were seeing correctly. All four of the Nova had reappeared on the radar surrounding the location that any of them at least expected. West Genetics.

"Damn it! They're right at our front door and we're sitting ducks!" cursed Elize.

"Did they plan this or something? We're completely surrounded!" said Yu-Mei. "Order the fourth-years on standby from East Genetics to come back immediately!"

"It won't do any good," said Elize. "There's no way they'll make it in time."

Sister Margaret stood there trying to make head or tails as to what was happening. Then she started to understand.

"It makes sense now," she said. "The attack on East Genetics was may have been just a distraction."

"What do you mean Sister?" asked Elize. "If they did plan this then what are they after?"

"If you recall the recent attacks before, the Nova moved around from place to place almost as if they were searching something," explained Sister Margaret. "The longest time they remained was approximately 5 hours and 37 minutes. Any longer than that time and they undergo a dimensional compression which causes them to explode. The reason why is because mostly likely, they leaving marks like that to indicate that they searched that particular area."

"So in other words... East Genetics wasn't their true target at all," said Elize. "It was us the whole time?"

"Yes," said Sister Margaret. "Which means that the Nova may have found what they've been looking for."

Yu-Mei and Elize stared at Sister Margaret. Then Yu-Mei stepped forward.

"In that case, please give us permission to mobilize ma'am," she said.

"We'll do whatever it takes to bring them down!" added Elize.

Sister Margaret nodded. "Gather the students and have them meet you in the auditorium Yu-Mei," said Sister Margaret. "I'll handle things from up here. Now go and good luck to the both you."

"Yes ma'am!" said Yu-Mei and Elize as they both ran out of the control room and prepared for battle,
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.title: A new battle plan

1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.content:
Things felt dizzy, limbs felt numb and half alive. Head was spinning. Felt sick from the stomach to the mouth.

Those were all Creo could comprehend as she woke up. She was too tired from the drugs that were meant to put her to sleep. But the traumatic event of your death kept haunting her. She started to get up much to the nurses shock. Kazuya and Satellizer quickly went over to her side to calm her down knowing they were the only ones she'd listen to. "Creo stop!", Kazuya said.

"(Name)...", she said faintly.

"She's delirious. I'll give her another dose.", one nurse suggested.

Before she could inject the needle into Creo, she knocked it out of the nurse's hand and tried getting off all of the medical equipment off her. "(Name)..."

"Creo stop! He's gone Creo. He's not coming back.", Satellizer said bluntly.

"DON'T YOU SAY THAT! We can get him back!", Creo roared viciously. Kazuya stepped back fearing Creo would battle Satellizer. But Satellizer kept Creo in place and held her back.

"He's gone Creo."

"NO! No...", Creo broke down into tears falling into Satellizer's arms. Satellizer embraced and comforted Creo with Kazuya joining in. They sat by Creo as she melted in grief unable to hold back her tears. After only half an hour an alarm went off.

"Defcon 4! Defcon 4! All pandora report to auditorium for announcements.", an automatic voice said across the pa system.

"Creo stay here.", Kazuya said.

"Fu&* off Kazuya. I'm getting ready for battle. Either I kill the Nova who took (Name) or I meet him on the other side."

"Creo you can't throw away your life so recklessly!"

"I have nothing else but those options. I'm not laying down until I kill at least one Nova. And I don't care how dazzed those drugs are making me."

"Ugh..Kazuya head over to the auditorium while I get her properly dressed in her gear.", Satellizer said.
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.title: At the infirmary...

choices: On the way towards the East Gate...
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.content:
Moments later, every Pandora and Limiter from West Genetics gathered in the auditorium. Yu-Mei stood in front of them and gave them the run-down.

"For those of you that are not aware of what is going on, four Nova have appeared," she said. "We have reason to think that they are the same Nova that attacked East Genetics and have absorbed their Pandora earlier. To make things more complicated, the fourth years we sent to help them have yet to return. Therefore, we have to assemble new platoons with the remaining one-third of our fourth years. It's pretty much our only option at this point. The third years will be our defense at each of our gates. Finally, the second years and their limiters will standby until further notice. For most of you, this will probably be the first time fighting the Nova I'm sure, but if you show the same strength that you always have shown every day here, then I'm sure that we will defeat the Nova. That is all."

After that, the third years and the fourth years left to prepare for battle. The second years all went into the waiting to await further orders. Soon only Satellizer, Kazuya

"Damn it. I hate having to be on stand by like this," she seethed. "I'd rather fight than sit here and wait. Especially after what's been going on."

"I agree. I personally want to destroy that Nova that took the life of (name)!" said Rana clenching her fists.

"I know, but we don't have a choice in the matter. Seconds years are supposed to stay on standby," said Kazuya. "But I agree with you guys."

Kazuya looked back at the door where the third years had just went through. He was thinking about Creo and her condition after she left.

"I'm especially worried about Creo. Especially in her current state," he said.

"Can you blame her? (name) was not only her limiter, he was her lover. Her one true partner," said Rana sadly. "She just witnessed him get absorbed by the Nova in front of her eyes. He saved her life. I may have only talked to him for a short time, but even I know that he's was a good and brave man."

"It's true. I may have hated him at first because of what happened in the past, but... as time went on and I got to know him, he actually was a very kind person," said Satellizer. "But... (name) is gone. And I want to believe that he's alive like Creo, but..."

There was a long pause. Then Kazuya spoke again.

"Do you think Creo will be in any condition to fight?" said Kazuya. "She'll be okay right?"

"I don't know Kazuya," said Kazuya. "All we can do right now is wait, hope, and pray."
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.title: Continue...

1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.content:
Meanwhile back outside, the other battle plan was put into motion. Four armored vehicles rumbled down the road tearing through the misty night. The plan was that four reformed platoons named 1 through 4 would each head for the gate and defeat the Nova before it would do any damage. Elize was chosen to lead Platoon 1 of the 4 and her platoon was en route to engage the Nova at the East Gate. Soon the Nova was in sight close to the east defensive gate and the trucks immediately came to a stop.

"Alright. The target is 400 meters to our north," said Elize as the door opened. "We will engage the Nova in exactly 180 seconds... All Pandora to the mission area... Limiters get into position with their vehicles and make sure that the defensive line is secure. Now Platoon 1, let's move out!"

"Yes ma'am!" everyone shouted as every single Pandora and Limiter swarmed out of the vehicles. The Pandora immediately went straight for the Nova with Elize leading the way. Soon they were right behind it. They were ready to strike at any time.

"Alright then. Volt Weapon Deploy, Doppelganger," said Elize as volt weapon appeared from both hands in the form of two daggers. "Now then, let's take this thing down."

She was just about to give the order to attack, but suddenly the Nova turned around. It also began to glow in a bright red light and it's flesh began to grow bumps all over it's body.

"What the hell?" murmured Elize. "Is it evolving or something?"

Bulges kept growing all over the body of the Nova and then, from the bumps on it's body, something began to come out of the Nova's flesh. At first, Elize couldn't make out what it was, but then as it came out more she could clearly see what it was. It was a girl! And there wasn't just one, more and more of them came out and rained down on the ground until the ground was littered of them. At first, Elize didn't know what these things were. That was until she took a look at them.

"No way...: she gasped. "Those are the Pandora that the Nova absorbed back from East Genetics!"

Suddenly, one of the girls stood up which turned out to be Cassie. She began to glow a bright red and then a strange object shaped like a diamond appeared in the center of her chest and emitted a familiar blue light. The light dimmed down and clothes appeared on the girls body like she was doing a volt texture. The clothes were torn with blue pentagon like lines on it and strange protrusions jutting out from back on her body. The one thing that really gave Cassie's new form a frightening appearance was her eyes. They were cold, lifeless, and no human emotion. Soon after her, one by one the other Pandora awoke as well and took on the same appearance as Cassie did.

"What are those things? Stigmata?" wondered Elize.

Then suddenly, one more body emerged from the Nova. This time unlike the others, the body came out, flipped in the air, and landed on it's feet making a small crater. Like the Pandora, the individual straightened up and a stigmata appeared in the center of it's chest, the protrusions appeared on it's back, and gained a torn up volt texture, but unlike the others, the uniform was for a male student. The individual straightened up and looked at Elize with it's zombie like eyes. Seeing it's face, Elize eyes filled with disbelief. For the person that stood in front of her was the last thing she of anyone else expected to be. You.

"No way... How... how is this even possible?!"

You stared at Elize with your eyes cold and glossed over like robot. Then the stigmata in your chest began to glow and suddenly you disappeared a blinding flash of light and Cassie and the others followed suit. Before Elize and the other Pandora could react, dozens of flashes of light darted right past them, breaking though the defensive gate and heading straight to the campus.

"Damn it they're fast! It's gotta be acceleration!" said Elize. "Destroy every last one! We can't let them reach the campus!"

"But ma'am, what about Target 1?" asked a Pandora.

"I'll take care of it myself!" said Elzie. "Now get going!"

"Yes ma'am!" shouted the Pandora as they all use acceleration in pursuit. Elize turned towards the Nova and readied her weapons.

"I knew this was going to happen eventually," she muttered. "Oh well, might as well be now."

Then with a fierce cry, she charged at the Nova ready to take it down.

In another part of Genetics, Yu-Mei who was leader of Platoon 3 was handling Nova problems of her own. She and her platoon were locked in a fierce fight with the Nova there and were getting nowhere.

"Damn it! Why won't this damn thing die?!" Yu-Mei growled.

Then she heard someone on the radio.

"Captain Yu-Mei. Do you copy?"

"This is Yu-Mei. Co ahead."

"We have a situation with Platoon 1. I don't know the specifics, but Captain Elize from Platoon 1 is engaging the Nova solo."

"What?!" said Yu-Mei. "You're telling me that Elize's fighting that thing alone!?"

"Yes ma'am, Please provide backup to her platoon once Target 3 is destroyed," said the woman on the radio.

"Easier said than done!" said Yu-Mei.

Suddenly Yu-Mei heard a loud crack and a noise. She looked up and she could the see the Nova's core right in the middle of it's chest completely exposed.

"Yes! The strikers broke through! Alright, girls I'll take it from here! Volt Weapon Deploy, Getsurō! "

Yu-Mei took a great leap into the air and deployed her volt weapon which was a bladed lance. With a giant thrust, she stabbed at the Nova's core with all her strength. The core cracked and cracked some more until finally it exploded erupting beams of light.

"Elize, just hang on!" thought Yu-Mei as she was swallowed up by the blinding light.
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.title: On the way towards the East Gate...

1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.content:
Sister Margaret still stood there watching the battles unfold on the monitor. She had witnessed everything that had happened with Elize's squad and she wore a grim expression in a mixture or fear and anger.

"It's just as I feared," she said. "Nova Form."

"Sister Margaret, Sakurako Shekoin and Irene Vanette have been injured while battling the enemy Pandora," a woman said.

"Send a medic out to them, immediately," replied Sister Margaret.

"Yes ma'am!" the woman replied. "Sending message to standby medic team now."

"Sister Margaret!" another woman shouted. "The enemy Pandora are approaching the East Gate! They're about to breach it!"

"The East Gate?" thought Sister Margaret. "What purpose would they have going over there?"

She thought and she thought trying to figure out the Nova's intentions. Then it came to her.

"Of course," she thought. "It makes sense now. I know exactly what they're after. That gate is the closest after all."

"Order all the third years in their current positions to withdraw and send them to back up the Pandora at the East Gate!" she ordered.

"Yes ma'am!"

Sister Margaret immediately left the control room and headed towards the elevator. She stepped inside and closed the elevator behind her. As the elevator went down, she pulled out her communicator.

"This is Sister Margaret. Patch me through to Satellizer El Bridget, Ganessa Roland, Rana Linchen, and Creo Brand.
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.title: In the Command Center...

choices: To ignore the order and go to the front lines to save you
Obey orders and go to the Ravensborne Nucleoshade
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.content:
In a separate room, all of the third years with their limiters were waiting for the moment when they would be needed in battle. Most of them were feeling a little tense and nervous about fighting the Nova due to it being their first time. Although there were some that were ready to fight the Nova. One in particular was sitting alone with her head down. The sedatives had almost completely worn off at this point, but Creo was still feeling emotional from your demise. She felt angry for the Nova taking you away from her. She felt saddened that you were gone. Most of all, she felt really lonely without you. If she could have saved you when she had a chance...

"Damn it," she cursed squeezing her hands.

Arnett stood a few feet away watching Creo and she felt sorry for her. She wanted to help her. She wanted her to be her happy self again, but she didn't know how to. Just then, Attia and Ingrid came up to her.

"How's she holding up?" asked Attia.

"I don't know, but from what I can see, not very good," said Arnett.

"I see," said Attia. "I heard that she had to have sedatives injected in her. A normal Pandora would have been knocked out for hours, but somehow she's still awake."

"Well women like us tend to be strong willed," said Ingrid. "Especially when someone precious to them was taken away from them. I should know."

"I just hate having to see her like this," said Arnett. "I wish there was something I could do."

"There's nothing you can do for her," said a voice.

The three turned and Chiffon along with Ticy came up to them.

"That's what sucks in this world we live. No matter how many times we win and no matter how many times we save lives when we fight the Nova, we always end up losing people."

"Chiffon. Let me ask you something," said Arnett. "I know I shouldn't be asking, but shouldn't we just let Creo stay behind with the second years? I mean... wouldn't she be safer that way?"

"I'm afraid it's hard to say," replied Chiffon. "It would be safer for Creo, but knowing her she would most likely ignore orders and join the battle. She's hellbent on getting back at that Nova and she isn't going to stop until she succeeds in getting her revenge. It would best for her to join the battle. We wouldn't want to her to cause a scene now if she was ordered to back out now would we?"

"But..." protested Arnett.

"It's fine," interrupted Chiffon. "Besides I think Creo would tell you the same thing? Isn't that right?"

Sure enough, Creo stood behind them making Arnett jump a little.

"I take it you overheard us?" asked Chiffon.

"Yeah. Starting from when Chiffon showed up at least," said Creo. Then she turned to Arnett. "Listen Arnett. I'll be fine. Until I can avenge (name)'s death, I have no intention of backing out from this now."

"But.. how are you gonna be able to fight without a limiter?" asked Arnett. "If you get hit by a freezing field you won't stand a chance."

"Then I'll just have to avoid them and not get hit won't I?" said Creo.

You along the other Pandora using acceleration raced through the halls until the Ravensbourne Nucleotide was in sight. Cassie extended her blades and in a few quick swipes, she cut through the entrance door in an instant. You and the squad of Pandora raced through the entrance and towards the elevator. Sister Margaret and a few of the staff in the Command Center could only watch as the Pandora made their advance.

"The Enemy has entered the Ravensborne Nucleotide!" a staff member said. "They're heading for the elevator!"

Cassie used her blades again and cut through the elevator and cut the cable. Making the elevator drop all the way down until it crashed at the bottom. You all jumped down the shaft and burst into the hallway at lightning speed. As you all ran, the barriers around you were closing one by one.

"All the main doors are closing! Sectors 22 and 31 are now shut!"

Just then, a barrier up up ahead was closing. It didn't stop you all though. You, Cassie, and the rest of the possessed Pandora ran past the barrier before it shut.

"Damn it! Enemy has cleared Barrier 51!" A staff member cursed.

"Barrier 53 is closing now to stop them!" another said. "Have them rerouted to level 6 and proceed to the next phase!"

"Understood! Enemy advancing to Level 7 now!"

You and the possessed Pandora came across a couple barriers that were closed, but you quickly made your way taking a different route. Then you all came to a dead end. You tried going back the way you came, but the barrier that you came through was quickly shut trapping you all like rats. You looked around trying to find a way to escape, but there was no way out. Cassie used her blades to try and cut through the barrier, but this time her blade broke from the impact, but it quickly regenerated. The metal was a lot tougher than it was from before. Then you all heard a hissing noise. You looked up and you all saw vents on the ceiling above you emitting a strange white smoke.

"Neutralization system activated! Filling area with non-lethal gas... neutralization level reached!

The gas seemed to be working, but unfortunately it didn't. Your stigmata began to glow in the center of your chest and then letting out a fierce cry, you slammed your fist into the ground and unleashed a powerful shock wave bursting right through the barrier.

"Impossible! The Barrier has been destroyed! Not to mention the gas was ineffective and that beam tore through the barrier like it was nothing!" A staff member cried.

"No doubt that stigmata has to be the cause," thought Sister Margaret. "Not even our most powerful Pandora and Limiters don't have that kind of power and strength. I've never seen this before."

"What now Sister Margaret?" asked a staff member worried.

"To start, what's our current status? As far as the Nova are concerned, the Third Platoon has just arrived is currently engaged with Target One along with Platoon One. All Platoons are also continuing their attacks. Regarding the enemy, they are moving towards level eight. We are having them rerouted to our primary defensive line. Stationed at that position we have Ingrid Bernstein and Attia Simmons prepared to engage."

"Only those two? What happened to Arnett Mcmillan?" asked Sister Margaret.

"I don't know. Last time we heard from her, she was seen heading to the East Gate along with Creo Brand."

"I should've known," thought Sister Margaret. "Those two must have gone to try and save (name). Damn. Of all times..."

Then she pressed a button patching her through to not only the third years, but also the second years on the lower floors who were defending the main door to the Holy Remains.

"I have something important to say," she said. "As you are all well aware rumor or not, the Ravensborne Nucleotide contains the body of the woman who gave birth to all Pandora. We stored it here to keep it safe. We don't know how the Nova were able to locate the remains or why they're after them, but I do know that if lose t remains to them, mankind if surely doomed. Therefore it's imperative that you protect them. No matter what. I'm counting on you."

You and the Pandora resumed your mission and dashed through the halls once more in search of the Holy Remains. It seemed that you would all make it there with no problem, but then a giant familiar looking spiked ball shot out from the darkness. You immediately jumped out of the way and looked at your attackers. There standing there were Attia and Ingrid with their limiters at the way blocking your path.

"Sorry, but you're not getting any further!" said Ingrid her tonfas raised.

"Direct confrontation's not my usual thing," said Attia. "But I guess I'll do what I can for now."

"Typical Attia," said Ingrid. "At least you're back to being yourself again."

Everything was at a stand off for a moment. Then both sides attacked as the fight began.

Having no other option, you were forced to go left. You continued on until you were close to the Secondary Defensive line. You were all about to use Acceleration to go faster, but then you suddenly sensed danger. You immediately jumped back and three beams of light shot out from the darkness. One narrowly missed you and Cassie was able to dodge it as well, but the beam hit Milena right on her left shoulder. It wasn't as serious wound, but blood oozed out from her shoulder. Then a Pandora stepped out from the darkness.

"So I missed did I? You're tougher than I expected."

It was Elizabeth along with her limiter André. She had her volt weapon which had the form of stigmata-like satellites at the ready ready to fire at the three of you once more.

"I'm sorry (name)," she said. "I'm happy to see you, but at the same time I can't help but feel sad for what the Nova has done to you. Even though you're a good friend of mine, I'm afraid I have to take you down. You now face the 2nd ranked third year, Executor of Ingenious Schmes, Elizabeth Mably. André, be on guard and watch out for the enemy's freezing."

"Yes, my lady," said André.

Cassie spikes began glowing once more and she activated her freezing, but André was able to counter and neutralize the freezing with a freezing of his own and froze you, Cassie, and Milena. You were raised your hand about to activate your ability once again, but Elizabeth immediately went on the offensive.

You and Cassie dodged the beams using acceleration, but one beam hit Milena right at the stigmata on the middle of her chest sending her to the ground unconscious. The stigmata on her chest glowed and then it died down. The blue lines on her face disappeared and her blade slowly turned back to human hands.

"Well what do you know?" grinned Elizabeth. "It seems that if we destroy the stigmata in their chest, we'll be able to free the victims from the Nova's control. André! Again!"

Your stigmata began to glow brightly and you used your attack. You screamed releasing a powerful energy and slammed your fist into the ground releasing a massive shock wave sending cloud and dust everywhere. Elizabeth and André couldn't see anything. Then the smoke cleared and Elizabeth was shocked to see that you and Cassie had disappeared. There was nothing left, but a giant hole on the floor leading to the lower levels.

"Listen up. For all those engaging the enemy Pandora, aim for the stigmata on their chests. If you destroy that, we'll be able to save the people from the Nova's control."

It took all day to get even close to the United States and was nightfall by the time you were reaching Alaska territory. It was starting to get a little chilly so you and Kazuya wore coats while girls however wore their regular clothes with nothing but a vest over them.

"Brrr! The cold is almost overwhelming," shivered Rana. "If only there was some way to keep warm." She looked at Kazuya smiling mischievously and scooted closer to him. "Please Kazuya. Hold me."

"Here (name). My hands are warm," she said.

"Thanks."

You instantly felt your hands warm up. Then you and Creo looked at each other and you couldn't help your face warming up a little too. You squeezed Creo's hands and you snuggled up against her making Creo's eyes widen a little surprise.

"(name)! What are you..."

"Actually... the rest of my body is still feeling a little cold," you said. "Is... it OK if I do this?"

Creo smiled and stroked your head and kissed it. "Of course you can."

Your head on Creo's shoulder and savored her warmth which felt very pleasant. She felt just like a warm water bottle only softer. You hummed softly enjoying the warmth when...

Suddenly, you heard the pilots speak through the radio.

"Attention! We're picking up a distress signal! We're changing course and heading towards the site."

"A distress signal?"you wondered. "I wonder what that's all about."

"You got me," said Kazuya. "I'm just as clueless as you are."

"Me either," added Rana.

"Well whatever it's about, I get the feeling we're gonna find out and it's probably not a good thing," said Creo as she fastened her seat belt.

You sat up and fastened your seatbelt as welll as did everyone else as the helicopter changed course. Soon the helicopter was hovering around the forest and you heard the pilots again.

"We're closing in on the signal. It's right below us."

"The snow coming down like crazy. We have no visual."

You looked out of the window trying to see what was going on. The helicopters lights searched around trying to see what was going on below. Then you saw something in the darkness. A giant dark shadow. You squinted your eyes trying to see what it was. Then... your eyes widened in shock and horror. You knew what it was.

"Son of a bitch..." you murmured. "No... no it can't be!"

"(name)? What's wrong?" asked Satellizer. "What do you see?"

You didn't answer her. Your body was stiff in shock. You couldn't move.because you wanted to have the helicopter's light confirm what you were seeing praying that you were wrong. Satellizer and Rana looked out another window so they could see what you were seeing. The helicopter's light slowly looked around until finally the dark figure was shown to the light and to your horror, you were might. Satellizer and Rana gasped in surprise for the figure turned out to be what you hoped it wouldn't be. A S class Nova. Creo and Kazuya also looked through another window and they saw the nova as well. You can still remember the recent trauma that you experienced a while back. It made you scared but at the same time angry as well.

"It can't be..." murmured Creo. "An S class Nova?!?"

"What's a Nova doing all the way out here?!" exclaimed Kazuya as he picked up a com from a radio to communicate with the pilots. "This is Kazuya. When it appeared, did you pick up it's dimensional vibrations?"

"Unfortunately we couldn't!" said the pilot. "This blizzard is causing all of our equipment to malfunction!"

Then a female voice came through through the line.

"Don't worry. Leave this to me. I have an idea of what's going on."

"Who's that?" asked Kazuya. "Is someone else on this line?"

The woman on the other line, ignored Kazuya's question and continued.

"About three kilometers from you, there's a Chevalier petroleum storage base. If the base is compromised, the enviromental impact could be disastrous. The petroleum spills would also result in wide spread seawater contamination. You all have to stop the Type S and defend the base at all costs. That's your top priority."

Hearing the whole thing, you grabbed the com from Kazuya and spoke to the unknown woman.

"Are you serious right now?! There's only three Pandora here!"

"You're the only ones who can stop that from happening," said the woman. "Also reinforcements are on the way so calm down."

"They better be," you mumbled.

"Take it easy (name)," said Creo as she rested a hand on your shoulder.
"
"Sorry," you said as you handed the com back to Kazuya. "I guess I'm a little freaked out that's all."

Then you heard the pilot again.

"The wind is too way choppy to make a safe landing!" he said. "All Pandora and Limiters prepare to depart! Once the hatch is open, commence combat operations immediately!"

"Ex...cuse me, but couldn't translate for me please?" asked Rana who was a little puzzled.

"Isn't obvious? When the hatch opens, we jump out and start fighting," said Satellizer who was more than ready to fight.

Rana and Kazuya looked at Satellizer like she said something foreign while you and Creo prepared yourselves.The helicopter eventually was close enough to the ground and the hatch door opened. Cold winds and snow were blasted in your face the door lowered. As you stared out to the ground below, you felt a hand touch yours which belonged to Creo.

"Are you OK?" she asked.

"I'm fine," you said. "I... was just freaked out for a moment. I'm OK. Don't worry. Let's just take out this Nova and call it a day."

"Right," said Creo. "Make sure you got my back OK?"

"No problem."

"Are you guys ready?!" called out Satellizer.

"I am!" said Rana. "But I don't really have a choice!"

"Let's do this!" called Creo.

"All right! Let's go!" said Kazuya.

Satellizer took a running start and she jumped off the door holding Kazuya's and hand both fell towards the ground below. You and Creo followed soon after with you jumping off first and Creo coming after and then Rana. All of you landed safely in the snow as the helicopter flew away.

"Attention all units. This is Mission Control. Proceed to the combat area. Target is in sight. I repeat, target is in sight."

"It's about to start ladies."

"We'll be there right away doctor."

The mysterious woman pressed a couple of keys and a live feed appeared on the screen showing your group as well as the Nova. Then three girls entered the room all looking young for their age. One was dark skinned and had long black hair. The second had short purple hair with tanish white skin. The last one had pure white skin with long silver hair with a crimson bang.

"Now then..." said the mysterious woman. "Now the show really begins. Keep a close eye ladies."

As they all watched the feed, the feed showed an up close look of your group.

"That's her," said the girl with silver hair. "She's the one who helped protect West Genetics in Japan during the 10th Nova Clash."

"And that girl with the silver hair..." said the girl with purple hair. "She's also took part in it. And that boy... I heard that he's no ordinary limiter. Then again, I heard rumors that say all the people in West Genetics are far from ordinary."

"Prestigious debutantes you say? More like spoiled brats," the girl with the purple hair sneered.
