"All right then," said Kazuya. "Now what do we do?"

"Isn't it obvious?" you said cracking your knuckles. "I say we get busy and kick that Nova's butt to kingdom come!!"

"Take it easy (name)," said Creo. "We can't just rush in without a plan. This is a S class Nova we're talking about here."

Suddenly, you all heard the whirling sound of helicopters. Sure enough, high above them a squad of military planes zipped past. One flew right above the Nova dropping flares all around it so it could be seen. The other air crafts that were gunners and bombers prepared to attack.

"What the heck...?" you murmured.

"Reinforcements are here already?" pondered Satellizer.

Then the bombers went on the offensive dropping multiple bombs right on the Nova. They hit the Nova exploding with mighty booms causing the ground to shake and snow dust flying everywhere.

"All right!" cheered Rana. "They did it!"

"No they didn't," said Creo. "Look."

Sure enough when the dust cleared, the Nova still stood remaining untouched from the assault. The gunners took their turn next. They fired a salvo of rounds at the Nova giving it everything they got. Unfortunately, they couldn't do a thing either. TheNova deflected them all with ease. Then the Nova began to glow and then unleashed a freezing field. It expanded throughout the area heading right for your group's location.

"Kazuya!"

"Right!"

You and Kazuya immediately reacted by unleashing both of your freezing fields combining them and disabling the Nova's freezing field. However, the Nova immediately turned to your group's direction and was now heading right for you.

"Damn it! It's coming straight at us!" Rana said.

Then suddenly, two huge missiles shot right past your heads and hit the Nova with a mighty boom making snow dust fly all around once again. As soon as this happened, a thought struck you. Something about all of this seemed a little off.

"What the heck...? They deployed cruise missiles? Something about this is strange. It's like they were too prepared for this," you thought.

The Nova continued coming towards you all and the girls prepared to fight. They all deployed their volt weapons and stood their ground.

"Listen up! It's too risky to fight the Nova head on, so I have a plan!" said Satellizer. "There's a gully not too far from here! Me and Creo will keep the Nova distracted and draw it out! Once we do, Rana....?

"I'll bury that evil machine alive!" finished Rana.

"Sounds like a plan," said Creo. "I'm with you Satellizer!"

"If thing's get hairy, me and (name) will have your back!" called Kazuya.

"Be careful you two!" you added. "Give that thing what for!"

Satellizer and Creo nodded and then they both dashed at the Nova while Rana headed towards the cliffs. As soon as they were close enough, they made a feint and darted to their the left with the Nova following in pursuit. The Nova attacked using it's tentacles, but Satellizer sliced and slashed them using her Nova Blood blade and Creo bashed and punched using her Infinity Fang Gauntlets. Then the Nova unleashed another freezing. You and Kazuya once more used your freezing fields to stop the Nova's freezing, but then your freezing field began to falter and soon weaken.

"Damn it! Not now!" you thought.

Then Kazuya's overtook yours and disabled the Nova's freezing enabling Satellizer and Creo to take off running again with the Nova in hot pursuit of them.

"(name)? Are you OK?" asked Kazuya.

"I'm fine," you said. "But... it seems that my freezing is still weak. Damn it. And I thought it was stronger this time..."

"It's ok," said Kazuya. "Just don't push yourself too hard."

"Right."

Creo and Satellizer were soon deep in the gully to spring their trap.

"Rana! Do it!" yelled Creo as she and Satellizer used acceleration to get out of the way.

Rana immediately jumped up from a cliff above springing wings of light upon her back as she released her stigmata.

"Sacred extremities fist!!! Flame Fang!!!"

She slammed her fist into the ground making the ground crackle and break. The attack caused an avalanche causing rock and ice to fall upon the Nova. The Nova not expecting it was buried under all the rock and snow. When the avalanche stopped, the Nova was nowhere to be seen. The trap had worked.

"Well that was easy," said Rana.

"Yeah. Way too easy," said Satellizer.

"I agree. Compared with the other fights we had with the Nova, this was certainly different than the others," added Creo.

"Hey you guys! Way to go!"

The girls turned and they saw you and Kazuya climbing up to them. Then just as you both managed to climb up, you saw a tentacle spring up from the ground and dart right towards Rana.

"Rana! Watch out!"

Not even hesitating, you dashed forward using your acceleration, grabbed Rana and got her out of the way just in time. Then another appeared. This time right behind Kazuya. Satellizer dashed toward and pushed Kazuya out of the way just before it hit him, but she couldn't stop it from hitting her. The tentacle hit it's mark grazing Satellizer right in her midsection sending her rolling and tumbling to the ground.

"Satellizer!" cried Creo as she rushed to help her, but then another tentacle appeared and barred her way. "Damn it! Move it!" she growled as she punched it shattering it.

"Don't worry! I got her!" you yelled as you dashed forward using acceleration.

"No! (name)! There's another one!" cried Rana.

But it was too late. As you rushed toward Satellizer using acceleration, another tentacle sprung up and darted straight at you. You jumped to the right attempting to dodge, but the blade of the tentacle slashed right at your shoulder making you scream in pain as you fell to the ground holding your shoulder. You looked up trying to get back up only to look in time to see the tentacle aimed right at you. Just when you thought that the tentacle was gonna kill you...

1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.content:
Then suddenly at the last second someone came to your rescue. She used her giant pair of claws and crushed the tentacle just when it was about to hit you. At first you didn't know who it was, but then you saw her face. Your rescuer was a certain girl with short brown hair with a white ribbon and as soon as you saw her narrowed eyes and her smile, you immediately knew who it was.

"Chiffon Fairchild!"

"Nice to see you too (name)," she said.

Just then the Nova slowly came out of the snow still alive firing it's tendrils once more. Satellizer, Creo, and Rana prepared to fight once again, but then another girl joined the fray. She had long blonde hair and had her floating stigmata at the ready and fired at the tendrils destroying them.

"No way..." said Satellizer.

"Elizabeth Mably is here too?" finished Creo.

Then two boys along with Kazuya appeared by your side. The first one you recognized immediately for he was Elizabeth's limiter.

"André!"

"It's good to see you too (name)" said André.

"(name)! Are you OK? You're hurt!" said Kazuya worriedly.

You looked at your shoulder and saw that you had a gash oozing blood.

"Don't worry I'm fine. It's just a scratch," you said.

Then another boy appeared next to you. He looked a little like Kazuya, but he had darker hair and gray eyes. You had to assume that he was Chiffon's limiter.

"You shouldn't be tough after taking a hit like that," said the boy. "That's a pretty bad wound."

"André. You and Eugene take good care of those two will ya?" asked Elizabeth,

"Whatever you saw milady," said Andre bowing.

"Alright! Satellizer, Rana, and Creo, you're on decoy duty," said Chiffon. "I'll serve as the striker and Elizabeth, you're the finisher. Let's put an end to this thing!"

"Right!"

Everyone then scattered using acceleration. The Nova went on the attack firing it's tendrils at Satellizer, Rana, and Creo, but they all dodged the attacks with ease. Chiffon used her acceleration and dive bombed right at the Nova.

"Eugene! Get ready!"

"Right!"

"Ereinbar Set!"

Both Chiffon and Eugene glowed in a blue light as they activated their Ereinbar Set. The Nova sensing Chiffon coming activated it's freezing and attempted to freeze her, but Eugene was ready and fired a freezing of his own allowing Chiffon to attack. With a mighty swing and shout, Chiffon used her giant claws to hit the Nova at it's surface exposing the core. As soon as Chiffon exposed the core, her eyes widened.

"This Nova...! I knew it!"

Right then, Elizabeth fired her stigmata weapon right at the center of the Nova's core. The Nova exploded with a mighty boom as it was finally destroyed.

"All right!" cheered Kazuya. "We got it!"

"Wait a second..." you said. "Something's not right here."

"What do you mean?" asked Creo as he came up to you. "We beat the Nova didn't we?"

You didn't answer. You came up to the Chiffon and Elizabeth and walked past them. Then you saw it. There were pieces of the Nova scattered everywhere. Metal bits and some parts lay everywhere. As soon as you saw this, you came to a realization.

"This Nova...it's a...."

"A fake," finished Chiffon.

"Wait... a fake Nova?" wondered Satellizer. "How is that possible?"

"Who knows? Rumor has it that they've been developing these Nova fakes right here in Alaska," said Elizabeth. "If you look at this from another point of view, it was like we were being tested."

"That would explain why they were so overly prepared," said Kazuya.

"It is standard procedure," added Creo. "But wait..."

"Are you meaning to tell us that they went through all this trouble to send us here, keep us in the dark, fake a distress call just to involve in a test run?" said Satellizer who sounded a little angry.

"Actually Elizabeth and I were told that this was related to disaster relief," said Chiffon.

"Disaster relief my ass!" you snapped. "They just practically used us! Plain and simple!"

"Now, now. Calm down," said Creo.

"Whatever the case, it would appear that were being tested," said Elizabeth. "and this is only the beginning."

"Damn it, what a fucking load," you muttered. "What do you think Kazuya? Kazuya?"

Then you noticed that Kazuya had a dumb smile on his face blushing a little. You looked to where he was look and blushed. Satellizer outfit was once again torn, exposing very much of her boobs. Satellizer noticed this and yelped in embarrassment covering herself.

"Kazuya! Avert your eyes!" said Rana as she covered Kazuya's eyes.

"(name)! You too!" snapped Creo as she covered your eyes too.

Chiffon chuckled. "You do know you can use your volt texture to fix that. Unless you want these boys to look at you."

"(name)! Who's side are you on anyway?!" snapped Satellizer glaring at you.

Satellizer walked over to Rana to about to get into another argument her when she stepped on a fish causing her to slip. With a yelp she fell flat on her face her glasses falling off. Because of all the Nova appearing frequently not to mention with the recent tenth Nova clash, the Chevalier General Command had announced a new Pandora plan; the E-Pandora project, spearheaded by a woman named Doctor Scarlet Ohara."

"Correct," said Chiffon. "However there are some girls that are incompatible, but want to fight as Pandora. That's where the E-Pandora comes in. This project will allow those girls along with the ordinary to have a chance to become Pandora."

"What?!" you and Creo said simultaneously.

"That's right," continued Chiffon. "This will be made possible by implanting artificially-made stigmata. I know that it sounds crazy, but it's considered to be revolutionary breakthrough although there are some people that are against it because of it's unethical nature."

"Well yeah. I can't blame those people. It sounds crazy," you said. "I mean... should those girls even be considered to be Pandora?"

"Artificial or not, a Pandora is a Pandora," said Elizabeth as she gazed into the water. "However I'll assume that there will be volunteers who want to become E-Pandora only for the glory and status they get after the tour of duty. But as it is now, less than two percent of girls are verified to become Pandora anyway. After all it is a dangerous job and everyone knows it. Countless lives have been lost including the Pandora fighting against those Nova. We need all the help we can get. Given the circumstances, it would be a mistake to pass any Pandora volunteers only because they're artificial. There is a worldwide shortage of Pandora after all. This could be the answer to all of our problems."

You stared at Elizabeth a little surprised. "Wow... pardon me if this sounds rude Elizabeth, but I don't think I've ever heard you talk this much before."

Elizabeth turned to you and smiled. "Shows how much you really know me," she said. "You may not know this, but I can be quite the chatterbox if I wanted to be."

"Hey you guys! Look!" called Rana pointing to a building close to the shore. "The laboratory is straight ahead!"

Soon after that, you all made it to shore and were riding on board military jeeps heading inside the lab. As they drove on, they passed by on what seemed to be the inside of a factory.

"It seems like this place used to be some kind of industrial plant," said Kazuya.

"And the perfect place to keep a secret covered up," added Chiffon with a smile.

You and Kazuya looked at Chiffon a bit irked, but Chiffon giggled.

"Don't mind me. I'm just kidding," she said.

"Jokes are supposed to be funny and that clearly wasn't funny," you said.

Then Chiffon whispered something to you. "By the way (name), there's something that I need to say before we get off."

"What? Another bad joke?"

"No. Look I'm serious. I need you to try to lie low alright?"

You raised an eyebrow in confusion. "Why do you say that?"

"Duh! It's because of you. You're the Imperfect Limiter remember?"

"Yeah. As far as everything in West Genetics yes," said Chiffon. "But as far as this goes you're still pretty infamous. If people found out who are, you're gonna be knees deep in trouble. Especially with the other Pandora."

"Feh. I ain't scared of a couple Pandora," you said. "If they have a problem with me, then I'll just fight em."

"(name) I agree with Chiffon," said Creo. "The last thing you should be doing is starting a fight with a bunch of Pandora. You're starting to sound like Satellizer. Just do what Chiffon says OK?"

You sighed. "Oh alright, but if anyone picks a fight with me I have a right to defend myself and I won't hesitate to do so."

Soon after the girls went to get their new volt textures and you all headed for the assembly hall,

When you all arrived there, the hall was filled with Pandora as well as a couple of limiters.You looked around the hall in amazement.

"Holy cow... what is this some kind of gathering?" you asked.

"Skilled Pandoras have been called here from Genetics facilities from around the world to collect data," said Chiffon. "Pretty cool right?"

"Indeed it is," said Rana who was a little embarrassed. "It's quite overwhelming."

"Hey! Chiffon! Over here! Long time no see!" said a voice.

Then a young girl came up to Chiffon. She had a buxom figure, blue eyes, and had magenta hair which had the ends encircle her neck like pincers, while the rest framed her face, her bangs stop just above her eyes.

"Hey Roxanne!" said Chiffon. "Good to see you. I haven't seen you since the world carnival!"

"Yeah, When you kicked my butt from here to kingdom come," chuckled Roxanne.

"Oh yeah. Some proper introductions are in order," said Chiffon turning to you and your friends. "This is Roxanne Elipton. A friend of mine from Genetics America, US. Roxanne, these are a few of my classmates. Satellizer, Rana, Creo, and their limiters (name) and Kazuya."

"Nice to meet ya," said Roxanne. "Just call me Roxanne The Immortal."

"Um... Am I to believe that this young girl cannot be killed?" asked Rana.

Then another Pandora came up. She was short, had cream-coloured hair that was short at the back with side-bangs covering both sides of her cheeks, brown eyes, and had a set of headphones. Roxanne turned around clearly a little insulted.

"What did you say?"

"I see you're just as uncouth and sassy as ever," said the girl.

"And who is that?"asked Satellizer.

"That is the infamous Charles Bonaparte of Genetics France, LDT. Aka The Young Tempest Phoenix," said Chiffon.

"Hey! (name)! Satellizer!"

Just then, you and Satellizer heard yet another voice. Only this one was all too familiar. You and Satellizer turned and when you saw her, your faces brightened in delight for it was none other than Cassie Lockhart.

"Cassie!"

Cassie ran up to you and gave you a big hug. "It's so good to see you!"

"Cassie! It's great to see you!" you said.

"You too (name)!" said Cassie. "I was hoping I'd see you and Satellizer here."

"Oh! It's her! The Godspeed of the East to fought us as the lesbian nude cheetah!" said Rana.

"Lesbian?" questioned Cassie.

"Just.... ignore her," you said sweatdropping.

"Yeah. She's not exactly on the bright side," added Satellizer.

"That's the understatement of the year," muttered Creo.

Then suddenly another Pandora joined the party. She crept up behind Cassie and grabbed her breasts causing her to help in surprise. You and Satellizer blushed bright red from this sight and Creo covered your eyes not wanting to see blushing herself.

"Hmm... supple with a mix of firm and bounciness," she said. "If I had to make a guess with size, I'd say she's a D cup."

"What the heck are you? A boobologist or something?!" cried Cassie defensively covering her chest.

"She is the one and only Julia Munberk," said Chiffon. "She's from Genetics Germany Panzer. She also goes by the title the Maverick of Walpurgis."

"Man... so she's a big deal too huh?" said Kazuya. "I feel like I just walked into a celebrity's party or something."

Just then, a small crowd began to form around the girls.

"Hey! Check it out! They're the fabulous five!" said a Pandora.

"Yeah! I can't believe they're here!" said another.

"The Fabulous Five?" wondered Satellizer. "What's that?"

"You don't know? Those girls along with Chiffon are five of the most third-year Genetics members in the entire world," said Elizabeth.

"No way! You're kidding!" you said. "Wow Cassie, I didn't think you were such a celebrity much less that powerful."

"Well it's no big deal," said Cassie. "But I can safely say that I can hold my own in rankings."

"She's not the only one," said Chiffon. "Elizabeth is just behind them in ranking. She could become one of the newest members of the five if she wanted to be."

"Wow..." Kazuya said. "That's pretty amazing."

Elizabeth chuckled. "Yeah. For the moment. I will be fighting a tough opponent pretty soon. Holly Rose of Genetics Britain UK. Speaking of which, I'm surprised she's not here."

"Now that you mention it, it's not like her to miss a party like this," said Chiffon thoughtfully.

"Hey Creo. You think that you could get that high in ranking one of these days?" you asked. "I mean you're pretty strong yourself."

"No way," said Creo. "There's no way I'd stand a chance with those big shots. I could hardly even stand up to Chiffon. I'd get my ass kicked."

"Don't sell yourself short Creo," said Chiffon. "You could get high in the ranks if you wanted to. Just keep working hard and you'll get there."

Just then, a female voice came from a loudspeaker.

"Attention all Pandora and Limiters. Please report to the Assembly Hall. Pandora are to first to test their Volt Textures in the fitting rooms."

"Well then that's our cue," said Chiffon as she and the other girls went to the fitting rooms while you and Kazuya waited for them outside.
1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.title: At the assembly hall...

1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.content:
After all the Pandora got dressed in their new volt weapons, you all gathered in the assembly hall. On the stage, a young woman stepped out on the podium. She had mauve colored hair, had an average build of a woman and wore a white lab coat.

"My name is Scarlet Ohara and I'm the head of the E Pandora project," she said. "The goal of this plan is pretty simple and that is to create artificially create stigmata-compatible subjects. However in order to successfully do this, I need all of you original Pandora to provide the data necessary. There is no doubt that this will be a game changer. Once the project gets underway and we get all the data necessary, we will no longer have to rely on the slim chance of natural Pandora compatibility. You will no longer have to share the burden by yourselves."

She paused impressively.

"The time has come for every girl to share that responsibility!" she finished.

Everyone in the room applauded from her speech. However there were a couple of people who had a different reaction to this. Particularly your group and the Big Five.

"Something feels off about this," you said. "I don't know why, but something feels off."

"So you think so too eh kid? I don't blame you," agreed Roxanne. "Rumor has it that Doctor Gengo Aoi has been and still is opposed to this E-Pandora being pushed forward. Not to mention that they were already got it ready before they even got permission from the Chevalier.

Her lips then curled into a smile.

"Looks to me that someone's been doing quite a few human experiments."

"Is that you got to say?" said a voice.

All of you turned around and there standing there were three girls none of you have seen before. One was dark-skinned with long black hair, the second had short purple hair, and the last one had long silver hair with a red band on her forehead. The three scowled at Roxanne as if she had insulted them, but Roxanne wasn't fazed.

"Well then, I guess I would like to know who the hell you are," she said glaring at them back.

"E-Pandora," the silver haired girl replied.

You looked at the girls curiously upon hearing that word. "E-Pandora?"

"So... you're the result of what they got cooking down here," said Roxanne. "Pretty interesting."

The girl with silver hair's glare hardened and the two looked ready to start a fight. As much as you wanted to step in and break it up, you decided to stay quiet, but You couldn't help but stare at the girls. It was surprising to believe that they were the very E-Pandora that Scarlett Ohara was talking about. It made you interested to know if they were really the result of the project. Then the purple haired girl noticed that you were staring and gave you a dirty look. You looked away pretending not to notice not wanting to start a fight.

You, Creo, Satellizer, Kazuya, and Rana were walking through the hall finding your rooms.

"That Pandora, the one that Charles called the zombie," said Rana. "certainly is quite the straightforward person isn't she? I was afraid that her words with the E-Pandora would entice a fight, but luckily nothing happened."

"Rana. First of all her name is Roxanne," said Satellizer. "And secondly that doesn't guarantee that there will be a fight later on."

"Yeah. No kidding," said Kazuya. "So you make sure that you behave yourself alright?"

As you continued to walk you couldn't help but think about the E-Pandora and especially the look that girl gave to you before.

"She's right about one thing about the fighting, but why do I get the feeling that somehow someway I'm gonna get dragged in the crossfire?" you thought.

"(name)? Is something the matter?" asked Creo.

"No. It's nothing. I'm fine," you said. "Just thinking that's all."

Soon they came to a room each one with a gold label on the side that had names on the side. Rana came up to one that had her name on it.

"Say what?! Partners!? The two of you haven't even had a proper baptism!" cried Rana indignantly.

"It doesn't matter," said Satellizer flipping her hair smugly. "We are roommates now because the higher ups recognize us what you can't because we share a bond."

"Doubtful," said Kazuya pinching his nose. "Once the two of them go at it like this, there's no stopping them."

"That's enough both you," she said. "Rana you just need to accept that Satellizer and Kazuya will be sharing a room together. There's nothing you can do about it. Now go to your room and let this go."

"Surely you jest Ms.Creo! How can you tell me to let this go!?" complained Rana.

"Like this; Let. It. Go. All of this love triangle crap is getting on everybody's nerves and it needs to stop."

"But-"

"You can claim that Kazuya's yours all you want, but it's obvious that Satellizer and him are partners regardless of baptism and you need to grow up and accept it."

"But-"

Creo then gave Rana a dangerous look. A look what made her as well as you and Kazuya cringe in fear. Even Satellizer was sweating a little. Rana then hung her head in defeat.

"All right fine. I will return to my room," she said. "But I won't give up!"

And with that, Rana bolted out of the room and into her own room. Everyone in the room looked at Creo in surprise as to what she had just did.

"Creo... are you sure that wasn't a tad harsh?" asked Kazuya.

"It's fine," said Creo. "I think that she won't be bothering you for a while."

"Remind me not to get on your bad side," said Kazuya.

"Yup. That's my Creo," you said. "Cute as she is fearsome."

"In any case, thanks for getting her off my back," said Satellizer. "I swear I had nothing to do with it."

"I'm sure you didn't," said Creo. "Anyway, if Rana starts trouble again, feel free to call me. Come on (name). Let's go get settled in into our room."

"Yes?", she replied wondering what he wanted.

With the way Creo and (Name) act so intimately without any worry, the idea seems more natural now by comparison. "Do you want us? To do it here and now?"

"I wasn't planning on it."

Even though you have showed great patience with me, I can't feel safe about it since.", she cut herself off as if she starred into space for a split second. Kazuya nodded understanding her reason to wait, but his droll sign of disappointment reverted to joy as Satellizer gave Kazuya a big kiss on the cheek.

"Sorry. I didn't know how to end that conversation."

"Fine with me. Just, I feel happy we talked about it.", Kazuya said relived.

You undressed in front of her and got inside the bath. It took a second for you to adjust to the temperature but not too long. Soon as things were comfortable you rested yourself next to Creo with her nestling her head on your chest. Both of your hands interlocked with hers, she trailed them down over her stomach, letting you feel the soft breaths inhaling from the bliss she was in.

1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.title: Let it all go?

1113322222222222222222222212222222222111.content:
After a while, you and Creo got out of the tub and got into some clothes to sleep in and got ready for bed. Creo's sleeping clothes comprised of a tank tip and a pair of shorts while you wore a t-shirt and a pair of shorts. Creo has just finished getting ready and got into the bed while you were in the bathroom brushing your teeth. You had just finished brushing your teeth and were about to join Creo in the bed when you heard the doorbell ring.

"Now I wonder who that could be?" you wondered as you peeked out of the bathroom.

"I don't know," said Creo. "If it's Satellizer then that was faster than I expected. You want me to answer it?"

"No. I'll get it," you said as you went to the door. "Besides it's probably no big deal."

You walked to the door and then opened it. Your eyes then widened in surprise for the person standing in front of the door was someone who you least expected to show up on your doorstep. A certain mauve hair colored woman wearing a lab coat to be exact.

"Hey... you're-!"

"Sorry to bother you this time of the night, but may I speak with you a moment?"

You looked back at Creo who was starting to fall asleep and then you stepped out of the room shutting the door behind you.

"I take it you know who I am?" she asked.

"Of course I do," you replied. "You're Scarlet Ohara, the head of E-Pandora project. What I don't know is what's someone like you doing over here?"

"I came to see you of course," replied Ohara. "You're (name) from West Genetics right? I wanted to talk to you as soon as I had some free time."

"Talk to me? For what? You have some business with me?"

"You could say that. You see I need your help with something. It's something that only you can do for me," explained Ohara.

You raised a brow. "Something that only I can do? Like what exactly?" you asked with a hint of skepticism. "If this is your way of asking me out on a date or something, you should now that I'm already taken."

"I promise you it's nothing like that," said Ohara. "It has to do with the E-Pandora project. As you're well aware, the goal of this project is create Pandora at a faster pace without having to rely on natural compatibility. And so tomorrow morning, there will be some mock battles between the E-Pandora and the natural Pandora."

"And what's this have to do with me?"

"Forgive me if this sounds a bit outlandish," said Ohara. "But I want you to take part in one of the mock battles tomorrow."

You instinctively flinched.

"Excuse me?"

"Yes. I know it sounds crazy," said Ohara. "But I need you to participate in one of the mock battles that will be taking place. The purpose is to not only test the strength of the E-Pandora, but it's also for getting the necessary data needed for the project."

"And why do you need me to take part of this?" you asked your skepticism showing more in your voice. "Need I remind you that I'm a limiter not a Pandora."

Ohara turned around and walked to the window looking out into the endless night.

"That may so, but I've heard stories that tell me otherwise," she said. "Stories about you going toe to toe with Pandora and living to tell the tale. Not to mention you were in the recent Nova clash and you're well known for a certain incident that gave you the title The Imperfect Limiter.

Your eyes widened at that. You then for the first time, you gave Scarlet a hardened glare piercing right at her back.

"Listen lady. I don't care if you're the head of the project or anything like that, but you better watch yourself before you start pissing me off." you growled.

"Now, now. Take it easy," said Ohara not even turning around. "I have no intention of starting a fight with you. I'm sorry if I touched a sensitive subject. I only came here to ask you for help. I just want you to take part in a mock battle tomorrow that's it."

11432111.content:
You casually laid back on the beach as the surf rose again, coming all the way up to your ankles before it slowly seeped back into the ocean. You were quite enjoying this day, it had gone pretty well as your days went. You had been off from school on vacation, and spent pretty much all day relaxing and wishing that you didn't have to go right back to school tomorrow. Days like today, allowing yourself to casually lay in the warm beach sun with the surf at your feet as the sun slowly set into the distance, were not only nearly impossible to come by, but also your favorite moments in life. The only thing you wished you had more was someone to share them with.

"Ah... I wish this day would never end." You said, sighing as your head hit the beach. You'd have to bother cleaning the sand out of it later, but what did you care. Right now, you didn't think it would matter if the sand actually swallowed you up. On the bright side then, no more homework at least.

But even as you thought about how perfect the day was, something happened that had a certain potential to make it even better. Off in front of you, further into the water, you saw something. It was a black circle, seeming to radiate waves of blackness off of it. Whatever the hell it was, it looked evil, and yet... inviting? You didn't know how it could look inviting, but that was the only way you could think to describe it.

"What the hell..." You said to yourself, as you peered at the oddity. Not knowing entirely what you were doing, you slowly stood up, brushing sand off your back as you took a testing step into the water in front of you. You walked as though you were in a dream, not knowing entirely what you were doing. On one hand, you were going at an unknown object that had the potential to do just about anything to you. But... on the other hand, it wasn't like you had much to lose. You weren't particularly happy with your life as it was, and thinking about going back to school tomorrow was even more likely to make you leap headfirst into the circle.

It was just then you realized what you had done. You were knee-deep in water, staring at this black circle. You thought you could almost see something through the other side, but it was hazy and you couldn't make out anything important. You could see, though, that the circle was beginning to shrink. You had to decide, and fast, what the hell you were going to do. And to you, the choice was pretty clear. School, or unknown and potentially deadly fate? Definitely the potentially fatal. Better to die quickly than die slowly from boredom. Without knowing what you were getting yourself into, you put first an arm, and then seeing that it wasn't harmed, the rest of your body through the portal.

When you finally regained your senses, you found yourself in a room that looked to be made entirely of white. There was nothing in the room that wasn't white - in fact, there was even a plant, or plant sculpture, painted white in the corner of the room. As you slowly rubbed your head, you tried to figure out what had happened to you.

The last thing you remembered was seeing a circle of... dark energy at the beach. The only explanation for it was some kind of portal - what else could've appeared so suddenly and mysteriously at your innocent town? So, without really thinking anything through, you had then thrown yourself through the portal, and promptly passed out.

Which left you... where? Here? And where exactly was here? How the hell did you managed to find a portal to here, and why the hell did a place like here, with a portal that shouldn't exist leading here, exist here? And why couldn't you stop saying here?!

You were just calm enough to realize that you were having a mild panic attack, and sat down in the white couch in a corner of the room. Panting heavily, but trying to force yourself to slow down your breathing, you felt yourself sink into the rather comfortable cloth and padding. "Where... where am I..." You said to yourself again, this time out loud.

Just as your heart rate finally began to slow down, you realized that you could hear something. Voices. Or rather, just one voice. "...mission? I mean, that's four in the last three days. I thought getting assigned to this stupid castle meant that I wouldn't have to deal being sent off on missions every damn day. Talk about a waste of my time..."

You couldn't tell where they were, mostly because you were still too disoriented with the new surroundings to tell where the sound came from, but you could tell a few things. From the words, the person was likely alone and talking to herself, and from the sound of the voice it was a woman. Pretty young, from the sound of it. And also from the sound... headed your way!

"I mean, first they ship me away from home base just when those new guys were starting to get useful, and then they send me to this deserted, boring, useless... castle..."

As the voice came closer, the figure the voice belonged to finally came into view, and you had to say, it was quite a view. A woman with blonde hair, two strands spiked up over her head with the rest hanging down just above shoulder level. She had a great figure, too, but you didn't get to notice much more, as you were busy staring at her, while she stared at you. The awkward silence went on for a good six or seven seconds before she finally spoke up.

"Who are you, and what the hell are you doing in my room?" She said, staring at you with a blank expression on her face. Better than anger, at least.
114321111.title: On the other side...

choices: You come up with a plan.
1143211111.content:
"Uh..." You mumbled, unable to form any real words. Although, if you could've seen yourself, the blank look on your face pretty much said it all anyway.

"You know what, I really don't care what you're doing here. You don't belong here, and that's good enough for me." She said, shrugging as she pulled a knife out of her robe.

"Err... what are you going to do with that..." You stuttered, as you stumbled backwards and fell OVER the couch you had been sitting on, just as she began to laugh and twirl the knife on her hand.

"Well, why don't you pretend you're me and get creative?" She said, smirking quite a bit as she slowly moved closer to you.

"Because I don't enjoy picturing myself in more than one piece?" You said, flipping the couch back upright behind you and backing yourself up against the wall.

The woman just laughed at you. "You're lucky. You've got a sense of humor, and I actually have a mission I'm supposed to be leaving for right now. That Keyblade master's starting to get annoying, and now I have to give him a new set of cards? Please, like I don't have better things to do than that..." She said, then sighed and gestured, forming a black portal between the two of you like the one you had just arrived through.

"Now, don't go anywhere. If I find out you left while I was away, I just might have to get REALLY creative with the knives." She said, laughing one last time as she walked through the dark portal.

Meanwhile, you were too completely shocked to even begin comprehending what she had just said to you. As you thought about it, you couldn't believe you hadn't realized it earlier - you were in Kingdom Hearts! You didn't actually know how you had gotten there, but you knew without a doubt that the woman you just ran into was Larxene. And she was just as cold in here as she was in the games. This was unbelievable! You would get a chance to meet Sora, and Kairi, and Namine if you were lucky!

But... you were kind of trapped in a room with a homicidal maniac likely to be back in a few minutes. What the hell were you going to do?
1143211111.title: "Uh..."

choices: She tells you a different idea [Community branch-off point]
11432111111.content:
After several minutes of heavy thinking, all the while wondering if the next moment might be the one that Larxene showed up in and started showing you how creative she could be with knives.And that had been the primary basis of your plan, which was: to stay the hell there. Scared as you were of her imminent return, you were even more scared of what she might do to you if you disobeyed her and attempted to leave the room. And besides that, assuming that you were on the top floor of Castle Oblivion, Sora was only on the sixth floor... seventh? You couldn't remember nearly as much as you wanted to about Chain of Memories. Anyway, that meant there were about six levels between you and Sora - levels filled with Heartless, other Nobodies, and other horrors you didn't care to imagine. You might even run into the other members of the Organization before you could meet up with Sora and be saved.

So, with not much else to do, you lounged against the couch again and let yourself slowly slip into a half-conscious state. For some reason, you were unbelievably tired; maybe inter-dimensional travel was a lot more tiring than you thought. You almost couldn't stop yourself as you slowly drifted off through the folds of your mind into the unknown land of dreams.

------

You didn't know how long you slept, but you knew one thing, and that was the reason why you woke up. There was a stabbing pain in your back...

"STABBING?!" You half yelled, half mumbled as you jumped off of the couch, coming to the ground only a foot or two away, barely keeping yourself from smacking your face on the floor.

"Aww, and things were just getting fun."

Looking up, you saw Larxene holding a knife at the place where you had been just moments before. It didn't look bloody, but you still placed a hand on your back to check for any wounds that might have been inflicted, but your hand came back dry, and no huge stains of red either.

"What were you trying to do to me?!" You asked, somehow still surprised by the fact that she had chosen to poke you in the back with one of her knives rather than, oh say, wake you up?

"I was just gonna have a little fun. I wanted to see if I could draw blood before you woke up."

Your mouth dropped a little bit and you stared at her before you managed a response to that. "What in the hell is wrong with you?"

Not even offended by your question, she just shrugged and kicked back on the now empty couch. "I'm a nobody. You can't really expect me to feel any sympathy for you, especially when you invaded my room like this without an invitation."

She did have a point. After all, you were trespassing in her territory, and you didn't even have a really good excuse for being there. 'I saw a portal, so I went through.' probably wouldn't hold up in a legal court, much less to an evil supervillain.

"Well... maybe next time you could wake me up... without the sharp pointy objects?"

"But that takes all the fun out of it." Larxene said, and you could swear she almost had a small tone of pouting in her voice, like a little kid being told not to wander around in a toy store.

"Well, I suppose I could always turn you in to the bosses..." Larxene said, almost immediately over her little childish episode and obviously thinking to herself. As she did, thoughts ran through your head of all the things that the OTHER members of the organization had - and would - do, you were even more afraid of what might happen to you with them than you were of what Larxene herself might do to you.

"Uh... please don't."

"And why shouldn't I? For uncovering an intruder who might have valuable information, Xemnas might even give me a promotion if you know something."

"I don't know anything, you have to believe me. I don't even know how I got here."

As if the thought was just occurring to her, Larxene swiveled on her heel to look at you. "How exactly DID you come to arrive in this castle, anyway?"

You thought on your feet, but considering where she was from, this might actually be surprisingly easy to explain. "Well... I was standing on a beach out by my house, and all of a sudden this big black portal opened up in front of me."

"So... you just decided to enter the mysterious black portal that could've led to anywhere?"

"Well... yeah. It was a lot better than just sitting around being normal."

Larxene looked thoughtful at that, though exactly what she was thinking you couldn't guess at. "Well, I guess that sort of makes sense. Although, I have to give you credit kid, not a lot of people would have the guts to do something like that. The portal though... seems a bit weird for one to open up around you like that. I mean, normally that requires an organization member. So either you've got a bit of nobody in you, or someone else opened that portal for you."

You had to admit, it made sense.

"But, that still leaves the question of what to do with you... Wait! I think I have the PERFECT idea for you."

Whatever it was, you most certainly did NOT like the sound of it.
11432111111.title: You come up with a plan.

choices: Pick up after she tells you all the things you already know.
114321111111.content:
"Well, I do have some time to kill, and since I've just finished up my last mission for awhile, I could use someone to keep me company."

You were pretty shocked - you thought you were going to be in for something a lot worse than that. "Wait, there's an intruder in your castle, and you're talking about having time to spare?"

The blonde just waved her hand, dismissing your thoughts. "Relax. Things work differently in this castle than you think. Poor Sora down there will be trapped in his own memories right about now, wandering through the trappings of his mind. To him, it will probably only seem like a couple hours in each world, but to everyone else he might spend a day or two, maybe even more, in each world. It's one of the reasons we chose this castle, combining it with the cards allows us to draw him deeper in, floor by floor, giving us plenty of time to prepare. And because of the magic of the cards he won't rot or starve to death while he wanders aimlessly in his memories."

Impressive. Even if you were supposed to be rooting for Sora, you had to admit that the members of the Organization were very, very prepared. In fact, you realized that there were probably even more levels to their planning that you never got to see in the games. This was, without a doubt, one of the coolest - if scariest - moments of your life.

Larxene seemed to interpret your silence in a different way than being impressed, though. "Oh, right, I suppose if you're going to be staying here as my slave for a while then I should explain to you what's going on. But don't be surprised if you still don't understand anything - I can't give away the details of our little Organization here."

You nodded your head, realizing that it would be good for her to explain things to you like this willingly - that way, hopefully, she would never have to find out how you knew so much about her world. "Yeah, I think it would be nice to know more about this new world, and - WAIT, WHAT DID YOU JUST SAY?!"

"Well, I'm saying now that you need to keep your voice down. We've got thick walls here at Castle Oblivion, but if you keep yelling like that you're just asking for Axel or, god forbid, Marluxia, to drop by and find out about you."

In a quieter voice, you maintained your shock and outrage. "But you just said I would be your slave!"

"Well, yeah. What, did you think you would be my guest or something? If I'm gonna be taking care of your room and board, then you are going to be earning your keep."

"And what if I don't want to be your slave?"

Larxene purposefully twirled one of the knives she had in her right hand, probably the same one she had just stabbed you with while you slept. "Well, I suppose I could think up something a little more creative for you."

"...God damnit, fine, I'll be your slave."

"Good, I've got you for about two weeks then, at least until the keyblade master finishes sifting through his own memories. First things first though, you need to at least understand what I'm constantly going to be yelling at you for when it goes wrong..."

"Oh, lucky me." You said, sighing as you started to regret coming through that portal already.
114321111111.title: She tells you her idea.

choices: Uh oh, Uh oh, Uh oh.
1143211111111.content:
~~A day later~~

You were embarrassed beyond belief, you were trapped in a castle in another world filled with psychopaths incapable of emotion, and to be quite frank you were starting to feel a little homicidal yourself... too bad everyone was stronger than you. And to top it off, this was a little less than one day into what Larxene had said would be about a two week stay with her. And to make things even worse than THAT...

You were in a butler outfit.

Now, you had no idea where Larxene got the outfit - and you sure as hell weren't stupid enough to ask her where with the mood she had been in later that day - but it made things about three times as humiliating as they should have been. Of course, that was undoubtedly the entire reason she made you wear it, but that was another story. This was, to put it mildly, utter bullshit. But, again, you weren't quite stupid enough to tell HER that. The thought of spitting in one of the drinks she made you bring to her did occur to you, though.

But then, something unexpected happened.

"You're going where?"

"Ugh. It's like I was yelling about before. Keep my rants straight or I'll have to hurt you! Now, I have to go on a mission to another world. I still can't believe they're gonna make me babysit the Keyblade Master and still go on missions... anyway. While I'm gone you are not to enter my room, leave the suite, and definitely not touch any of my knives, as usual, but I also don't want you trying to contact any of the other Organization members. No funny ideas about escaping, alright?"

You nodded. No problem there; at least Larxene took less joy out of killing than she did just hurting. You doubted the other members of the Organization would've left you alive this long.

"Good. I should be back in a few hours. Until then you can steal anything from the refrigerator or just sleep on the couch again."

With that she turned around and walked into a newly formed dark portal, which promptly sealed itself behind her. You sighed with relief as you collapsed onto the couch. You weren't particularly tired, but your nerves had been on edge for the last couple of hours - ever since she decided to play a game of dodgeball with knives after you failed to bring her something to drink in under ten seconds. You had some hairs on top of your head that would never be quite the same again.

But despite all that, you had an idea, and a crazy one at that. Even though you had obeyed her without question until now, perhaps it was time to change that... for some reason, Larxene didn't want you in her room. The whole place looked undecorated and inhospitable, so you had no ideas what she wouldn't want you to see. Although, now that you thought about it, back in 358/2 Days, Roxas was told to keep a diary...

That settled it. You were going into Larxene's room, and you were going to spy on her diary. Who knew, maybe you could even find out what she had planned for you.
1143211111111.title: Pick up after she tells you all the things you ...

11432111111111.content:
You touched the handle of the door with just the faintest hint of force, almost like you thought the handle itself was booby-trapped. In this house, why the hell wouldn't it be? She seemed to overreact to almost anything and everything that went wrong. Either way, you had made up your mind, and there was no going back now anyway. With conviction and fear both fighting for dominance, you pushed down on the handle and opened the door before you could have a change of heart.

Looking around, you saw that the room was much like you had pictured it. There was a white bed in one corner, with a plain white dresser next to it, and a white shelf on the other side of the room. Jeez, the Organization really needed to hire a decorator to put some color into their rooms. But what was more important was that you saw a notebook sitting on her headboard, and you had few doubts - that had to be her diary.

With a mischievous smile on your face, you tiptoed into the room and grabbed the book as quickly as you could. Flipping through the pages, you didn't even read it much, instead looking at the dates until you found the latest entry, and to your surprise it had been just from the night before - the night after you arrived. That HAD to have something interesting in it. You pressed on and read as fast as your eyes could go.

"Today was boring, as usual. Xemnas and Marluxia are being so mean. How am I supposed to stay in my room and be lazy if I have to take care of their little puppet Keyblade Master and do missions for the Organization at the same time? Oh well. On the bright side, some stupid kid found his way into my room today through a portal. I dunno how one got there, but at least I have something to keep me entertained. It's been a little-"

You noticed something here - the word lonely had been written, but then it had two lines through it and underneath it the replacement word "boring" had been put in. You didn't think too much, just kept reading.

"-boring around here lately. Maybe I can get this kid to give me some fun times while I'm waiting to RTMC (Return To Main Castle, I made that up!). If he doesn't try anything stupid, I might even send him home after we're done here."

Well, that was just fantastic. Especially since you were doing something stupid right then. Carefully, you put the diary back in as close to a normal position as you could and retraced your steps out of the room. You immediately ran back to the kitchen, grabbed the coldest drink you could find, and then collapsed onto the couch. You were glad that she might let you go, scared that she might discover what you did, and above the other two emotions you were very confused. Why would Larxene have written lonely, and then crossed it out? Nobodies didn't have emotions - that was something they had emphasized throughout the games. But, some of them did seem to show emotion on occasion; was it possible Larxene actually got lonely when she wasn't around the whole Organization?

Sipping on the soda, you just shook your head absently. There was very little for you to do now. It wasn't like Larxene had a Playstation for you to use; nothing to do now but rest your tensed nerves and sore muscles for a bit. You tried your best to sleep with one eye open, though. No telling what sharp instrument might be poking into your spine the next time you woke up.
11432111111111.title: Uh oh, Uh oh, Uh oh.

114321111111111.content:
You did end up falling asleep rather quickly, despite your nervousness at the situation, but when you awoke it was not because of a stabbing pain in your back. You didn't know how long it had been, but you actually got a decent sleep in - you woke up on your own, in other words.

Looking around, you were mildly disappointed to see that yet again you had woken up in the castle. Some part of you was still hoping that all of this was some terrible nightmare that you might wake up from at any moment, but with every day your hopes grew fainter, and were now almost gone.

Before you could sink totally into depression you heard a sudden "fwoom" sound and a black portal appeared in front of you, and mere seconds later Larxene popped in as well.

"Ugh, what a pain..." She said, brushing her back behind her head and into position again, then looking at the couch. She had an evil look, but that faded as soon as she saw you.

"Oh, you're awake..." Was she... disappointed?!

"Yeah, I am."

"Well, I'm taking over the couch, so move it."

You brushed some sleep out of your eyes and climbed off of the cushy seats as Larxene plopped down on it. You had an idea about that, though, especially with her in such a bad mood. Standing around and doing what she told you didn't seem to stop the pain, so why not take the initiative? Hell, if you did a really good job then she might let you go. You had no reason to disbelieve her diary, after all - why would she lie in something that nobody else was supposed to read?

So, walking around behind the couch, you reached down and started massaging Larxene's shoulders gently. She jerked at your first touch, but as soon as you started massaging she relaxed slightly, not preparing to punch you in the face like she probably had been before. She still felt tense though, and even though some of it was probably from her mission you could tell this was something she hadn't been expecting. She had been so surprised that it took her almost a minute to come up with a witty comment on it.

"Sucking up to me, eh? I don't know whether you're trying to hit on me or just trying not to get stabbed again, but you're not completely incompetent at this. Tell you what, you just keep doing that and we'll see about the not-stabbing part."

'Yeah, that sounds great.' You thought, but kept silent as you continued to massage her shoulder muscles. She eventually relaxed completely and - to a certain extent - even let her guard down. You wondered how someone like her could ever let her guard down with a stranger nearby, but when you looked closer you realized why. She had actually fallen asleep while you were doing your little massage.

Well, you couldn't blame her. Even though you had no sense of time in this place, since there were no windows or clocks to judge time by, she had just gotten back from a mission and was probably exhausted. The important thing was that you had managed to buy yourself at least a few hours of time without the imminent danger of having a knife in some part of you.

You began to walk to the room on the other side of the house to not wake her up, but as you did so you heard her moan and sigh, and the sound of her falling over. "Well, that did it." You said, sighing as you turned around. But to your surprise, she hadn't woken up, and instead was laying across the couch as you had been only minutes before. She was also crossing her arms over her chest.

Looking at her closely, you even saw that she was shivering slightly. She had probably been shipped out to somewhere cold, and it would take her awhile to warm back up. Nothing to do with you, but somehow you couldn't leave in good conscience. Sighing, you walked over to her closet and opened it. Extra pairs of your butler outfit were there, and then above them were blankets. You weren't supposed to touch anything but your outfits, but somehow you thought she would make an exception this time.

You grabbed one of the blankets and flapped it out in the air, then went back into the living room. Larxene was still sleeping on the couch, and shivering every so slightly. Now that she had fallen asleep she couldn't hide her uncomfortable temperature. You gently laid the blanket over her, and almost immediately she grabbed onto it in her sleep, wrapping it tightly over her body and curling up into a small ball on the couch.

You smiled in spite of yourself. When she was asleep she could almost pass for a non-homicidal human being. Now that she was better taken care of, you could go into the other room without feeling so guilty.

And once you were in the other room, you could go without feeling so terrified. ...Even asleep, you had to admit she still scared the crap out of you.
114321111111111.title: Larxene arrives home.

1143211111111111.content:
While you sat in the other room without much to do, you found yourself thinking long and hard about your situation. Larxene was certainly proving to be a bit deeper than the psycho you had originally thought she was; she put on the facade of pretending that she wasn't even cold when she was obviously half-frozen, and she seemed genuinely thankful - in her own way - for your little massage treatment. But she was still pretty violent, and those knives of hers...

Speaking of which, as you rested your hand on a desk next to the chair you were in you felt something cold. Looking over, you saw that Larxene had left one of her knives on the table. Picking it up, you absentmindedly twirled it in your hands. It was surprisingly light, and a test on your finger showed it to be unbelievably sharp as well. Definitely something to be afraid of in the hands of an expert, which she definitely was. With nothing else to really do around here besides eat and sleep you found yourself quickly engrossed with the blade, eventually flipping it between your fingers like a pro. You must have taken a while to master it, though, because when you next looked up from the blade you saw Larxene standing at the door, looking strangely at you and the knife. She looked surprised, but then she noticed you staring at her and her look turned to anger immediately.

"Just EXACTLY what did I say to you about touching my things, again?"

"Sorry, I was... I just..."

She reached over and slapped you on the side of the head, and her strength was pretty impressive. But not her typical style; last time you messed up, she'd just used you as a human target. This was much kinder.

"You were just what? Not thinking, obviously. Give me that!" She said as she grabbed the knife from you again, then slapped you upside the head again.

"Wait, what was that for?"

"That one was for messing with my laundry." With that, Larxene promptly walked out of the room, turning her back and heading into her bedroom; probably to get some real sleep instead of that uncomfortable couch. To your great surprise, however, there was no shriek of fury and indignation, which probably meant you had repositioned the diary well enough she didn't see a difference. You breathed a sigh of relief, and then headed back to the main room. You had just slept not that long ago, but you might as well entertain yourself until she woke up. Then it was back to your life of servitude.
1143211111111111.title: Twiddle your thumbs for awhile.

11432111111111111.content:
About five hours later by your sense of time – which was probably way off, so what did it matter anyway – Larxene awoke. And she was in one hell of a mood today.

“I can’t BELIEVE this! Double mission duty, after yesterday’s mission?! I thought they were going to let me have a break for awhile!”

Larxene was taking her frustration out on the couch, and you were glad to let her do so. At least it wasn’t you. And, naturally, as soon as you thought that, she turned to you with an evil grin in her eyes.

“Hey, c’mere!”

You had little time, but managed to duck as a knife flew over your head and bounced off the wall behind you. You then hid around a corner as two more went right through the doorway.

“Hey, it’s no fun if you just hide!” She yelled back, and for a second you heard footsteps leading towards you, but then she stopped.

“Oh well. I have to get going, anyway.” Talking more to herself than you, she said that and then quickly turned around and formed a dark portal. You saw all this because you had peeked back around once the last two flew past you had cautiously peeked back around the corner.

With her gone, and you still wide awake after your last sleep, you were yet again bored out of your mind. You sighed and walked to the kitchen, grabbing a soda and nursing it while you sat on the couch. You had to give one thing to the little episodes of knife dodging and servitude – at least they kept you entertained for a bit. When Larxene was gone, there was nothing to do but eat and sleep. Wait, hadn’t you already thought of that a long time ago? Now your thoughts were even becoming repetitive.

“That’s all I do around here… eat, sleep, serve… read diary…”

Hmm, now there was an interesting possibility. Although you had seen that she might let you go if you were good, and you didn’t want to screw that up by getting caught with the diary, there was a lot to gain and only so much to lose. Hell, even if she did let you go she probably couldn’t take you back to your world. And if you were stuck here you were probably as good as dead anyway. Okay, maybe not, but you needed to give yourself a pep talk. Whether it was for survival or not, peeking at her diary was just too fun for you to NOT do. Maybe it was because you never had a sister to spy on and use against her later.

You quickly walked back towards her room, and then quickly opened and shut the door behind you. Fun or not, no sense taking chances with unnecessary delays. With that done, you turned and walked over to her bed, mentally memorizing the diary’s new position on the headboard so that you could set it back perfectly. Then you picked it up quickly and opened to the latest entry.

“Had this kid for about six days now. The Keyblade master’s getting close, but I still haven’t decided whether to let him live or not. He really puzzled me today. First, when I got back from my mission today he actually gave me a massage – without me even asking! I had been thinking about ordering him to give me a foot massage, but the snow must have frozen my brain. He got me while I wasn’t thinking. Won’t happen again.

“And when I fell asleep – damn that massage was pretty good! – I guess the kid went into my closet and got a blanket. I was really cold after my mission. Damn Marluxia… but I guess that’s beside the point. I don’t know why he got in there, I mean he knew I was going to punish him. But I was so shocked I DIDN’T! And when I went into the room to do something to him, I saw him playing with a knife I must have left out. He looked pretty good flipping it too. But why wasn’t he doing anything with it? Maybe he just found it, but I don’t know. He’s my prisoner here, and I’m nothing more than a nobody. He shouldn’t be doing weird stuff like this. Ugh, I’ll write later.”

Use it? Use the knife? What did she mean by that? Maybe you just found it… wait, did she… did she think you would have stabbed her in her sleep!? You put the diary back, careful not to so much as ruffle a page wrong. Wait… this did sort of make sense. You numbly walked back through the house until you sat down on the couch. She was a nobody, after all, and the same emotionless behavior that made her a killer also meant she probably didn’t understand normal human emotion. She looked at your actions practically – you should have killed her and then gotten the hell out of there. But you hadn’t and that puzzled her. Admittedly, you were a little shocked at yourself for not having thought about that plan, but you wouldn’t have gone through with it anyway.

You kicked your legs over the end of the couch and laid back. Well, if that was the case, the reason she was so surprised when you acted nice towards her was probably because she would expect a knife in the back sooner than she would expect a friendly gesture.

Man, all this thinking was making your head hurt. You suddenly realized you were also pretty tired. Maybe you just… needed a little time… to sleep on it.
11432111111111111.title: The next day (You think)

114321111111111111.content:
Your little nap hadn’t been any long time since the last time you slept, so you awoke probably only three or four hours later. Either way, as soon as you awoke you were on guard. Usually when it felt like three or four hours Larxene was about to arrive home – or, more likely, already home. And that meant that it was time for you to be quick on your feet.

But when you looked around, Larxene was nowhere to be found. Confused, you lay there on your elbow for a minute as you tried to think of where she might be. But, then you remembered – she had double mission duty. Odds were, she wouldn’t even be back for at least three or four more –

At that moment, a dark portal opened and Larxene stepped out from inside. “I’m back.”

- hours. Well, hell.

"Oh, hey Larxene. Sorry, didn't expect you home so early. I'll get to dinner right away."

"Don't bother. I already got some from the world I got assigned to today."

That was quite a surprise. "You had time to eat dinner? Usually you barely get home from one mission in this time, and you're telling me you did two AND dinner?"

Uh oh. You must have said SOMETHING wrong, because the look Larxene shot you was one of shock, and perhaps a hint of anger. But then she composed herself, and scoffed off your question with an answer that was so typical of her.

"Well, since they decided that I should have to play 'card keeper' for the little brat when he needs it, and do missions - no, DOUBLE missions - at the same time, I decided I wasn't going to do all I could today. All I had to do was scout and then find some lame treasure chests to see if they had items anyway. I just decided to only find out what I had to for the scouting and not bother finding the rest of the chests after I got what I went for."

Typical of her. She was strong, but also vindictive and short-tempered. She was probably worse about doing missions she hated than Demyx.

"Anyway, you can fix yourself something for supper. For now, I'm just glad to have that scum Marluxia-"

"Yeah, what about-"

"Quiet!" Larxene yelled as she grabbed you, suddenly dragging you back along the hallway. When she got to the closet, she opened it and threw you into the small walk-in section, slamming the door hard enough to knock blankets off of the top shelves and onto your head. You wondered what this was all about, but then you got your answer as the familiar sound of a dark portal came through.

"Hello, Larxene. Home so soon?"

"Certainly no thanks to you." Larxene said, and you could almost feel her cross her arms.

"Well, I'm disappointed in you. Usually, you're so good about doing missions to their full extent. Today you barely did what we asked of you Something important to rush back here for?"

You heard a touch of amusement in her voice as she replied, "Please. Have you seen the rooms you provided for us? There's nothing of any worth in these rooms, and certainly nothing worth returning to. The least you could do is provide us with a television or something entertaining."

You knew she would be biting back a giggle at her poking fun at you. You just sighed mentally at her comments of you not being of any worth, and then felt the hairs on the back of your neck prickle at Marluxia's next response.

"Well, I think you might have taken something from those treasure chests and decided to hide it. We can't have you taking an unfair cut of the rewards, can we? I think you should let me see inside that closet."

That wasn't good. Not at all.

"I've already agreed to assist you in our plan to take over the Organization. Why the hell would I hide something from you?"

You agreed with her. Something was suspicious - you felt that this was nothing more than a plot for him to discover you. And it looked like he was going to succeed. Unless... those towels around your shoulders gave you an idea.

"I'm not certain, but something about you has changed, Larxene. You seem a bit... off. I can't explain it. You've been acting more like that young boy Roxas than your usual self. I can't put anything past you until I figure out why you're so different."

"Well... fine. If you really have to invade a woman's privacy, go ahead."

You tucked yourself into as tight a corner as you could and listened as the door opened. For several seconds, nothing happened. But you could tell Marluxia was looking into the closet quite intently. Of course, you couldn't see him directly - you had climbed to the top of the closet and tucked yourself behind the towels. And unless he wanted a knife in the back, there was no way Marluxia would disturb Larxene's things.

"Hm... fine. No treasure in here, I suppose. Good, glad to see you're not so changed that you would betray me. Very good, I suppose I'll leave you alone now then."

The sound of a dark portal opening followed almost immediately.

"Yeah, nice to see you too. Ass."

That said, you tried to climb back down from the top of the closet. Unfortunately, you overestimated how much space there was between you and the ceiling, and when you tried to crawl over you got stuck, and when you wiggled free you rolled right off the top, falling all the way to the floor. You hit with a loud bang, landing right on your shoulder, and seriously hurting yourself.

"Ouch..."

Larxene bent down to see you, but your vision was blurred for a moment and you couldn't catch what she was doing until you felt her hands clutching your shoulder. You groaned in pain, but did nothing else.

"Oh, shut up you baby. It's not even broken. You would've been in much worse shape if Marluxia had caught you. Now, go ahead and fix me supper."

"I thought you weren't hungry?"

"Stress makes me hungry. NOW GO!"

"Yes ma'am!" You said, crawling up against the pain of your shoulder and running off to the kitchen. On cue, a knife flew behind you and almost took off your ear. Ah... the return to things being normal.

11513211121.content:
You are a regular earthbender who has been living in Republic City since you were five. You are a worker for the Pro-Bending arena, where your friends, Mako and Bolin, are part of a team known as the Fire Ferrets. You just finished shift and now you are just wondering around the city. Everything looks great when you accidentally bumped into someone.

"Oh man, I'm so sorry. I wasn't paying attention." You apologized.

"That's fine." A female voice said.

You look and what you see made your heart beat so fast. You see a gorgeous dark skin girl who is wearing what it looks like she's from the Water Tribe. You blushed madly to see someone so beautiful. You took your hand out to help her up.

"Thanks uh." She said.

"I-I-I'm, uh, (Name)." You introduced.

"Nice to meet you. I'm Korra." She introduced.

"Wait a minute, that name rings a bell." You said.

You think real hard until it finally dogs on you.

"Your Korra? As in Avatar Korra?" You wondered in surprise.

"That's me." Korra said.

"Wow! This is a surprise. I didn't expect you to be here." You said happily.

"I'll say. You live here?" Korra asked.

"Yep. So, what brings you here?" You wondered.

"I'm here to start on my Airbending training. What are you doing?" Korra asked.

"I just finished shift. I work at the Pro-Bending arena." You said.

"Really? That's awesome!" Korra said excitedly.

"Yeah. So, I'm gonna head back home with my friends. I guess I'll see you sometime?" You wondered.

"Of course. I'd love to hang out with you." Korra said.

"Cool. I'll see you soon." You said.

"Ok. Bye (Name)." Korra said.

Korra walked off and you watch her leave. Seeing her made your heart about to explode. This kind of feeling your having means only one thing.

"I think I'm in love." You thought.
11513211121.title: Yes

115132111211.content:
You walked back to the hose and sit on the couch. You can't seem to get Korra out of your head. Every time she comes to your mind, it just gives a warm feeling in your heart. You look to see Mako coming through the door, meaning that practice was over.

"Hey Mako." You said.

"Hey (Name). What's up?" Mako asked.

"Nothing much. How's practice?" You asked.

"Oh the usual. Bolin kicking my butt about practice, again." Mako said sourly.

"Yep that usual. Never gets old." You said with a smile.

"Ha ha." Mako said sarcasticlly.

Mako then noticed the positive look on your face.

"What got you in a good mood?" Mako wondered.

"You're not gonna believe this, but I just met the Avatar." You said.

"You've met Korra?" Mako asked.

"You know her?" You wondered.

"Yeah she's gonna be part of our team now. Let me tell you, she's got skills, Avatar or not." Mako said.

"I'll bet on that." You said.

Mako also noticed the small blush on your face. Seeing that mean only one thing.

"So, are you gonna ask her out on a date?" Mako teased.

You look at him in surprise at what Mako just said. You try to think of some sort of lie to hide you feelings about Korra.

"What?! No of course I'm not." You lied.

"You're a bad lair (Name). It's written all over your face. You in love with her." Mako said.

"Um, well I-." You studdered before Mako stopped you.

"Relax, I understand. And quite honestly, you should do it." Mako said.

"Really?" You asked.

"Yeah, you deserve some happiness. And you two seem to make a perfect couple." Mako said.

"How would you know?" You wondered.

"You'll see for yourself. Well, I'm gonna go and relax for a while." Mako said.

"Ok. Later." You said.

Mako then left the apartment, leaving you alone. You look out the window, enjoying the bright sunset. You think about Mako's advice about asking Korra on a date. Maybe it won't hurt to try. You went to bed, thinking about how to ask her out. You finally thought of an idea and drifted to sleep.
115132111211.title: Back to your house

1151321112111.content:
You wake up to start a new day. Today's your day off from work, so you decide to practice your earthbending. You want to try off metalbending, but it's very difficul, even for you. You try to bend a small metal nail. You've almost got it, but it doesn't go well in the end. You have another image of Korra flashed in your mind. You sigh as you may have second thoughts about asking her out. That's when Mako comes back.

"Hey (Name)!" Mako said.

"Hey Mako! How's work?" You asked.

"They made some decent money. So, it's okay." Mako said.

"That's good." You said.

"Say, have you seen Bolin? I've got his favorite dumplings." Mako wondered.

"No. I haven't seen him all day." You said.

"That can't be good. I'll go look for him." Mako said.

"I'll help. After all, if he's in trouble, you two might need some back up." You said.

"Ok. I'll look around the city and ask if they seen him." Mako suggested.

"I'll ask Korra if she seen him earlier." You suggested.

Mako nodded and you and him split up to find clues about Bolin's disappearance.
