1151321222111221.content:
You are a citizen of Republic city and a pro-bender. You are a Fire-Ferret and now replacing Mako as the new fire bender of the team. The Avatar had also left the team to continue her Air-bending training so you also had a new team player replacing the element for water. Luckily the Ferret's earth bender Bolin was still around and was the team leader. You all barley survived the last match and hoped that this one would be different.

"Now we all know that last match was garbage, terrible, even Paabu could have done better. But that's in the past, when you back a Fire Ferret in the corner he comes out fighting! So lets get out there and bend like there's now tomorrow, are you with me?!", Bolin spoke motivating you.

"FIRE! I'll fry those guys to a cinder! You won't worry about me boss!", you screamed.

"Now that is the kind of attitude we need. Let's go!"

A few minutes later....

"It's a knockout! The Rhino Lions will go down with the fastest knockout in Pro-bending history!", yelled the announcer.

You and Bolin swam out of the drink feeling destroyed. "Sorry boss.", you apologized.

"Don't mention it, sigh...where is Mako when I need him? No offense."

"None taken."

Later again...

You packed up your gear and was on your way home when you bumped back into Bolin. "Oh hey (Name). Look sorry for costing you a whole season of pro-bending."

"Don't mention it. Though how could anyone replace the Avatar or your brother in Pro-bending? Which...you wouldn't happen to have a way to introduce me to her?", you asked slyly.

"Wellllll maybe I could."

"Really?!"

"Yeah! I got a call from my bro, who you can also meet and he just said Korra is inviting us to her Water Tribe's Glacier Spirits festival. I could maybe bring a friend along and humbly introduce you."

"Boss as of this moment I am with 100% in life!"

"Thanks, buuut do you mean ALL the time cuz I don't want it to be weird-"

"I didn't mean I stick to you like glue I just meant that in emotional support."

You packed your things and all the stuff you wanted the Avatar to sign. You were geeking out in anticipation.
1151321222111221.title: Story #1 (Fire)

11513212221112211.content:
You went to the Republic City harbor where a ship was soon to be departing for the South pole. You had everything and hoped you weren't late, luckily you were right on time. Bolin was already on deck waiting for you to be sure you made it, "Hey there you are. So uh, ready to meet the Avatar, I mean we are like best friends so anything you want her sign, do, I can hook you up."

"Bolin I have no idea how to even come close to thanking you."

"No need to thank me. Just maybe hook me up with something when we get back. Cuz I don't have a job except you know."

"Happy to do that! Problem is I don't have a job or place to get you work.", you replied.

"Tell me how have you been making a living?", Bolin asked.

"I just have my old man who pays the bills and keeps a roof over our heads.", you explained.

"Gee is it that bad?"

"No, were not in a poor house and he barley makes ends meet. We have an apartment and a nice one to boot, thing is he works he bum to give both of us a decent life. He just works an awful load to do that so I joined the Ferrets to earn the prize money and help him. But now were back to square one."

"Hmm, your lucky.", Bolin replied with a downer expression.

"Hmm how so?", you inquired.

"Gah never mind I don't wanna be depressed on the way there. Now c'mon and I'll introduce you to Korra."

After that chat the ship left and made it's way to the South, outside the ship you and Bolin noticed a huge polar bear dog by the ship where you saw non other than Mako and Avatar Korra lying beside it. "(Name) I present to you in person Avatar Korra, Korra (Name).", Bolin introduced.

You were ecstatic and smiled your largest grin you could possibly make. "HI I AM (NAME)!"

"Bolin did you bring a fanboy with us to Korra's Water Tribe festival?", Mako asked annoyed.

"No! I brought your replacement on the team who happens to be a fanboy with us to Korra's Water Tribe festival. Difference being, replacement on the team, Mako."

"Ugh, I told you I have a job now. I'm sorry I couldn't stay."

"EEEEEEEEE! Mako it is a honor to meet Bolin's brother. I worked very hard to try and fill in the gap you left behind."

"Uhhh thanks?", he seemed a bit awkward but tried to act nice around you.

"Also Avatar Korra", you kneeled down in respect, "In your previous life Avatar Aang saved my grandfather's life during the 100 year war. You saved his life during an assassination attempt on Fire Lord Zuko. My family wouldn't be here today if not for you.", you said.

Korra felt embarrassed since she didn't feel like she deserved your praise, "Thank you but Aang saved your grandfather's life. Not me."

"I know but your still the Avatar and I appreciate you for what you did for my family. Different life, same immortal spirit."

Korra bowed down in response, "I appreciate your kind words and appreciation.", she said.

"Bolin thank you so much for this, I am glad to meet you.", you left with Bolin to your cabin and waited to arrive in the South Pole.
11513212221112211.title: A Thank You to a different life

115132122211122111.content:
It took a couple days but you finally made it to the south pole. You got your stuff and exited your ship alongside Bolin, you noticed a crowd of people by the deck as you made it to the dock. "All the people here Korra's welcome wagon?"

"Wow I wasn't expecting this many people to come and greet us.", Bolin replied.

"They didn't come here for us, they came for him.", Korra pointed out the much bigger ship docking onto the harbor.

Soon as the passengers left the ship you saw three people, a middle aged man and two teens who were identical twins. "Whoa, who are the lovely ladies?", Bolin asked noticing the twins as well.

"That's Eska and Desna, the cheif's son children. Desna is a guy.", Korra exclaimed.

"Ohhhf course I knew that. Ehhhand which one is Desna?", Bolin responded.

"One with the eye shadow.", you pointed out.

"How'd you guess?", Bolin asked.

"What guy puts on eye makeup? I'm right am I?"

"Yes (Name).", Korra answered.

You thought that Eska looked pretty nice, if a bit strange but you were certainly interested in her.

"I don't want to be here."

"Father requires us by his side sister."

"The south bores me. I find it to be far inferior to our home in the north."

You went with Korra to meet the chief of the Water Tribe, chief Unalaq. It seemed from the looks of things Korra's family was a bit tense with him. You weren't wanting to pry however the twins were facing right at you, or through you. "Uh hi.", you said kindly to them.

"Hissss", Eska snarled.

You were taken aback by her hissing and froze for a second. "I'm....(Name)....and I'm here with Korra's friend."

"Why is this boy being such a bother to me Desna? He completely uninterests me."

"I believe he is trying to seek companionship with us."

"Yes.", you confirmed.

"Quiet. We shall seek you again after me and my brother have had proper sustenance.", Eska replied to you.

You still stood still in confusion, "Ok? What the hell was that?", you thought.
115132122211122111.title: First impression

1151321222111221111.content:
The glacier spirits festival was a very spry and lively celebration, it was one giant carnival with everyone having a fun time with the Southern tribe enjoying themselves. The lights across the festival lit the starry night with laughter breaking the silence in the cold freezing air. You didn't attend the main feast since fancy dinner parties weren't where you felt you fit in, so you settled in by your tent until the festival began and met up with Bolin and his brother Mako.

"This is amazing! I would totally visit the coldest place on earth for this again, I've never been to a festival before!", you commented.

"Aaaand I've been scoping out the scenery. If you catch my drift, wink, wink.", Bolin smirked.

"Bolin remember the last water tribe girl you tried to date?"

"Oh come on Mako that was one time and I am telling you this will be different."

"Who was the last water tribe girl you tried hooking with?"

"I think it's better you NOT know and save everyone the awkwardness.", Mako replied.

"I'm with my bro on this one so yeah, keeping my relationship with Korra on the down looowww."

"You dated Korra?!"

"Whoops! I slipped that out."

"And she's with Mako? How'd that happen?"

"Bolin do not tell-"

"Ahaha it's ok Mako not another word. I'm as quiet as mouse-rat."

While you were left curious as to the details you noticed the chief's children walking around. "Hey Bolin, I'll be back. I'll find you later." You wanted to avoid them knowing they seemed to be a little off. Remembering what they said sounded like they would hunt you down. You quietly walk through the crowds of people and waited for a turn to ride the Ferris-wheel hoping it would elude you from them. You had to wait for only one more person but suddenly you noticed someone getting through all the people in line behind you.

Turns out it was the twins getting special privilege to cut through any line being royals of the chief of the water tribe. "We will take the next one with this one.", said Eska to the one overseeing the ride. You wanted to leave but knew now it was pointless to try and escape from them now. Soon as the next box car stopped and let others out you went in with the twins. You sat across from both while mildly strapped in by your legs on a metal bar. Ounce the wheel rotated they final broke the silence and began to talk to you.

"What was it you were trying to accomplish earlier today?", Desna inquired.

"I just said hi. You're Korra's cousins I heard and I though it would be polite to introduce myself.", you answered nervously.

"No one ever introduces themselves to us unless they are bowing. I didn't see the point with you seeking our attention for now reason.", Eska replied.

"I was just being nice, I wasn't trying to offend you."

"It seems he had no ulterior motive. Let's get off sister."

"Not yet, this one's answers are blunt, he is uncultured, and I find his fear of his to be funny. You amuse me, I will make you mine."

What? She wanted you to be hers? Did she mean that as a romantic gesture? "Uhhhhh you mean as a boyfriend or a slave?", you asked stupidly. The ride had finally ended and Eska took you by your coat collar and dragged you along the festival making you try and win her prizes for her.
1151321222111221111.title: Wheel of fortune

11513212221112211111.content:
For the next couple hours you spent the reminder of your time at the festival with Eska and Desna. She ordered you around like she was your boss, much to both your fear and disdain. While winning most of the games you were forced to enter was fun, Eska swiped every prize away ounce you had earned them. "You are quite skilled to have won me so many. But they were just practice."

Now you were terrified, what did she have in mind that was a big test? Darts, water guns, throwing the ring on bottles? She pointed to the worst one of all history. The claw. The most insidious contraption to have ever been conceived by human thought. People already were trying left and right wasting their money to win a single prize, but it always never stuck or even if it did it fell too soon. "That one?", you asked her. She nodded. "THAT ONE?!", she nodded again. "THAT one right over there, is what you want me to try and win you a prize in?!"

"Not try. You WILL.", she replied.

"Sister even I find it to be far fetched, I find this to be far too humiliating for an uncultured rat like him to best that horrid contraption.", Desna said both as a reply to make her stop while also insulting you.

"NO. You will win something and you will succeed. Don't fail me boyfriend."

She waterbent the other people out of the way to make sure you could have the next go at it. You were scared and deep down you were almost begging whatever powers that be to make sure you win the claw. But realistically winning anything on the first go is a million to one. Eska and Desna watched from behind watching you. You started it up, let it rest in center and looked for the easiest prize to grab.

One was sticking out that looked like you could scoop it up from the body, it was a plush of an air bison, it's big stuffed animal body looked like if you grabbed it firmly enough it would stay inside the claw until it released. You aimed it as best as you could, the claw was right above it, you steadied it a bit to make sure it was dead center, then you lowered it. From there it was all luckbased, you sweated from the sheer fear of what Eska would do if you failed. Another try? Was she expecting it? Was she expecting you to do it in one shot? Time froze as the claw fully gripped the bison. It looked good, the claw grabbed most of the body but there was too much space around it to feel comfortable. It didn't help as soon as it raised up all the way it shook free the perfectly placed grip on the bison. You saw it begin to fall off, only mere inches from the chute, falling off, wait, wait waiiiiiitt! It dropped before the claw relased, but it landed within the edge of the chute and leaned all the way into it!

"YYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYEEEEEEEEEESSSSSSSSSSSSS", you yelled. Everyone who played was amazed, Desna raised his brows in surprise, Eska was the only one to remain stoic and without another thought she went to swipe the stuffed animal bison out of your hand. But just before she could you presented it her, "Here! Enjoy it because I am never playing that thing again! EVER!"

Eska smirked, "I am pleased. Now you may be treated as how my boyfriend should be treated."

"Oh does that mean-"

"I may now order you around as I please. You have earned the right to be my boyfriend.", she said.

"Sister I believe it is time for us to return to father."

"Agreed, as for you boyfriend I shall see you again tomorrow.", she walked away with her brother leaving him to carry all the prizes you won for her. She was controlling with a capital C. She might have been nice to look at but the person within proved she was a dark spirit! You went back to your tent prepared to get a good nights rest. However the things were only now beginning...
11513212221112211111.title: The TEST

115132122211122111111.content:
The following night the wind blew hard to where it could be heard as well as felt. You wrapped yourself in every extra layer of blanket you had in your bed and sealed yourself up. It was still too cold you felt. You knew it was only going to get worse so you wore your winter coat and tried to go to sleep but even then you couldn't sleep. Now you heard howling from outside, Korra's polarbear dog was waking everyone who had gone to sleep. At this point you decided you couldn't take it anymore and went outside to shut it up. Just as soon as you went to vent out your frustration you saw the others staring out to the festival. You turned your head to know what was going on, to your shock it was a dark spirit.

You were terrified. You knew in full the cruelty of the spirits and knew that whatever it wanted it wouldn't rest until it got what it came for. The spirit zoomed fast in the blink of an eye and dove at Korra. Mako and Bolin went to help her while you followed. The spirit tried to eat her whole but Bolin lifted the earth under the spirits' footing, then you and Mako combined your fire and blasted it mid-air. The spirit was knocked down, then Tonraq surrounded it in ice. "I think we got it!", Bolin said.

"Oh no we don't!", you replied.

Mako looked at you with a inquisitive look, soon after the dark spirit broke out and grabbed all four of you, throwing Tonraq, Mako, and Bolin. But it pulled you in starring into your very soul it felt. When Korra struck back with a gust of air, it threw you into the snow, you lost consciousness as you landed from the throw. When you finally came to, the dark spirit was gone. You got up to find that everyone was already going back to their tents. Meant that the spirit was gone and that everything was safe for now.

It wasn't easy for you, to learn that dark spirits were around meant a great deal of trouble and pain. You never told anyone but you had some bad blood between your family and the spirits. And you knew they haven't forgotten as evident by that spirit singling you out. Mako paused to see you enter your tent. He noticed something relating to you and the dark spirit. You were too paranoid that you didn't notice and just tried getting back to bed.
115132122211122111111.title: The Spirits remember

1151321222111221111111.content:
Korra was now starting her training with Unalaq, and the first step was going to the south pole. Of course after last night you though it best to remain in the southern tribe. "Hey (Name) were going to the south pole. This guy called Varrick, a business friend of Asami's, he's fixing me with some state of the art gear! Said to meet him by his yacht. I could put in a good word for you."

"I'll pass. Spirits and me don't mix.", soon as you said that Bolin stepped aside for none other than Eska and Desna.

"Boyfriend, we are journeying to the south."

"I know I told Bolin-", she grabbed you by the collar and dragged you along, literally, on her arctic camel. Hogtied by your wrists on the saddle you knew that this wasn't going to be a fun trip. "I guess I changed my mind.", you replied to Bolin.

A few hours later you all started marching to the south pole, Bolin everyone except Bolin rode on their arctic camel, with him riding in a single cared snow speeder. As everyone headed there you thought to try and polity ask your 'girlfriend' to let her remove the knot. "Uh say Eska could I move my wrists now? I promise not to run, since I won't last on my own."

"It stays until we make camp. Don't ask again.", she coldly and quickly replied.

"Desna back me up please."

"Don't involve me with your lover quarrels I am not the person for this sort of thing.", he said.

"Well at least we could talk about...uhhhh.....the sky. And how it makes you feel. Maybe start some conversation?", you thought by maybe getting either of them to like you while you tried to act more friendly to them they would cut the rope.

"I never look at the sky. It is empty as is most of the world.", Eska answered.

"I looked at it once. I liked how the stars covered the darkness. But it bored me so I never looked at it again.", Desna answered.

"Well that is interesting. Tell me what interests you guys?"

"Boyfriend I would like to ask you something.", she said.

"Really?! Uh I mean what Eska?", you got excited that maybe you got through to her in some way.

"Have you considered your attempts to try and change my mind about keeping you tied up are feeble?", she asked having a snarky tone.

You frowned and turned away from her in frustration. Eska chuckled finding your reaction amusing, and thought you looked cute when you were angry.
1151321222111221111111.title: Journey to the South Pole

11513212221112211111111.content:
It was starting to get darker and colder the further you pushed on. But now things were getting worse when it dawned on everyone they were being followed by dark spirits. Your strained relationship with them because of your family made you urge the idea to make camp for the night, to which Tonraq and Bolin agreed to. You all settled in a small shelter clear from the blistering winds. Finally feeling like the time is now to receive some much wanted rest you buckled down in every layer of blanket and coat you had and found a comforting spot to lay close to the fire. After that you immediately dozed off, but later you heard faintly what seemed to be arguing by the fire. But you figured if it wasn't involved with you it wasn't your place to say anything. A bit afterward though you were woken up by a hard poke on your shoulder, as you expected, Eska.

"It would be better to sleep in our sleeping bags.", she said.

"Thanks for the suggestion but I'm really ok with where I'm sleeping now."

"Very well. We will sleep in front of you so that we are not far.", she answered.

"Well wait....uh? Nevermind it was a dumb idea."

"Speak."

"Nothing."

"What? Answer me when I ask you something."

"Jeez I am really sick of you ordering me around! So I won't say.", you lower your hood in defiance shrugging your arms. And Eska responded with tugging it back and grabbing you by the collar.

"I find your words of defiance very unwise and hurtful. I would seek an apology if I valued my life out here."

"I'm still I fire bender and I can last long to walk all the way back. Heh find them hurtful I think that may be the first time you said you felt something."

Desna raised his arm and in the snow formed an icicle defending his sister. "I'd advise you to not speak ill of my sister or else I will have to kill you for her."

"Desna. Do not treat him rudely, I enjoy his honesty.", Desna backed off. The twins got into their bags and were ready to sleep. But Eska still felt curious about what you meant to say to her. "(Name)?", she asked more softly opposed to her monotone attitude.

"What?", you replied still angry but with less of it in direction to her.

"I wanted to know what you were going to say."

"It was nothing."

"I will be the judge."

You decided to humor her and say it, "If you wanted to you could sleep next to me if you wanted to keep me safer from the dark spirits."

Eska paused momentarily, "You were right.", she turned away and went to sleep as did you and the others. However later that night Eska woke up groggily finding the cold to be very harsh. She turned to you where you were cold, the fire gone, the heatsource wasn't enough to keep you from freezing to death. Eska looked at her brother, but knew you need some level of warmth. So she quietly got out of her bag and right beside you slept next to you. She wrapped her arm around your waist, but did it like she didn't know if it was the right way being done. Eska thought to herself, "This one is doing something that I am sure I want happen to me.

Soon the sun cracked over the ice, and was time to move.....
11513212221112211111111.title: Cold night

115132122211122111111111.content:
The following morning you woke up to a surprising feeling around your back, Eska's arm wrapped alongside you. "She actually did it?! I only meant it as a joke, but last night it got more tense than it needed to. She's crazy! Still there is something about her that's sincere.", Eska began to wake up. She got up and stretched out her arms yawning, but nonchalantly packed up her essentials and didn't bother greeting you with a good morning. You were puzzled by it but assumed it was among the list of eccentricities she had among people. You followed suit along with Desna and the others and in no time got back to heading to the South Pole.

Hours had passed with the group crossing through an endless wind of snow. The sky was getting darker indicating you have spent the whole day trekking through the arctic storm. But things began getting worse...

"We have to keep moving.'', Unalaq said. The storm began getting more intense even for a water bender to handle.

'Oh man I don't like this.", Bolin said cowering over the thought of dark spirits.

"Bolin calm down there's no reason to-", suddenly a dark spirit popped out of the snow, "PANIC!"

The dark spirits tore through the supplies everyone had and knocking everybody off their mounts. One managed to get you but Eska and Desna jumped out of the way in time. The dark spirit got right in your face and suddenly its neck began to pulse rapidly like a rattle snake tail. It's neck began to expand until the twins shot a blast of water at it freeing you from its grasp. "Thanks!"

They didn't reply back but instead chose to focus on the battle. Another one came lunging at you but this time you were ready. You fired a couple of slashes of fire against it managing to land a hit on it. With that the rest either retreated or were dealt with by the others. Leaving you all in a precarious position. Without your supplies you needed to go back. You didn't know what to do so you went along with whatever was best for the mission.

Eventually you all managed to make it to the south pole where at the center was a forest covered entirely in ice. "Whew, I'd never want to go on a camping trip in there.", you joked.

"Hehe!", Bolin laughed. Everyone kinda starred at the both of you at the thought of how you seemed to not be taking this matter seriously. "What it was funny.", Bolin said.

"Inside that forest is the portal to the spirit world. From there Korra, you must go alone.", Unalaq explained.

"Hold on were not going without her.", Mako replied.

"Yeah if she goes we go too!", Bolin followed.

"And I'm here for moral support so I say that they go with her as well!", you interjected.

"The Avatar must go alone.", Unalaq insisted. With reluctance from Korra and Bolin and Mako she went in thanks to Unalaq's encouragement. It felt quite nerve-racking as you were worried things would go south. (pun not intended I swear!)

"I hope she'll be ok.", you said.

"Yeah me too. I mean every time she risks her neck by herself it never gets any easier.", Bolin replied.

Then suddenly a large beam of light shot upward into the sky. You had no idea what it was but the sheer sight of it was breath taking.

Out of all the awe from the portal Korra managed to come out of it fine. "Hey Korra's back!", you yelled in excitement. Then you felt a block of ice forming around you and you were moved right in front of Eska. "Why are showing emotional interest in another woman?!", she said with a sneer yet her face remained the same blank look as always. You didn't say anything as you feared whatever answer you gave would infuriate her more.
115132122211122111111111.title: The Southern Portal

1151321222111221111111111.content:
By the time you made it back things got a whole lot worse than what everyone expected. The Northern Water Tribe had occupied the South and it seemed more like an invasion rather than an occupation. It only made things between you and Eska only more complicated with you being "together" with the person marching in on the Avatar's home.

Meanwhile as things throughout the tribe was growing more tense you and Bolin were getting into a heated argument.

"(Name) I for one don't get it.", Bolin reacted.

"What's to get exactly? It makes sense to me.", you replied.

"I think you are being brainwashed by your girlfriend bud. And I can't in good faith let that happen."

"Since when did she get roped into the discussion?"

"Hello! Your taking the side of the guy who is causing a lot of tension around here. Might you reconsider your tastes?"

"Absolutely not! The food here beats the water tribe food they make in Republic City I've been there 15 times and I'm telling you this place beats it!"

"But were both city boys! Why can't you play for the home team?"

"Bolin, Eska isn't even here to boss me around, this is coming from me."

"Ugh. Jeez this can't be any worse. So you were saying Korra?", Bolin said finishing your discussion.

"Well what else can I say. I'm trying to maintain balance here but nobody is going along with the program.", Korra replied with much frustration emanating from her.

"Korra stuff like this ticks everyone off. But the fact that everything has come to a total halt because your uncle moved in, makes me beg the question why?"

"Because he's trying to bring balance to the Water Tribe. So the dark spirits stop attacking.", she tried to explain.

"Hate to instigate more conflict but his idea of balance is absolute stupidity.", you said.

"Do you truly believe your gravely mistaken perspective of my father boyfriend?", in just one moment you went from your usual blunt and honest self, to calculate every response so she doesn't freeze me mode. You turned to see Eska and Desna together, they sat right next to you forcefully, squeezing Bolin a bit.

"No of course not. I was being hypothetical.", you replied.

"Good. If you have any intention on making this work, you will love my family whether you really do or not. Frankly I almost laughed at that remark. Nobody would be so ignorant to blatantly call my father such descriptions."

“I detest his ignorance. But I find the interactions from you two very entertaining.”

“It’s ok Desna, he will grow to become more dignified and intellectual.”

“I happen to be very intelligent in terms of emotional intelligence.”, you stated.

“Interesting. What am I feeling now?”, Eska asked you.

Eska stared at you, almost as if she was gazing into your very soul. She had the same cold face she gave nearly all the time. You grew increasingly nervous and awkward at this whole thing, but you still tried anyway.

“You’re feeling like you should get some food since were sitting at a dinner table.”, you said it as if you were certain but you were hiding it as a total shot in the dark.

“Hmm. I think I just grew a tiny bit more tolerating of his faults. Stay here boyfriend we will return.”, Eska replied.

“Whoa. You really can read peoples feelings. So tell me what am I feeling?’’, Bolin asked.

“You want to leave with Korra?”, you guessed.

“Yeah, except I think she already left.”, the two of you turned to notice Korra’s seat was empty. “I was going to leave too except scooching over those two made me feel like a fourth wheel.”

“Who’s the third?”

“Desna right?”

“I honestly believe he’s part of the other wheel.”

With that Bolin left and Eska and Desna returned with some food. You stood still not sure what to say or do next. “Were you expecting us to provide you with your own meal?”, Eska asked.

“Nope, already ate.”

“Good. So I hope you have money left over for our meal.”

“Heh?”

“Isn’t it customary for the man to provide the finances for the date?”, she replied.

You groaned internally and luckily had just enough to pay for the meal. Though you were now officially broke until you got back home.

You still sat next to Eska and figured trying to continue to make conversation might lighten things. “So how do you feel about this whole North coming into the South business?”

“Political affairs are boring. I refuse to discuss them with you while I am eating.”, Eska replied.

“Wonderful. Soooo what about your cousin?”

“I don’t like her.”, the twins both answered.

“Why’s that?”

“It is not your concern.”, they said.
1151321222111221111111111.title: Continue...

11513212221112211111111111.content:
The next day you met up with Mako, Bolin, and Asami. With all of the drama occurring around the South it was a safe idea to hang around with them.

“Sooooo hiding from your girlfriend?”, Bolin asked.

“Can we talk something other than my girl problems? Or if we are, why not go on with Mako’s?”

“Hey don’t drag me in on that!”, he glared.

“Sorry.”

“Well if you’ve been unhappy with her, why not just break up with her?”, Mako suggested.

“She’s possessive, crazy, very dead-pan, not conversational much, and I feel the occasional danger she will try to murder me.”, you replied.

“So do it then.”

“Nah, I’m staying with her.”, you answered back.

“Ok did you get conked on the head this morning?”

“It’s not the looks that are selling me.”, you said reassuringly though neither Bolin nor Mako felt convinced.

“That’s not what we mean. Any one of those problems is worth breaking up.”, Mako explained.

“Yeah but the pros weight enough to balance the cons. She’s insightful and blunt, a strong bender, sweet though coming off as deadpan, has a wonderful sense of humor, and yes she looks very pretty. That’s five things for each scale.”

“Maybe we need to give you an intervention.”, Bolin thought.

Just then Eska and Desna entered the room with a group of Water Tribe soldiers. “Hey Eska.”

“Boyfriend. Have you seen Varrick?”

“No. I don’t even know who he is.”

“That’s fine. We shall meet tonight regarding our plans.”

“We meeting up for dinner or strictly a get together?”

“Get together. But I am open to you providing the meal.”

“Sure thing. Btw, why are you looking for this guy?”

“Varrick is responsible for trying to assassinate our father. He is a traitor to the water tribe.”, Desna informed.

“Our cousin Korra’s parents were arrested earlier this morning for high treason.”, Eska followed up with.

“Wait what?!”, you and the bending brothers reacted.

“It seems he is not here.”, Desna realized as their escort searched the room finding no sign of their target.

“Very well, we will continue our search elsewhere. Boyfriend, bow to me when I exit.”, Eska ordered you.

“My doctor said I can’t bend my legs like that for six days.”, you explained.

“Fine. But we will discuss this behavior tonight.”, she said leaving.

“Don’t let her treat you like that.”, Mako said still grasping why you were even considering being with her at all.

“If I’m convinced she won’t improve then I’ll consider breaking up with her. Trust me I have no interest in that stuff either.”

"(Name) let me make this clear and simple. She is not for you. You two make a horrible couple. She in no way makes a good partner for a relationship, break-up with her as soon as you can."

"So I get the feeling you don't approve?", you replied.

Mako and Bolin simply face palmed very hard to the point they just fell to the ground with utter groaning.

1151322211111.content:
It was a normal day in Peach Creek. All of the kids were having fun enjoying the day. You were new to the area and had seen them playing in the cul de sac. You went outside to join them hoping to make some new friends.

"Check it out, new dude in town.", a punk kid with a hat called out.

"Hi, I'm (Name).", you introduced.

"Names Kevin. The blond is Nazz, red head Sarah and her friend Jimmy, and the guy with the plank is Johnny and the plank is literally named Plank."

"Nice to meet everyone.", you said politely.

"Uhh, not everyone. There are these three dorks called the Ed's. They all have the same name just spelled differently. I'd stay away from those dorks at all costs.", he warned.

"That's all of the general residents?"

"Well, the dorks are harmless for the most part. But wherever you go, stay away from the trailer park. And especially, avoid-"

"THE KANKERS!", you heard people screaming coming from the woods. Three guys were running for their lives when they ran past everyone. You turned to see what they were running from, three girls. One with red curly hair that covered her eyes, another with blonde hair with buck teeth, and lastly a brunette with a goth look.

"Dude follow our lead and- RUN FOR IT!", everyone in the cul de sac ran straight into their homes or making a b-line away from them. You didn't know what all the fuss was about. After all they were just girls, they weren't going to be evil. Sure they looked tough but nothing is set and stone from appearances.

"Hello.", you waved to them.

The girls stopped in their tracks noticing your friendly gesture. "Well what have we here girls? A new face in town. And cute one at that.", the red head acknowledged.

"Dawwww! He looks sooooooo adorable! Can we keep him for a while?", the blonde girl pinched your cheek and moved it around very violently. You pushed her hand away leaving you to rub off some of the pain she caused.

"Hehehe. Well I am game to give him a try. I vote we take him home.", the brunette agreed.

"I second that. So kid, how would you like to spend some quality time with some lovely ladies?", the red head asked.

You thought they looked kind of cute but lovely stretched it a little. But you thought since they were extending to invite you over, maybe they wanted to hang out. No harm in that. "Uhh sure."

The girls giggled all the way back to their home. The other kids watched in horror too afraid to warn you, but it was too late. A couple minutes passed and you entered their trailer home. "Huh nice place.", you complimented.

"Thanks.", the red head replied giving a pat on the back so strong it sent you slamming into the wall.

"Ohhhhhh...", you said letting out a painful moan. "That hurt."

"Oh don't mind our sister, she loves to rough house. Anyway I'm Marie.", the brunette introduced herself.

"I'm May!", the blonde one followed, leaving the red head to introduce herself last.

"And I'm Lee. Were the Kanker Sisters."

"Ugh, so what we you planning we do for fun? I'm new so is there something around that is cool to see or do around?", you asked.

"Gnehehehehhehehe. Oh we have plenty of ways to entertain our guests.", the other girls giggled again. You didn't pay much thought since girls giggle all the time. They were thinking about weird stuff that you wouldn't understand maybe, except you had yet to realize their laughter was coming from malicious intent.

"Tell me, what's your name?", Lee asked she said laying on the floor with her hands holding up her head in a relaxed position.

"(Name)."

"(Name) huh? Well then, how do you feel about cooties?", Lee asked.

"Oh that is just a myth. Dumb thing boys say to avoid girls."

"What about hugs from girls?", May asked.

"They aren't bad at all. If they're alright."

"Then how do you feel about, kissing?", Marie asked blinking rapidly at you. You felt a little nervous the way she looked at you.

"That! I think is something I would be happy to answer tomorrow, I just remembered I have to take out the trash. See ya!", you tried getting out of there, but May blocked the door.

"Aww don't go so soon. We haven't started having fun. And I think the fun has just started. GIRLS! Roundup our guest! Ehehehhehee!", the others surrounded you. You were terrified by what they were going to do. You shut your eyes wondering what they were planning. You felt them start to...
1151322211111.title: Plot 1

11513222111111.content:
"Huh?", you found yourself sitting on a chair in a basement with a single light on. The Kankers stood in front of you giggling what they would do with you. "WHat is going on?!"

"See we have a special kind of fun with everyone. We prefer the more touchy feely sort. The kind that requires a ton of lip on lip contact.", Lee explained.

"Ewww! You three only try to kiss people. Yuck!"

"Not ALL the time numbskull. And not everyone. We like to mess around with people when we feel like it. But smooching our boyfriends is our favorite. pass time."

"Wait you have boyfriends and want to kiss me?"

"They keep getting away from us. Which is why we try catching them all day.", May elaborated.

"So they aren't really your boyfriends? I'm starting to think saying hi to you three was a bad idea.", you commented.

"Oh don't feel bad. Chivalry never goes unrewarded, were planning to reward it, very very generously.", Marie said rubbing her finger on your chin.

"You're all nuts!"

"Maybe, but were not the one tied up right now. Ok (Name). We have a game we like to play I know you have heard of. Spin the bottle."

You tried wiggling out of the chair but it was no use. They placed the bottle under your chair and spun it, "Rules for this are simple, who ever it lands on gets the first smooch. Pucker up."

You couldn't see who it was landing on. All you did see was the trio putting on some makeup and lipstick over their lips. They were ready for action. You sat and wondered who would be your first kiss.
11513222111111.title: Tie you up

1151322211111121.content:
Finally you heard the bottle stop and the one looking most excited was May. "WOHOOO! I GET FIRST DIBS!", she yelled very happily.

Out of the three you were hoping she would be picked first the least. She sat on your lap dabbing a little more lipstick before finally getting ready to seal the deal. "I'd start making like a fish now. Mmwah! Mmwah! Mmwha!"

Her breath smelled like she hadn't brushed since the last two days which made it hard to like. You leaned back trying to avoid her lips. But Lee held the chair in place so you wouldn't tip over and had her other hand locking your head in place. No escape. May kept doing that loud kissing sound all the way toward you, it was like a ticking time bomb. Her last one held on the "mmm" sound as if to let you savor your last moments of freedom. Finally May's lips touched your own. Her strong forceful press made this feel weird. It felt hot, ticklish, sticky, a tad tight on the mouth. May wrapped her arms over your neck holding in your first kiss. The entire time she almost seemed to try making her loud noises audible through the kiss. As if to let everyone know she was liking it.

For a solid 20 seconds she held it in until she ended it with a loud pop after squeezing your lips together like popping a zit. Gross. "Bleeeehhhh! That was gross."

"Not over yet! Our rules say I have 40 extra seconds."

So they could kiss you for a full minute? What is wrong with them?! Now May started giving your shorter but still hard kisses all over your face. Continuing with her annoying sounds and sloppy kisses. This happened for the remaining minute. Now only 2 left.

You're name is Joseph. You're a 18 year old young man that has a huge reputation in Beverly Hills High School. You're a top student with good grades and has made the honor roll. You're also a master martial artist when you're at home after school. You've been training ever since you were 8 years old. Now, you go into school to start off a new day. Today is Friday, meaning that you've got another weekend coming up. You go in to get to class. You made a turn and you bumped into someone and knocking their stuff down.

"Oh man! I'm sorry! I didn't see you." You said.

"That's fine. I wasn't looking myself." A female voice said.

"Here. Let me help." You said as you bend down to get her stuff.

"Thank you." The girl said.

As you give her her books, you blushed and you're heart starts pounding fast as you see a girl with green emerald eyes and long red hair. You recognized her as Samantha Simpson, the smartest girl in school. You always admire Sam for her brains and other talents. But among other things, you also like her for her kindness and selflessness. You would see her with her friends, Clover and Alex, but you never got the chance to meet her. Until now, that is. You get up and hand her her stuff.

"Thanks. You're a real gentleman." Sam said.

"No problem, Sam." You said.

"How do you know my name?" Sam asked in surprise.

"I've seen you here a couple of times. Though, I never got a chance to say hello." You said.

Sam then leans in and examines you.

"Hey, I think I know you too. You're Joseph, right? You're one of the top 5 male students here." Sam said.

"Yep. That's me." You said.

"Wow. I must say, you look better up close in person." Sam said.

"I can say the same about you." You said.

Sam blushed and giggled at your comment and the bell rung.

"Looks like I have to go. It was nice meeting you." You said.

"Me too. Say, how about we hang out at lunch together? If you want." Sam asked.

"I would like that. See ya, Sam." You said before leaving.

"Bye, Joseph." Sam said as she goes off to tell Clover and Alex about you.
115132222211.title: Seeing Red

1151322222111.content:
Lunchtime finally came and you go down to the Cafeteria to get some food. You get your meal and you turned to see Sam with Clover and Alex at their table. Sam notices you and she waves at you.

"Joseph!" Sam said.

"Hey, Sam! How are you doing so far?" You said.

"Great!"Sam said.

"So wait. This is the Joseph you mentioned before?" Clover wondered.

"The very same!" Sam said.

"Well, he does look interesting." Alex said.

"Interesting isn't the word I would describe him. Sammy, I think you just hit the mother load." Clover said.

"Clover!" Sam blushed as she knows that Clover is teasing her while you just chuckled.

"She's just kidding around, Sammy." Ales said.

"She's right. I'm sure she's just pushing you buttons. Anyway, mind if I join you girls?" You asked nicely.

"Sure. Come and sit with us." Alex said.

You sit with the girls and you had made funny conversations while you eat with them. You were gonna start another one until someone stopped that.

"Look who it is. The three little ugly pigs. Did you losers finally decided to get a sense of looks?" A girl said meanly.

"Ha ha. You're so not funny, Clover." Mandy said.

You never liked Mandy to begin with because she's a spoiled, loudmoth, selfish, egotistic, evil bully who wants things to always go her way. You always thought that her big mouth will get her into big trouble and maybe the death of her one day, but she'll never learn. Mandy turns to see you and she has a wicked smirk on her face.

"Hello there. You seem like a big boy, aren't you? Why don't you leave the loser train and come hop on the royal express?" Mandy said as if she's trying to bribe you.

The girls don't like that too much, Sam mostly. She tightens her fist so hard that she'll break Mandy's face if she wanted to. Before Sam could do anything about this,

To me, you're nothing but another loudmouth, egotistic, spoiled brat. You asked that you want me to hop on the 'royal express'? Well, you can take my ticket and shove it. Now, get out." You demanded.

Mandy was fuming and she left in a fit of rage. The girls were really happy that some guy told her to take a hike. She needs to be taught a lesson every now and then. You calmed down and sit back down.

"Wow! I never seem a guy flip Mandy off like that before." Alex said.

"I'll say. You are one if a kind, Joseph." Clover said.

"Thanks. I swear, that ego of hers is gonna get her into big trouble." You said.

"Well, let's just-huh?" Sam stopped.

The tables appeared to open on it's own and you got sucked in with the girls
1151322222111.title: At the Cafeteria

11513222221111.content:
As you and the girls go down the weird tube slide, you have a lot of questions on what in the world is going on here. You made it to the bottom of the slide and landed on a couch. The girls followed you and landed right on top of you. You turned to see a old man wearing an old fashion black and white suit.

"Hello, Girls." The man said.

"Another mission, Jerry?" Clover asked.

"Indeed. Reports coming in that a strange machine is making people vanish into thin air. I want you three to check it out and find the source of the problem." Jerry ordered.

"You got it, Jer." Alex said.

"Uh, Girls. Would you mind getting off?" You asked.

"Oh! Sorry, Joseph." Sam said.

The girls get off of you and you faced the man they called Jerry.

"Care to explain all of this?" You asked.

"Oh my. Looks like we have a new one. Very well. You're in the World Organization of Human Protection, or W.O.O.H.P. for short." Jerry explained.

"You mean to tell me that you three are spies?" You wondered.

"Yep." Alex said.

"We've been doing this for quite a while now. Sorry for dragging you into this." Sam apologized.

"No problem. I'll just be on my way now." You said.

"Wait! Maybe you can join our team." Sam suggested.

info.description:
Alright, so this story is meant for anyone looking for an actual story and less of a simple pornography in writing form. This is more about the story than the actual adult content; meant to embrace and pull readers into the story with their favorite characters rather than throwing them into bed for no readily apparent reason.

In fact, even if you do this, you should realize that you can't show it *points to PG-13 rating*. Now, hugs, kisses, cuddling, everything like that I will be including and is, of course, perfectly acceptable. Not much of a romance if there isn't some heartfelt touching going on is there? The same don't over do it rules apply, not as much though since this isn't a big deal at all.

And finally, here are some basic rules:
-Put your chapters in the appropriate section.
-Do not disobey the choices from the previous chapter. If you don't like them, maybe you should've written that chapter.
-Keep the chapters a decent length. Minimum 2 paragraphs, aside from the ones that simply involve making a choice as to what character/world/etc... at the very beginning.
-Use grammar for god's sake. Poor quality additions will be deleted without a second thought. Seriously. Its called SPELL CHECK.
-No fetishes in this one. This means NO: *Feet fetish *Fart fetish *Feces fetish *Fish fetish (Okay, now I'm just making up more F-word fetishes. Let's move on)
-Unless it fits in the world the characters are from (obviously) you cannot gain supernatural powers. For example, don't pick a character from, say, Star Fox and start flying around like you're from Dragonball Z. That aside, the stories would be semi-dull and very cliche if you were a damsel in distress the entire way through the story so... don't be afraid to have the reader actually, you know, do things.

Okay, that should be about it. Follow those rules and we'll have no problems. As a side note, if you find a chapter that violates one of these rules, tell me and I'll be sure to get on it right away.

UPDATE 9/13/14

I'm back bitches. That is all. I'd say more, but words mean nothing after years of absence. I'll simply say these three things:

-New chapters are about to surge all over this thing over the coming weeks
-The culling of poorly-written chapters begins now
-This thing is gonna be the best story on Writing.com before I'm done.
